title: Product Designer
description:
**Ready for a new challenge? Here is what we offer.**
**Team spirit, built upon trust & ownership. Together, we decide how to win.**
 We trust each other and take great ownership in what we do. We respect the individual, assume the best in others and believe in close collaboration and communication, within and outside the team.
   

  

**New challenges and personal growth.**
 We live by our entrepreneurial spirit, this means taking risks, identifying opportunities and always seeking new solutions. Do you have ideas how we can scale even faster? Bring them on!
   

  

**A passionate and fun culture.**
 We are passionate about our work and believe that having lots of fun is essential for both creativity and success. Welcome to a diverse and inclusive workplace, with a lot of fun and exciting activities going on- including Health Month, inspirational sessions, team activities, company trips and board game nights.
   

  

**A stable and global industry-leader based in Stockholm, expanding and scaling to new markets!**
 We’re in a great position to drive success and seize new opportunities, our international customer base is constantly growing and so is our product. With the support of our new owners, we are making moves to expand into new markets, setting a clear course for growth in 2025.
   

  

**🦋 Are you + Bannerflow = true?**
**Role**
 As a Product Designer, you’ll play a pivotal role in turning product innovation into intuitive user experiences that address customer pain points while aligning with our business objectives. With the freedom to shape the experience for some of the world’s most renowned brands, you’ll contribute to accelerating their online marketing success. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Drive design direction by ensuring users are at the core of every decision, leveraging user research and data insights to prioritize needs and deliver impactful solutions.
* Deeply understand our business model, ensuring design decisions align with and enhance broader objectives.
* Work closely with tech, product, and other stakeholders to solve complex UX and UI challenges. Support implementation by providing developers with clear, detailed design specifications to ensure a seamless translation of your vision into the final product.
* Share your vision through high-quality concepts and prototypes, knowing when to focus on pixel-perfect details and when low-fidelity sketches are sufficient.
* Feature optimization and establish routines for tracking and refining implemented solutions.
* We welcome you to challenge the status quo, by identifying opportunities to enhance processes and promote efficient ways of working.


**So, what are we looking for?**
* 4+ years of experience as a Product Designer, balancing user needs with business goals and hands-on experience in user research.
* You feel comfortable using your toolbox of design methodologies, have an interest in industry trends and best practices to enhance our products and processes.
* Excellent communication skills, both in presenting ideas and giving/receiving feedback.
* You have a problem-solving and commercial mindset who thrives in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.
* A strong portfolio showcasing user-focused designs.
* It’s a bonus if you have experience designing products for B2B/SaaS, or even more relevant, within the digital advertising landscape.


**Why join us? 🤔**
 At Bannerflow, we live by our values of passion, collaboration, and challenge. As an Product Designer, you’ll help us continue to revolutionize the Ad Tech industry through cutting-edge technology and product excellence. You’ll also get to enjoy our fun and engaging culture with activities like padel tournaments, webinars, Friday beers, and Level-up Hackathons.
   

  

 We offer a hybrid workplace and a competitive compensation package including pension according to ITP1, health allowance, parental leave top-up, and health care insurance. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team and welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities.
   

  

 If you’re passionate about bringing great tech products to market and being involved in growing a booming business to levels never before witnessed, send in your application. We want you on the team!

title: Design System Designer
description:
EasyPark’s Design System Team mission is to empower teams across EasyPark to create seamless, consistent, and delightful digital experiences through Rally, our multi-platform design system. We are committed to ensuring accessibility, inclusivity, and innovation in every aspect of our design system, enabling EasyPark to deliver exceptional user experiences at scale.
 



 Our goal is to provide a unified foundation that streamlines the design and development process, ensures brand consistency, and enhances the usability of EasyPark's digital products.
 







 Product design is essential in reaching our goal. Our design team, currently consisting of +25 members, also aspires to broaden EasyPark's offerings into new markets. This presents significant potential to improve user experience and contribute to substantial business impact.
 



 The broader R&D organization includes a genuinely diverse and distributed team of over 450 talented specialists in product, engineering, design, and analytics; located across Stockholm, Amsterdam, Basingstoke, Tallinn, Atlanta and more.
   





**What you’ll be doing** 




 As a Design System Designer at EasyPark, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping Rally, our multi-platform design system. You will craft and maintain a comprehensive set of UX and visual guidelines, ensuring consistency and accessibility across all digital products. Collaborating closely with designers, developers, and product managers, you’ll create reusable UI components and design patterns that meet stakeholder needs and elevate the user experience. Your role involves documenting best practices, design standards, and usage guidelines, while also conducting design reviews to ensure proper implementation of Rally. Staying ahead of industry trends, you’ll integrate best practices into the system and champion the creation of accessible, inclusive, and innovative design solutions.
 



**Key Responsibilities** 



* Develop and maintain UX and visual guidelines for all digital products, continuously improving Rally Design System.
* Create reusable UI components and design patterns for use across platforms.
* Collaborate with designers, developers, and product managers to align the design system with stakeholder needs.
* Document design standards, best practices, and usage guidelines for Rally.
* Ensure all design system components are accessible and inclusive.
* Conduct design reviews and provide guidance for implementing the design system.
* Stay updated on industry trends and integrate best practices into the design system.



**What you’ll bring to the team** 



* Strong visual design skills with keen attention to detail.
* Proficiency in tools like Figma, Sketch, and Adobe Creative Suite.
* Basic knowledge of front-end development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript).
* Understanding of design principles, typography, color theory, and layout.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Systematic thinking with the ability to solve complex design challenges.
* Experience with version control systems like Git.
* Familiarity with design tokens and their implementation.



**Life at EasyPark** 




 We are a values-driven company with an international culture and a global presence. By providing an environment with space to grow and room for autonomy, we believe in encouraging and supporting our team members to take initiatives and act outside of their comfort zone. To have an open mind and embracing change is a part of our DNA. At EasyPark we are dedicated to maintaining an open culture where the voice of each person is heard, and we play as one team across the globe. Diversity is something we celebrate and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone.

title: Marketing Designer
description:
**About Magma**
 Magma is a startup that has quickly grown to become the leading platform for data-driven math education. By leveraging handwritten solutions in a digital format, Magma allows teachers to place emphasis on creativity in math, while gaining key insights into student progression. This creates a more engaging, inclusive and pedagogical math class for all students.
   

  

 Math remains the largest challenge for schools, where one in five students in year 9 are low performers. Math is one of the core pillars on which careers are built, and we believe that school math represents one of the largest opportunities at improving educational outcomes and career prospects for children and young adults.
   

  

 Magma is now growing rapidly across Europe and the US. We are an ambitious team on a meaningful mission of improving math education for millions of children. This position is based out of the Stockholm office but will report to the VP of Marketing in the US.
   

  

 ‍
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Designer on the Marketing team, your main responsibilities will be:
   

  

* Creating all graphic design assets for the Marketing team’s campaigns and projects
* Leading the evolution of our company website and the visitor journey
* Driving the company’s visual identity and brand
* Proactively aligning go-to-market team visual assets to the company’s mission and vision


 This is a fantastic opportunity to join early in a journey with a world-leading product, strong traction, and a supportive team in place.
   

  

 ‍
   

  

**Who You Are And What You Know**
 We serve a huge market with a relatively small team, meaning everything we do must make a difference. Therefore, we are looking for someone who is:
   

  

* Very ambitious and likes chasing challenging projects
* Strikes the right balance between quality and quantity
* Is very dynamic in terms of what is worked on and open to quickly changing depending on the broader needs of the organization
* Familiar with aspects of digital marketing, customer marketing, event marketing, and product marketing
* Experience creating and developing brand guidelines and templates
* Comfortable editing videos for social and marketing purposes
* Desire to work in a startup environment


**Experience With The Below Systems**
* Webflow
* Figma
* Canva
* Vimeo
* Hubspot (preferred)‍‍


**What We Offer**
* Play a key role in an exciting journey. We are a young company with ambitious targets and meaningful goals
* Fantastic colleagues in a fun environment with great opportunities to learn
* Competitive remuneration - salary and bonus
* An opportunity to work on a meaningful mission and have an exceptional impact on education, society and how children learn math across the world‍


**Start** 
 : As soon as possible
   

  

**Location** 
 : Stockholm, Hantverkargatan 26

 **with previous iGaming experience** 
 (this is essential).
 



  





 This role would be suitable for either a Mid-level or more Senior candidate.
 



  





 The iGaming studio is a smaller company of around 20, where you will have a lot of creative freedom and be part of a talented and collaborative team.
 



  





**Essential Skills/Experience**

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.
   

  

 As a
 **Senior Product Designer** 
 , you’ll play a vital role in shaping experiences that profoundly impact people’s ability to communicate. Your design work will be centered around eye-tracking technology and will enable users to overcome barriers, fostering independence and inclusivity. If you're passionate about crafting thoughtful, accessible, and life-changing design solutions, we invite you to join us on this journey of empowerment and innovation
   

  

**In this role, you will for example:**
* Collaborate with product, engineering, and design teams to shape strategy, set success metrics, and design intuitive, user-friendly products.
* Develop and maintain a scalable design system with engineers.
* Lead discovery and alignment processes to ensure quality across teams and touchpoints.
* Translate customer insights into prototypes and polished designs through collaboration with researchers.
* Advocate for user-centric design to ensure usability and accessibility.
* Contribute to the growth of the Design team and its culture.


**What We're Looking For:**
* 6+ years of product design experience with desktop and web applications, working closely with product and engineering managers.
* A degree in HCI, Product Design, UX Design, or a related field.
* A strong portfolio showcasing design process and impact.
* High proficiency in Figma or similar tools, with experience in collaboration, facilitation, and design systems.
* Knowledge of accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG).


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Chief Technology Officer
description:
**CTO/Tech Lead for FemTech Startup MeWe&You® – Be Part of Our Journey!** 




  





**Flexible Hybrid – Work from Anywhere in Sweden** 
 🇸🇪, with the possibility to work from our Stockholm office occasionally 📍
 



  





**Part-time Role** 
 – Approximately two days per week to start, with the flexibility to combine with other consultancy work, as long as it doesn’t involve competing businesses.
 



  





**Equity-based Remuneration (to start)** 
 – This means compensation will primarily be in the form of equity (ownership shares) until further funding is secured.
 



  





**Start: Immediate or as soon as possible** 




  





  





**About Us** 




  





 At
 **MeWe&You®** 
 , we are on a mission to revolutionize how women navigate peri/menopause. Over
 **1 billion women** 
 are in menopause today, and during the years leading up to it, many experience symptoms that disrupt their daily lives—with little to no support available.
 



  





 We are here to change that. Using advanced technology, our
 **app offers personalized solutions** 
 to match women with activities that reduce symptoms and improve well-being—at home, at work, and beyond, while also providing employers with tools to better support their workforce.
 



  





 This is an
 **incredibly exciting time** 
 for us: we have just launched our first version of the app on
 **App Store and Google Play!** 
 We are looking for a
 **CTO/Tech Lead** 
 to join us at this pivotal moment and shape the future of our platform and its impact on women globally.
 



  





  





**The Role** 




  





 As our new
 **CTO/Tech Lead** 
 , you’ll play a key role in bringing our vision to life. This is a
 **part-time position** 
 to start (approximately two days per week) with the flexibility to combine it with other consultancy work, as long as it doesn’t involve competing businesses.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  





 • Design, develop, and maintain robust, reliable, and scalable solutions using the latest technologies.
 



 • Collaborate with the CEO and team to transform user feedback and business objectives into actionable technical roadmaps.
 



 • Oversee external development partners and consultants.
 



 • Code and troubleshoot when necessary, driving technical innovation.
 



 • Stay updated on industry trends and best practices to improve the platform continuously.
 



  





**Your Profile** 




  





 We’re looking for someone who combines
 **technical expertise** 
 with a
 **passion for innovation and growth** 
 in an early-stage startup.
 



  





**Requirements:** 




  





 • Solid experience in full-stack software development, ideally including
 **Flutter** 
 for iOS and Android apps.
 



 • A strong foundation in
 **C#, .NET, and cloud platforms like Microsoft Azure** 
 .
 



 • Experience with
 **Rust** 
 or a strong willingness to work with Rust-based backend services.
 



 • Familiarity with tools like
 **Azure DevOps, Google Firebase, Crashlytics, and API technologies** 
 (e.g., REST, JSON, HTTPS).
 



 • Experience working in a
 **startup environment** 
 or similar, with the ability to adapt to a fast-paced and dynamic setting.
 



 • A
 **startup mindset** 
 , including a hands-on approach, resourcefulness, and a passion for building innovative solutions from the ground up.
 



 • A
 **user-centered approach** 
 to product development and an openness to
 **agile development practices** 
 .
 



 • Curiosity and enthusiasm for emerging technologies, such as
 **AI (machine learning, LLMs, AGIs and advanced UX design)** 
 .
 



 • A
 **collaborative mindset** 
 with a willingness to learn and explore new tech solutions.
 



 •
 **Fluent in English** 
 and proficiency in Swedish.
 



  





**Nice-to-Have:** 




  





 These are not dealbreakers, but they’ll give you an edge:
 



  





 • Prior experience as a
 **Tech Lead or CTO** 
 in a startup.
 



 • Passion for
 **women’s health and FemTech innovation** 
 .
 



 • Familiarity with
 **scaling apps** 
 in the early stages of a company.
 



 • Experience working in
 **cross-functional teams** 
 or with remote teams.
 



 • Interest in
 **building inclusive and sustainable technology solutions** 
 .
 



  





**Residency Requirements** 




  





 Applicants
 **must have the legal right to work in Sweden** 
 .
 



  





  





**Why Join Us?** 




  





 🌍
 **Impact:** 
 Be part of something transformative for women worldwide.
 



 💼
 **Ownership:** 
 Play a pivotal role in shaping our platform and future.
 



 🕒
 **Flexibility:** 
 Work hybrid, combining office time with the freedom to work from anywhere in Sweden.
 



 📈
 **Equity:** 
 This role offers
 **equity-based remuneration** 
 , giving you a stake in our success.
 



  





 If you share our
 **passion for improving women’s health and well-being** 
 , and you’re ready to
 **tackle big challenges** 
 with a
 **small but mighty team** 
 , we want to hear from you!
 



  





  





**How to Apply** 




  





 Apply via
 **LinkedIn** 
 with your resume.
 



 📧 Use the subject line:
 **“CTO/Tech Lead Application.”** 




  





 At
 **MeWe&You®** 
 , we are dedicated to
 **improving menopause health** 
 and fostering a
 **sustainable work life** 
 for all. We believe that
 **better well-being starts with inclusivity** 
 , and we welcome participation from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of
 **gender, age, ethnicity, ability, or identity** 
 .
 



  





 Together, we’re shaping a future where
 **everyone can thrive** 
 at work and in life.
 



  





 🔗
 **Learn more at** 
 www.meweandyou.com

title: Product Director
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world's #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities and more than 400 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.


**As the Product Director, Search at Truecaller** 
 , you will lead the strategy, development, and execution of the product roadmap for the team that powers our core search and identification capabilities. You will be responsible for ensuring Truecaller continues to deliver world-class caller ID, fraud detection, and spam prevention by leveraging cutting-edge AI, data science, and scalable backend services. This role is critical to our mission of making communication safer and more efficient for hundreds of millions of users worldwide. This role demands a deep understanding of data-intensive products, AI-driven insights, and proven experience leading product development for Android apps and high-availability backend services. You will collaborate closely with senior data scientists, backend and Android engineers, UX designers, and other product managers to drive innovation and enhance Truecaller's core functionalities.
   

  

 Reporting directly to the VP of Product, you will play a key role in aligning your team's strategy with Truecaller's overall product vision and business goals.
   

  

 The Search business unit encompasses multiple teams focused on caller identification, spam and fraud prevention, and data insights. You will oversee product development and ensure seamless alignment with Truecaller's broader vision.
   

  

**The impact you will create:**
* Define and champion the product strategy for Search, driving long-term growth and success.
* Lead the development of AI-driven innovations to enhance Truecaller's fraud detection, spam blocking, and caller identification capabilities.
* Ensure that search and caller identification services provide a seamless, fast, and accurate experience for hundreds of millions of users globally.
* Drive roadmap execution in close collaboration with data science, engineering, and design teams.
* Manage key Search KPIs, ensuring continuous improvement in accuracy, performance, and user experience.
* Build, mentor, and scale the team, ensuring we have the right mix of product managers, engineers, and data scientists to achieve our ambitious goals.


**What you bring in:**
* 10+ years of experience in product management, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role.
* Proven experience in AI-driven products, search technologies, or fraud/spam prevention.
* Strong background in data-intensive environments and experience working effectively with senior data scientists.
* Demonstrated success in leading cross-functional teams, including data science, backend engineering, Android development, and UX.
* Ability to define and articulate a compelling product vision while aligning with broader company objectives.
* Exceptional leadership skills with the ability to inspire, mentor, and develop high-performing teams.
* Solid understanding of AI, data pipelines, and backend architecture for high-availability services.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and stakeholder management skills, with experience collaborating across global teams.


**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What we offer:**
* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** 
 An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package** 
 : Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* **Office life:** 
 We strongly believe in the in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition every now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our own cinema or a Geek lunch. There something for everyone!


**Come as you are:**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc.
 **All those things make you who you are, and that's why we would love to meet you**

title: Senior Product Manager (Bangkok-based)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to know our team:**
 In Product, ideas come alive. The world is moving fast so our culture empowers ownership and minimal bureaucracy. That’s the environment that enables you to do what you think is right – and quickly. Our Product Managers move fast, fail, learn, and pivot.
   

  

 Being a product-centric organization, our team works cross-functionally to build products from conception to launch by bringing together engineering and business worlds. Agoda Product Managers work closely with executive leadership and have high visibility among the C-suite; they have direct impact on Agoda’s growth and strategy. Product puts our travelers first and delivers that special travel experience in the most creative expression.
   

  

**The opportunity:**
 This role is
 **BANGKOK-BASED, RELOCATION PROVIDED.** 
 Our Senior Product Managers are analytical and data-driven individuals, who’re responsible for building products end-to-end focusing on analyzing and experimenting until our solutions are perfectly tailored to our travelers. As our next Senior Product Manager, you will drive product strategy and partner closely with senior leadership cross-functionally to define, build, and deliver the best travel solutions.
   

  

 You will get dedicated engineering resources that you, and only you define and allocate. We expect you to have a hands-on mentality and spend considerable time with your SCRUM teams, have enthusiasm to develop engineered processes and technologies and apply innovative solutions to make organizational improvements. Product Managers can modify \*every\* system we have in our company to suit their needs.
   

  

 By applying to this role, you’ll be considered for a role either in User Experience, Marketing, Finance or Supply product vertical. The goal is to match you with the team that best aligns with your interests, competencies, and where you will have the most impact. We’re looking for Senior Product Managers for every part of our business. Our entire Product team sits in Bangkok. This is an Individual Contributor position.
   

  

**In this role, you’ll get to:**
* Analyze the online travel ecosystem, markets, competitive landscape and user requirements
* Conceptualize, launch and optimize products and features, experiment, test their performance and iterate quickly
* Work collaboratively with Engineering, Marketing, Legal and UX teams on cutting-edge technologies
* Develop innovative solutions to some of the world’s difficult problems by collaborating as needed across regions, product areas, and functions


**What you’ll need to succeed:**
* Bachelor’s degree in technical field (i.e. Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline)
* Proven ability to leverage analytics and quantitative methods to inform and influence decision-making
* Strong data skills
* Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English) with proven ability to convey complex messages clearly and with conviction to different stakeholders
* Experience developing and launching products
* Experience leading global product vision, go-to-market strategy and design discussions
* Entrepreneurial and analytical skills; effective at breaking down complex problems and driving and managing change
* Hands-on mentality


**It’s great if you have:**
* MBA or Master’s degree in Math, Economics, Computer Science or Statistics
* Data tools – SQL, Python, R, or equivalent


 #seattle #sanfrancisco #beijing #newyork #london #bangkok #singapore #chicago #hongkong #singapore #berlin #shanghai #losangeles #boston #austin #toronto #luxembourg #munich #oslo #copenhagen #stockholm #helsinki #brussels #hamburg #stuttgart #taipei #hamburg #stuttgart #dublin #telaviv #sydney #melbourne #perth #vancouver #montreal #prague #paris #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #amsterdam #moscow #saintpetersburg #frankfurt #shenzhen #istanbul #dubai #kiev #seoul
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
   

  

 To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Junior account manager/säljare till en startup
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:

 Är du social, älskar att prata med människor och vill tjäna extra pengar vid sidan av studierna? På Elliot Alpha söker vi nu en driven junior säljare som kan hjälpa oss att växa!
   

  

**Om Eliot Alpha**
 Eliot Alpha är en modern boendeplattform för bostadsrättsföreningar med fokus på kommunikation, trygghet och tillgänglighet. Vår plattform syftar till att förenkla styrelsearbetet, förbättra boendekommunikationen och stärka gemenskapen mellan boende.
   

  

 Med Eliot Alpha får ni en helhetslösning som är modern, prisvänlig och enkel att använda.
   

  

**Som Junior Säljare Kommer Du Att**

* Bygga kundrelationer och bidra till en högre konverteringsgrad.


**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Har driv och gillar att skapa nya kontakter.
* Är bekväm med att prata i telefon.
* Är flytande i svenska och bra på engelska.
* Studerar eller vill arbeta deltid.
* Är strukturerad, uthållig och målinriktad.


**Varför Elliot Alpha?**

**Vad Vi Er Bjuder**
* Påverka ett växande techbolag.
* Ut bildning och stöd i rollen.
* Positiv arbetsmiljö med fokus på framgång och gemenskap.


**Ansök idag och kickstarta din karriär inom säljyrket!**
 VNTRS is a venture studio that helps entrepreneurs and large corporations to build innovative digital products and services. In some cases we invest part of our fee in exchange for equity, so-called sweat equity investments.
   

  

 Our team consists of software developers, UI/UX designers, product and project managers, brand experts, and growth specialists.

title: Technology Solution Architect inom Financial Services
description:
Enheten
 **Financial Services** 
 är en del av en global organisation inom Capgemini vilket innebär att vi arbetar med kunder i Sverige men också i andra länder i Europa. I Stockholm består vårt team av drivna kollegor med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter och vi arbetar med de största bank- och försäkringsbolagen. Du kommer erbjudas möjlighet att utvecklas som konsult både i lokala kundleveranser och i större globala åtaganden.
 



  





**OM ROLLEN** 




  





 Som
 **Technology Solution Architect** 
 blir du en del av vårt agila konsultteam med bred IT-kompetens. Du kommer att analysera och utforma arkitektur- och molnlösningar utifrån kundens behov, krav och processer. Genom att kombinera kundinsikter, domänkunskap, branschpraxis och innovativa teknologier kommer du att bidra med lösningar för våra kunders transformationsprojekt inom bank- och finansbranschen. I rollen integrerar du kund- och marknadsperspektiv med bästa praxis för att leverera tydliga affärsfördelar. Dessutom har du möjlighet att forma och utveckla vår växande enhet i Sverige.
 



  





*Vanliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:* 




  




* **Ta fram lösningsdesign** 
 genom att uföra detaljerade analyser av affärs utmaningar samt tekniska förutsättningar.
* **Ta fram och etablera roadmaps** 
 kopplat till affär och teknologi.
* **Driva innovation** 
 och säkerställa att tekniska lösningar överensstämmer med etablerad praxis i branschen och kundens krav.
* **Möjliggöra högkvalitativa leveranser** 
 genom att förstå affärsbehov och skräddarsy lösningar.
* **Leda initiativ och team** 
 av konsulter hos våra kunder.
* **Arbeta som en del av ett globalt team av arkitekter.**
* **Mentorskap,** 
 se till att teamet ligger i framkanten inom olika teknologier, vilket främjar innovation och tillväxt inom gruppen.



  





**DIN PROFIL** 




  




* 7+ års erfarenhet av teknik, arkitektur och digital transformation ifrån bank- och försäkringsbranschen.
* Rådgivande färdigheter inom molnarkitektur och migrering (PaaS/IaaS/SaaS – Pivotal Cloud Foundry, AWS, Azure).
* Erfarenhet av applikationsintegration, agil infrastrukturarkitektur, skalbar arkitektur och datamodellering.
* Erfarenhet av API- och tjänstebaserade arkitekturer med SOAP, REST API, mikrotjänster och användning av JSON för webb- eller mobilapplikationer.
* Kunskap om CI/CD - verktyg som t.ex. Azure, Confluence, Jira, Jenkins, Git, GitHub, Stash, SonarQube.
* Insikter i DevOps processer samt lösningar kopplade till Scrum, Kanban, Lean UX och XP.
* Erfarenhet av strategisk rådgivning med fokus på affärsresultat.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, då vi har en nära dialog med våra kunder.
* TOGAF erfarenhet är en fördel.



  





**VAD VI TROR KOMMER FÅ DIG ATT TRIVAS** 




  





 Vi erbjuder en möjlighet att gå med i en liten men växande enhet för att vara med och påverka samt forma framtiden inom gruppen. För oss är delaktighet och gemenskapen viktig och vi ses så ofta vi kan under gemensamma aktiviteter som lunchträffar, afterworks och kompetensutbyte. Vi hjälper dig med kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling, certifieringar och intressanta kunduppdrag för en gedigen karriärutveckling.
 



  





**ANSÖKAN** 




  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan till oss! Vi inleder våra processer med att prata om vad du är intresserad av att göra som nästa steg och vi är genuint nyfikna på vilka faktorer som får dig att trivas på jobbet.

title: Mediepedagog till BUP Stockholm
description:
***Vill du vara del i en verksamhet som gör skillnad för barn och ungdomar? Bup Stockholm söker en mediepedagog.***
 BUP Stockholm erbjuder specialiserad psykiatrisk vård för barn och ungdomar från 0 till 17 år inom Stockholms län. Vi är en del av Stockholms läns sjukvårdsområde som är en vårdgivare inom Region Stockholm. Tillsammans är vi inom BUP cirka 1 000 anställda som varje år möter drygt 22 000 barn, ungdomar och deras familjer.
   

  

 BUP Stockholm arbetar aktivt med att utveckla vården. Digitalisering ser vi som en viktig del av arbetet med tillgänglighet och delaktighet i vården. Arbetet med digitalisering inom vår verksamhet syftar till att underlätta för både patienter och medarbetare. För att nå ett så bra resultat som möjligt utvecklar vi våra arbetssätt tillsammans med både patienter och medarbetare.
   

  

 Mediepedagogen deltar i flera delar av verksamhetens arbete med att utveckla digitala arbetssätt. Tjänsten är huvudsakligen förlagd på enheten BUP Systemförvaltning, uppföljning och kommunikation som är en del av verksamhetsstödet inom BUP Stockholm. En del av arbetet sker inom utbildningsfunktionen som är förlagd på enheten BUP Utveckling lärande och vetenskap (ca 40%). Mediepedagogen arbetar tillsammans med andra i olika projekt och arbetsgrupper.
   

  

**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Som mediepedagog bidrar du med din kompetens i utbildningssammanhang, i arbete md digitalisering och kommunikation. Det gör du främst genom att arbeta med verksamhetens funktioner för kommunikation, systemförvaltning och utbildning.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifterna består bland annat av följande:
   

  

* Bistå verksamheten med att skapa internutbildningar t ex med hjälp av programmet Rise articulate 360.
* Arbeta med innehåll till internetbehandling tex i ”Stöd och behandlingsplattformen” i 1177
* Delta i verksamhetens digitaliseringsarbete och stödja med innehåll till Alltid öppet.
* Skapa innehåll för intern och extern kommunikation


**Kvalifikationer**
 Relevant högskoleutbildning i mediepedagogik samt erfarenhet av att tillämpa dessa kunskaper i arbetslivet. Minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet.
   

  

 Det är meriterande med följande:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att arbeta inom myndighet eller offentlig verksamhet
* Erfarenhet av arbete med digitalisering
* Kunnig i Adobe suiten t ex premier pro, photoshop, indesign.
* Van att arbeta med text, och att anpassa innehåll för olika medier och målgrupper
* Erfarenhet av att skapa texter och media för webbplatser, webbkurser och i andra sociala kanaler
* Erfarenhet av att skapa e-kurs eller webbkurs, erfarenhet av författarverktyg, t ex som articulate 360.
* Erfarenhet av att bygga kurser för eller på en lärplattform
* Kunskap om och kan tillämpa WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines)
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Alltid öppet eller motsvarande
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med 1177 och stöd och behandlingsplattformen
* Kunskap om tjänstedesign/UX-design.


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Du ska ha en god social förmåga, kan samarbeta bra med andra, är initiativtagande och självgående. Du tycker att det är intressant med kommunikation och text och grafiskt innehåll. Du har ett intresse av både kommunikation och digitalisering inom hälso- och sjukvård. Det passar dig att arbeta i team med andra.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 BUP skapar goda förutsättningar för att du som medarbetare ska utvecklas och bli riktigt bra inom din profession. Som medarbetare har du förmåner såsom fri sjukvård, extra ersättning vid föräldraledighet, möjlighet till löneväxling, avtalspension samt försäkringar. Vi erbjuder också flexibla arbetstider samt friskvårdsersättning (5000 kr per år).
   

  

 Tjänsten tillsätts under förutsättning att den inte behöver tas i anspråk för intern omplacering, enligt gällande regelverk.
   

  

**Vid patientnära arbete inom Stockholms läns sjukvårdsområde:**
* tillämpas registerkontroll före beslut om anställning enligt gällande riktlinje.
* ska medarbetare som kommer att ha patientkontakt genomgå nyanställningsundersökning, enligt gällande direktiv, vilket sker genom företagshälsovården innan anställning.
* krävs, förutom svensk yrkeslegitimation, goda kunskaper i svenska språket motsvarande nivå C1 enligt den gemensamma europeiska referensramen (GERS). Samma krav är vägledande vad gäller icke-legitimerad personal med patientkontakt.


**Stockholms läns sjukvårdsområde (SLSO) är en av Sveriges största vårdgivare med 11 600 medarbetare. Vi erbjuder hälso- och sjukvård i Region Stockholms regi inom psykiatri, primärvård, geriatrik, ASIH, närakuter, somatisk specialistvård, habilitering och hälsa samt hjälpmedel. I samverkan med Karolinska Institutet bedriver vi forskning, utbildning och utveckling. Läs mer om SLSO här.**
 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/943 | Kontakt: Enhetschef Henrik Höök 08-12352078., | Facklig företrädare: Janne Virtanen, Akavia 08-12347529., Ola Tellner, Vision 08-12340481., | Publicerat: 2025-02-04 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-02-19

title: Lösningsarkitekt inom Logistik - Konsultuppdrag
description:
OM INFINITY IT CONSULTING: Infinity IT Consulting är ett konsultföretag inom IT och Management med en stark företagskultur och teamkänsla. Ditt välmående är vår framgång och vi menar att de bästa konsultaffärerna blir av och genomförs med stolthet när du som medarbetare mår som bäst, så gör även företaget och våra kunder det. Vi jobbar med IT-kunder och partners i hela Skandinavien inom både telekom, verkstadsindustrin, retail, sport & mode och många andra. Vi bygger teamet utifrån våra värderingar som genomsyrar hela företaget. Pannben – Viljan och förmågan att lösa uppgiften, ta ansvar och känna ägarskap, men alltid våga ta hjälp. Enkelhet – Vi krånglar inte till det, varken för oss själva eller för andra! Sunt förnuft och kundnöjdhet i fokus. Laganda – Vi ställer upp för varandra, gör varandra bättre och skrattar varje dag! Långsiktighet – Vi är besatta av att göra bra saker och saker bra, vi låter kortsiktiga vinningar stå tillbaka för långvariga affärsrelationer. Stolthet – Vi är rakryggade, på riktigt och vågar gå vår egen väg! Din IT-karriär kan starta hos just oss och vi ger förutsättningarna för det, eller så är du senior med många års erfarenhet och då ger vi utrymme för allt leda, kompetensutveckla och ge stöd åt våra mer juniora konsulter, och på det viset har vi en härlig mix i konsultteamet av olika utbyten i erfarenhet, intressen och kompetens.**Lösningsarkitekt inom Logistik – Konsultuppdrag**

  

Vi söker en erfaren **Lösningsarkitekt inom logistik** för ett spännande uppdrag hos en av våra kunder.
  

Har du en stark förståelse för IT-arkitektur, systemintegration och logistikprocesser? Då kan detta vara rätt uppdrag för dig!


**Om uppdraget**



Som Lösningsarkitekt kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att designa och optimera kundens IT-lösningar inom logistik.
  

Du kommer att arbeta med systemmodellering, processkartläggning och integrationer för att säkerställa effektiva och hållbara lösningar.

  

**Teknisk miljö & verktyg**



Vi söker dig med erfarenhet av:  

✔ **Enterprise Architect (EA Sparx), LeanIX, Visio, draw.io**  

✔ Dokumentation och presentation i **PowerPoint & Word**  

✔ Arbete i agila team med **Jira**

  

Uppdraget erbjuder en stimulerande miljö där du får bidra med din tekniska expertis och driva förändring inom logistikområdet.


**Är du intresserad?** Skicka in din ansökan eller kontakta oss för mer information!

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
Location
Stockholm
Employment Type
Full time
Department
Engineering  




About Sana
We're on a mission to revolutionize how humans access knowledge through artificial intelligence. Throughout history, breakthroughs in knowledge sharing—from the Library of Alexandria to the printing press to Google—have been pivotal drivers of human progress. Today, as the volume of human knowledge grows exponentially, making it accessible and actionable remains one of humanity's most critical challenges. We're building a future where knowledge isn't just more accessible—it's a catalyst for achieving the previously impossible. If all of this sounds exciting, you’re in the right place.  

  



About the Role
In this role, you’ll create engaging user experiences while implementing robust frontend logic. You'll work closely with our engineering and design teams to build and maintain our user interfaces, focusing on both visual implementation and technical architecture.


In this role, you will:* Build engaging user interfaces with a focus on both functionality and experience
* Work with engineering teams to implement frontend logic
* Collaborate with Product Design to deliver high-quality implementations
* Develop and maintain core frontend infrastructure

  

Your background looks something like:
* Proficiency in technologies like TypeScript, React, styled-components, framer motion, and custom CSS implementations
* Experience building complex UI components and systems
* Familiarity with Radix UI and similar component libraries
* Strong understanding of web fundamentals, from HTTP to CSS
* Focus on writing maintainable, scalable frontend code


What We Offer* Help shape AI's future alongside brilliant minds from Google AI, Spotify, McKinsey, BCG, and Slack.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Swift professional growth in an evolving environment, supported by a culture of continuous feedback and mentorship from senior leaders.
* Work with talented teammates across 5+ countries, collaborate with customers globally and work in our offices in New York, London and Stockholm.
* Regular team gatherings and events (recently in Italy and South Africa)

title: Backend Engineer
description:
Location
Stockholm
Employment Type
Full time
Department
Engineering  




About Sana
We're on a mission to revolutionize how humans access knowledge through artificial intelligence. Throughout history, breakthroughs in knowledge sharing—from the Library of Alexandria to the printing press to Google—have been pivotal drivers of human progress. Today, as the volume of human knowledge grows exponentially, making it accessible and actionable remains one of humanity's most critical challenges. We're building a future where knowledge isn't just more accessible—it's a catalyst for achieving the previously impossible. If all of this sounds exciting, you’re in the right place.


About the role
This role will help build the core systems that power both our Learning and AI platforms. We're looking for engineers who can work with either Node.js (TypeScript) or Kotlin backends to create scalable, resilient systems. You'll focus on data flows, cloud deployments, and the orchestration that enables our products to deliver value to users.


In this role, you will:* Lead the development of AI-powered features that transform data into actionable insights
* Build and maintain core AI infrastructure, including search systems and retrieval algorithms
* Implement and optimize LLM integrations
* Work across the stack to deliver AI capabilities that enhance knowledge sharing


Your background looks something like:
* Strong experience working with LLMs, AI APIs, and various prompting techniques
* Proven track record in backend engineering and practical AI implementation
* Ability to approach problems with rigorous experimentation and evaluation
* Experience with recommendation systems or natural language processing
* Deep understanding of AI model capabilities and limitations


What We Offer* Help shape AI's future alongside brilliant minds from Google AI, Spotify, McKinsey, BCG, and Slack.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Swift professional growth in an evolving environment, supported by a culture of continuous feedback and mentorship from senior leaders.
* Work with talented teammates across 5+ countries, collaborate with customers globally and work in our offices in New York, London and Stockholm.
* Regular team gatherings and events (recently in Italy and South Africa)

title: Maintenance Process IT expert
description:
*Stenungsund, Sweden* Apply until: **14 Feb 2025***På Nouryon skapar vårt globala team av Changemakers positiva förändringar varje dag för att nå högre tillsammans och individuellt. Vi skapar innovativa och hållbara lösningar för våra kunder för att möta samhällets behov – idag och i framtiden.*

*Vi söker teammedlemmar som skapar och driver nya idéer, kämpar för andra och samarbetar för att göra saker bättre. Låter det som dig?*

**Om jobbet**
-------------


Här får du möjligheten att leda och utveckla underhållsarbetet på en spännande och dynamisk arbetsplats. Du kommer att vara en nyckelperson i att säkerställa att vår site når sina säkerhets- och affärsmål genom ett effektivt underhåll.

**I din framtida roll som Maintenance Process IT Expert kommer du att**
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

* Delta i säkerhetsarbetet på siten.
* Säkerställa att AMM-processen och ALPS-standarden följs.
* Ansvara för att underhållsprocesserna stämmer överens med affärsmålen.
* Driva förbättringsarbetet inom underhåll och på siten.
* Utveckla och optimera processen för kategorisering av kritisk utrustning.
* Övervaka att FU-planer följer Nouryons krav och lagkrav.
* Övervaka och stödja hur vi jobbar i SAP och dess stödsystem som t.ex Ariba.
* Vara sitens super user för SAP/Ariba.
* Systemägare för vårt anläggningsregister samt CAD program
* Stödja säkerhetsanalyser genom tillförlitlighetsdata för utrustning.
* Identifiera kompetensgap och planera utbildning.
* Coacha och utveckla personalen för att uppnå resultat.
* Ansvara för avdelningarnas årliga budgetprocess.

**Vi tror att du har med dig**
------------------------------

* Bachelor utbildning inom relevant område, ex maskinteknik eller motsvarande
* 5-7 års erfarenhet inom underhåll
* Kunskap och förståelse om hälsa-, säkerhet-, miljö- och energifrågor
* Djup kunskap i SAP PM och MM
* Djup kunskap i SAP förekommande hjälpsystem på Nouryon
* Övergripande kunskap om disciplinerna inom underhåll.
* God förståelse för ALPS underhållsprocesser med fokus på tillförlitlighet och verktyg för rotorsaksanalys
* God kunskaper i svenska och engelska, skrift och tal

**Vi tror att du är...**
------------------------


en person med stark problemlösningsförmåga och analytiskt tänkande. Du har en utmärkt samarbetsförmåga och är teamorienterad, vilket gör att du arbetar bra med andra. Du har också en förmåga att leda och motivera dina kollegor, samt är flexibel och anpassningsbar i föränderliga situationer.

**Vi erbjuder dig**
-------------------


På Nouryon erbjuder vi inte bara en spännande roll och trevliga kollegor utan även förmåner utöver din lön. Nouryon har kollektivavtal med IKEM, men utöver det erbjuder vi även förmåner som bonus, arbetstidsförkortning, friskvårdsbidrag, kostförmån och mycket mer.

**Har vi fångat ditt intresse?**
--------------------------------


Detta är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med placeringsort Stenungsund. Du kommer att rapportera till Kjell Siggelin, Maintenance Manager.


Vänligen ansök via vårt rekryteringsverktyg med ett jobbspecifikt CV. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via e-post. När din ansökan nått oss kommer vi att granska för att se om vi har en matchning mellan din kompetens och rollen! För mer information om vår rekryteringsprocess, vänligen besök: nouryon.com/careers/how-we-hire/


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!


Vi vill be dig som intern sökande att ansöka med din Nouryon email för att underlätta vårt arbete i rekryteringsprocessen.

**Om Nouryon**
--------------


Vi letar efter morgondagens Changemakers, idag!


Om du letar efter din nästa möjlighet i karriären, ansök idag och gå med i Nouryons världsomspännande team av Changemakers för att tillhandahålla viktiga lösningar som våra kunder använder för att tillverka vardagsprodukter som personlig vård, rengöring, färger och beläggningar, jordbruk och livsmedel, läkemedel och byggprodukter. Våra medarbetare drivs av viljan att påverka och aktivt driva positiv förändring. Om det beskriver dig ger vi gärna plats för dina ambitioner. Från dag ett stödjer vi dig med din personliga tillväxt, genom utmanande positioner och omfattande lärande- och utvecklingsmöjligheter, i en dynamisk, internationell, mångsidig och proaktiv arbetsmiljö.


Besök vår hemsida och följ oss på LinkedIn.

**Kontakt**
-----------


För ytterligare information om tjänsten, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Kjell Siggelin, Maintenance Manager, Kjell.Siggelin@nouryon.com


För mer information om rekryteringsprocessen, din ansökan eller om du behöver support, vänligen kontakta: Recruiting.SE@Nouryon.com


För fackliga frågor:  

Sveriges Ingenjörer: Anna-Lena Palm +46 303 851 13  

Unionen: Magnus Svensson +46 303 858 38  

IF Metall: Ronny Jansson +46 303 854 96

**#WeAreNouryon #Changemakers**
-------------------------------


Då vi inför denna rekrytering redan tagit ställning till de rekryteringskanaler vi önskar använda undanbeder vi oss vänligen men bestämt att bli kontaktade för ytterligare erbjudanden om kompetensförmedling, annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp.

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
**Join Simployer as a Senior Engineer ‍** 



Simployer is transforming HR tech, and we are on the lookout for an experienced **Senior Engineer** to help us build a world-class platform. As part of the growing team, you will work with cutting-edge technologies to create innovative features that will be used by organizations across Europe. Join us in shaping the future of HR technology as we continue to revolutionize the industry with AI-powered solutions, seamless HR systems, and exceptional user experiences.


**What You Will Do:**


* Take a lead role in the development of backend-heavy features for our platform.
* Build new features from scratch, improve existing code, and ensure it remains clean, scalable, and efficient.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the product meets both business and user needs.
* Take ownership of your work and contribute autonomously while driving product development forward.
* Contribute to system architecture design, ensuring stability and scalability as the product evolves.

  
Skills & Requirements


**What You Will Bring to the Team:**


* Strong proficiency in **Node.js**, **TypeScript**, and experience with **REST** or **GraphQL APIs**.
* Experience developing production-grade applications, with a strong understanding of **API design** (server-to-server, server-to-client).
* Expertise in **data modeling**, and working with **cloud platforms** such as **GCP**, **AWS**, or **Azure**.
* Solid experience in **Unit Testing** and working with **Kubernetes**, **Nest.js**, **Redis**, **RabbitMQ**, **Jest**, and other technologies in the stack.
* Ability to maintain high coding standards and contribute to a collaborative, agile development environment.
* Strong communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
* A passion for building innovative software and contributing to a thriving development culture.


**What We See as a Plus:**


* Experience working with AI/ML technologies in a backend context.
* Experience in the **Tech** or **SaaS** industries.
* Knowledge of **Integration Testing** and **TDD** practices.


**Our Tech Stack:**Node.js, TypeScript, MongoDB, Nest.js, GraphQL API, REST API, Redis, RabbitMQ, Jest, Kubernetes, GCP



**Message from the Hiring Manager:**



“*Hi! I'm Herman, the Engineering Manager for the HR Core team. In this role you will be working closely with myself and a team of talented, passionate individuals dedicated to delivering high-quality products for our customers.*  

*At Simployer, I was welcomed into a culture of innovation and creative freedom, a work environment that encourages our team members to question the status quo and learn from their mistakes. So now I would like to extend this forward to yourself as well.*  

*I look forward to learning more about you, and how you can contribute to our success.*"


**What We Offer:**


* A supportive and inclusive workplace where collaboration and personal growth are prioritized.
* The flexibility to work from home or in our Stockholm office, based on your preference.
* Opportunities for personal and professional development with an emphasis on work-life balance.
* A team that inspires and supports one another in achieving our goals.
* High autonomy and responsibility, with recognition for your unique contributions.


**Our Hiring Process:**



* **Introduction meeting:** A brief chat with our recruiter for us to understand your background better, and for you to learn about us and the role (approx. 30 minutes).


* **Personality & Logic Test:** A short assessment to help us understand your problem-solving abilities and cognitive strengths via Alva Labs


* **Technical Screening:** Meet with someone from your future team to assess your experience and skills, and for you to learn more about the projects we are working on (approx. 45 minutes).


* **Technical Interview:** A deeper dive into your technical expertise with our tech leaders, and for you to get a better feel for our team (approx. 60 minutes).


* **Informal HR Interview**: Before making an offer, we’ll have a final informal chat to answer any last questions and ensure everything feels right on both sides (approx. 30 minutes).



**We can’t wait to meet you!**



At Simployer, we believe in empowering our employees to achieve their best. Join us and contribute to a workplace where your skills and ideas can truly make a difference.


  
**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------


Hybrid and flexible work model


Modern offices


Pension and health care


Laughs, develops, and celebrates together


HR tech company


Career opportunities


  
Simployer is a “people first” company. We offer a unique combination of high-value and people-centric products, services and expertise. Our simplifying solutions are the preferred choice of more than 15,000 customers and 1,2 million users in Northern Europe. For almost four decades, we have helped our customers unleash the full potential in people, the core asset of any company. Managers who want to lead better – by inspiring, engaging and developing their employees – choose our solutions. We are on an exciting journey where we will continue to grow our company into new markets in Northern Europe. In Simployer we have a culture where it is possible to grow, and to have a direct impact on the business through empowerment and flat structure. You will work with colleagues who are passionate about their work and we can promise you that we have a lot of fun at work. To succeed in the market, reach our growth goals and continue to fulfil our vision, we need top talent who shares our conviction that people make businesses grow. Are you our next Simployee?  



  

**Our Values**
**Learn, Lead and Deliver**
With every new piece of information we acquire, and every new skill we develop, we become stronger, wiser, and more capable of delivering good products and meaningful experiences. We will never stop seeking knowledge, for it is the key that unlocks the door to our greatest potential.
We are open to new ideas and perspectives, eager to make the next move. We are curious about way of working and stay ahead of the curve. We lead by example and dare to fail fast. We're on a fun journey, as a team and together with our customer.
We put passion and dedication into our work, because we know that every delivery is an opportunity to make a difference. We approach each task with our hearts and a drive to exceed expectations. We don't just deliver, we do it with a passion for both our customer and Simployees.
We embrace what makes us human, take time to play and have fun together.

title: Software Engineer till spelteknikbolag!
description:
Vår kund är ett snabbväxande svenskt spelteknikföretag med uppdrag att leverera det bästa ekosystemet som kopplar samman alla stora intressenter inom spel för kommersiell och kreativ tillväxt.

  

Kunden arbetar nära spelstudior och förlag av alla storlekar för att skapa värde genom att ge dem full kontroll över sin viktigaste marknadsföringskanal – influencer marketing. Kundens ekosystem tillhandahåller automatiserade verktyg för att förstå och rikta in sig på rätt målgrupp, publicera och distribuera spel till innehållsskapare på ett effektivt sätt och mäta resultat – allt på en plattform.

 **Arbetsbeskrivning**


För kunds räkning söker vi en Software Engineer i Linköping till utvecklingsavdelningen. Du kommer att ansvara för att utveckla och underhålla kod, åtgärda buggar och kvalitetsproblem samt delta i agila möten. Du kommer att arbeta med teknologier som .NET Core, gRPC, Docker, Kubernetes, Microsoft SQL och MongoDB databaser.

  

Kunden är ett vänligt team med högt tempo av lösningsorienterade tekniknördar. Som en av våra Software Engineers kommer du också att samarbeta med andra utvecklare, testare, produktägare och andra intressenter för att säkerställa att våra produkter har en positiv inverkan på spelindustrin.

 **Ansvar**

* Skriv kod som är ren, återanvändbar och testbar.
* Arbeta nära utvecklare, produktägare och annan personal för att säkerställa skalbara och pålitliga tjänster.
* Vara djupt involverad i den tekniska designen av funktioner i ett tidigt skede.

**Krav**

* Minst 5 års yrkeserfarenhet av C#- och .NET-baserade teknologier.
* Kunskap om vanliga designmönster och algoritmer samt förtrogenhet med olika typer av applikationsarkitekturer.
* Kunskaper om relations- och NoSQL-databaser.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med mikrotjänster och distribuerade system.

**Merit**

* En passion för spel (vi tar vårt drakdräp på största allvar).
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Azure och Azure DevOps.
* Erfarenhet av Docker och Kubernetes.
* Intresse för infrastruktur, CI/CD och automation.

**Varför ska du arbeta hos vår kund?**


Kunden vill utveckla hela spelbranschen. Genom att förse utvecklare och utgivare med marknadsdata och marknadsföringsverktyg av hög kvalitet möjliggör vi bättre beslutsfattande som leder till bättre spel. Bättre spel skapar bättre förutsättningar för innehållsskapare att behålla och bygga sina varumärken och ge konsumenterna bättre upplevelser.

  

Hos kunden är du en del av en innovativ och fartfylld miljö. Vi brinner för det vi gör och du kommer att arbeta med ett team av högpresterande individer som älskar att arbeta tillsammans (och tv-spel). Kunden värdesätter din personlighet och vi tror att du brinner för ditt arbete, är ambitiös och jobbar hårt för att nå dina egna mål!

 **Övrigt**

**Ort:** Linköping

**Start:** Omgående med hänsyn till uppsägningstid

 **Ansökan**


Vi tar emot ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan annonsen tagits ner. Vid frågor, kontakta maria@linden-it.se.

title: Software Engineer - Ingka DAM
description:
**Job ID:** 276989


**Date posted:** 04/02/2025


**About this work area**  

We are an area with the vision: to create a seamless, efficient, and captivating content experience that transforms the way our customers and co-workers engage with digital content. Join us in revolutionizing the digital landscape and making a significant difference in the lives of millions around the world. We are committed to the goal of creating quality content and asset management system that supports our vision of digital engagement. You and your team will be instrumental in achieving this goal, positioning IKEA’s digital content and asset management at the forefront of the industry. The Growth & Marketing area is a creative and strategic part of our business, focused on promoting engagement and expanding our customer base. By understanding customer needs and market trends, this area ensures that our products and services are not only innovative but also resonate deeply with our audience. Together with your peers from Growth & Marketing, other domains and other parts of IKEA you will co-create and facilitate a comprehensive, omnichannel CMS and DAM experience that will be provided to our customers and co-workers every day, across the world.  

  

ABOUT THE INGKA DAM TEAM  

Our goal is to be the INGKA single source of truth, when it comes to store and provide INGKA with assets. We are currently storing and distributing images, 3d models, pdf and videos for both ikea.com and for internal use in all INGKA markets.
  

Assets can be added to our system through automatic pipelines or in batch through our tools or even in some cases manual upload asset by asset. We are currently working on reducing manual and repetitive work and replacing it with automated processes.  

  

We are a small team with 4 developers, 1 product owner and 2 product specialists. Located both in the Malmö area and the Netherlands. Part of the dev team meets at the Hubhult a couple of times a week. It is important for us to have a close collaboration throughout the team, and there should never be an issue to reach out to whomever if you need assistance.  

**Your responsibilities**  

* Design, develop, and maintain scalable applications using TypeScript with GCP services.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
* Participate in code reviews to ensure code quality and system performance.
* Troubleshoot, optimize, and fix bugs in existing applications.
* Communicate effectively with team members, stakeholders.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes and team culture.

  

Qualifications:  

* Strong proficiency in TypeScript.
* Hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services
* Solid understanding of software engineering best practices (version control, CI/CD, etc.).
* Proven ability to write clean, efficient, and maintainable code.
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills—teamwork and collaboration are key.
* Ability to explain complex technical concepts in simple terms to non-technical stakeholders.
* Experience working in an Agile development environment is advantageous.

  

Desirable:  

* Familiarity with Docker, and microservices architecture.
* Experience in front-end development with React.
* Exposure to DevOps tools and best practices.

  

Why Should You Join Us?  

* A collaborative and diverse work culture where your voice matters.
* Opportunities for professional growth and learning.
* Flexible working hours and the possibility of remote work.
* There will be fika

**Apply now!**  

Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they’re 100% “qualified”. If this is part of the reason you hesitate to apply, we like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think. We look forward to receiving your application.  

  

From: “Why Women Don’t Apply for Jobs Unless They’re 100% Qualified” by Tara Sophia Mohr, August 2014”  

  

The role is based in Malmö.  

  

"In line with our value of togetherness we believe the best way for us to collaborate and co-create is when we meet in the office. This is why we expect you to spend the majority of time in the office."  

  

We will be interviewing continuously and are looking forward to hearing from you!  

  

Internal title: Software Engineer  

  

“In this recruitment there is no relocation support provided by Ikea, hence we are looking for people living in the mentioned location.”  

  

PLEASE NOTE  

Please respect that due to GDPR we cannot review any applications coming to us in other ways than through our recruitment program. Please submit with your application in English.

title: Programmerare för PLC-styrning
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**
--------------------

I sektor service spelar du en viktig roll i att hålla vårt samhälle igång. Vi arbetar med allt från fastighetsskötsel, offentliga måltider och lokalvård till underhåll av gator, parker och ledningsnät – här bidrar du direkt till att skapa en bättre vardag för våra invånare. Vi erbjuder en arbetsmiljö som främjar utveckling, samarbete och nytänkande. Välkommen till oss, här finns det alltid plats för fler som vill göra skillnad!  

  

VA som avdelning är uppdelat i två enheter Samverkan och ledningsnät samt Drift och underhåll. Totalt är vi 37 personer, varav 25 medarbetare är på enheten drift och underhåll som förvaltar och har driften av VA:s anläggningar. Personalen utgår från Stadskvarn avloppsreningsverk. Totalt förvaltar vi ca 120 anläggningar spritt över kommunen.  

Tillsammans jobbar vi för trivsel, glädje och utveckling på arbetsplatsen. Ett gott arbetsklimat där vi samarbetar och samverkar för att få verksamheten att fortsätta utvecklas. Vi söker nu ytterligare en lagspelare som trivs att jobba tillsammans med oss mot våra mål.  



**Arbetsuppgifter**
-------------------

Vår organisation växer och det är nu dags att gå från en till två programmerare som ansvarar för PLC-styrning av våra anläggningar på vatten och avlopp.  

  

Idag kommunicerar vi med våra PLC:er via server med hjälp av olika kommunikationssätt; vi har: radio, GSM-modem och fiber. Utmaningar finns i felsökning och att ha rätt utrustning i reserv hemma.  

  

Du kommer främst arbeta med Mitsubishi PLCer, MimerVA, VA-operatör, PLC-kommunikation. Du måste ha kunskap och ordning och reda på dokumentation, så som tex el-ritningar och PLC-program.  

  

Det ingår också att beställa och dimensionera automationsskåp, elektrikerarbeten och elektrisk utrustning. Alla elarbeten bereder du åt elektriker internt som externt. Du skriver också funktionsbeskrivningar för programmering av våra system. Du kommer också att effektivisera befintliga styrningar och göra energiuppföljning.  

  

Du och din kollega kommer också att vara systemansvarig för våra operatörs- och underhållsystem.  

  

Du är en stöttepelare för vår driftgrupp och rapporterar direkt till enhetschef som de andra specialisterna. Du behöver vara beredd på att skifta mellan arbetsuppgifter med kort varsel då vår drift är prioriterad.  

  

Som person ser vi att du gärna är prestigelös, strukturerad, och samarbetsvillig.  

  

Rekrytering sker löpande.


**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------

Krav:  

  

* Elingenjör eller automationsingenjör eller annan utbildning/erfarenhet som arbetsgivaren finner likvärdig
* PLC-kommunikation
* PLC-programmering
* Kunna läsa el-scheman
* Körkort B

  

Meriterande:  

  

* Erfarenhet i VA-branschen eller industri
* VA-operatör
* MimerVA
* Programmerat Mitsubishi
* Rita el-scheman i CAD
* Programmera och ställa in regulatorer

  

Denna tjänst omfattas av en säkerhetsprövning.
**Anställningens omfattning**
-----------------------------

Enligt överenskommelse.


**Ansökan**
-----------


Referensnummer: C233396

  



**Övrigt**
----------

Att jobba i Skövde kommun  

  

I Skövde kommun jobbar vi med allt från omsorg, stöd och utbildning till infrastruktur, underhåll, kulturliv och tillväxt. Hos oss finns hundratals yrken och 5500 medarbetare. Arbetet ser olika ut beroende på vilken verksamhet vi arbetar i men alla representerar samma arbetsgivare, Skövde kommun, och vårt gemensamma uppdrag är att vara välfärdsleverantör, samhällsutvecklare och arbetsgivare. Jämställda, jämlika och inkluderande verksamheter är en självklarhet för oss.  

  

Som medarbetare i Skövde kommun är du en viktig spelare i ett lag som varje dag, året om levererar tjänster och service till våra kunder. Det är i mötet med våra kunder som värdet av vårt arbete uppstår. Vi satsar på dig som medarbetare och erbjuder kompetensutveckling, förmånliga pensionsvillkor, friskvårdsbidrag samt flera friskvårdsaktiviteter och erbjudanden. Och det bästa av allt, vi har plats för fler.  

  

Läs mer om oss som arbetsgivare: https://skovde.se/naringsliv-arbete/Jobba-hos-oss/  

  

Vi tar gärna emot samtal från dig som är intresserad av jobbet men vi tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.  

  

Har du skyddade personuppgifter ska du kontakta den kontaktperson som finns angiven i annonsen.

------------------------
