title: Dev Ops Engineer
description:
**Role Overview**
 We are looking for a Dev Ops engineer with experience in building and managing high-performing and scalable systems to handle massive amounts of transactions.
   

  

 Our platform is built on containerised microservices that we deploy in the cloud through continuous deployment. We are working with test driven development to ensure high quality and we can quickly implement new software into production. The future includes moving towards streaming data and "data lakehouse" architecture
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
 You will be part of a small and high performing team taking care of our Operational environment. You will take full responsibility for the provisioning, development and monitoring of our infrastructure, therefore a solid understanding of modern computing technology is essential and knowledge of cloud environments is beneficial.
   

  

**Your profile**
* At least 3 years of experience of Dev Ops
* Experience of working with cloud platforms (in particular AWS)
* Solid Kubernetes experience is essential
* You know how to work with high volume data
* You can quickly pick up an understanding of the business you are working with and are able to convert that knowledge into technical solutions that fulfill client needs
* GitOps, IAC, CICD, Helm, Python
* Linux (e.g. Ubuntu, CentOS, etc.)
* Webservers (e.g. Nginx, Apache, Lighttpd, etc.)
* Version Control (Git)
* Shell Scripting (sh, BASH, etc.)
* TCP/IP Networking (IPv4 & IPv6)
* Active knowledge of industry trends
* Excellent written and verbal communication in English


**Why us?**
 Tradedoubler is an international performance marketing partner, creating smarter results for its clients and partners through traffic, technology and expertise. We help our clients grow their online sales and find new customers for their businesses and we help an expanding network of online publishers monetise their websites.
   

  

 Working at Tradedoubler is stimulating, challenging and fun. We pride ourselves in offering an environment where everyone can contribute and make a difference to the success of our business. Our employees come from all over the world, producing a culturally diverse environment where creativity, communication and idea sharing are highly valued.
   

  

 We recognise that our employees are the key to our success and with this in mind we offer competitive salaries and benefits as well as the opportunity for every employee to grow with us.
   

  

**About Us**
 Tradedoubler is a global partner marketing network that has been facilitating connections between result-driven brands and publishers worldwide for more than 25 years. We operate in 90+ markets across the globe and house over 2,000 brands and 180,000 publishers in our network. Our awesome teams are located across our 15 offices in Europe and Australia.
   

  

 In addition to Tradedoubler's core Partner Marketing business, we offer digital marketing solutions across the entire customer journey, including App marketing (Appiness), influencer marketing (Metapic), lead generation campaigns (Leadslab), & SaaS solutions (Grow by Tradedoubler).
   

  

 Tradedoubler was founded in 1999 in Stockholm, Sweden by Martin Lorentzon & Felix Hägnö, and has been listed on the Stockholm Stock Exchange since 2005.
   

  

 One of our strong beliefs at Tradedoubler is that our success stems from adhering to our core values: Make it Happen, Stay Curious, & Achieve Together.

title: DevOps Engineer
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Are you passionate about automation, system development, and ensuring high-quality IT operations? Do you thrive in a collaborative and dynamic environment where innovation drives continuous improvement? At Telia, we are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our Production, Shared Operation Secure Operation team.
   

  

 I’m Michael Mobelius, leading the Secure Operation DevOps team within the Shared Operation, IT Production & Cybersecurity organization. We are a dedicated and highly skilled team working to enhance our target systems and ensure smooth IT production operations. If you’re looking for an opportunity to develop your expertise across diverse technologies while making a real impact, this role is for you.
   

  

**As a** 
**DevOps Engineer** 
**…**
 You will play a crucial role in supporting and developing Telia’s target systems within IT Production. You will be responsible for ensuring system stability, troubleshooting technical issues, and maintaining service levels. Working across a diverse range of technologies, including databases, networking, servers, and cloud environments, you will continuously improve operational processes and implement automation to optimize system performance.
   

  

 Your role will involve proactively solving problems, deploying and configuring changes, and keeping technical documentation up to date. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, ensuring smooth communication and efficient workflows to meet service-level agreements. As part of your daily tasks, you will contribute to the overall system design and decision-making processes, helping stakeholders secure quality and customer satisfaction. The team operates under Agile and SAFe methodologies, with future plans to integrate SAFe & TM Forum best practices into daily operations.
   

  

**Who We're Looking For**
 We are looking for a technically skilled, solution-oriented professional with a strong DevOps mindset. You thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and are eager to develop and optimize IT operations.
   

  

 You have a strong technical background with a university degree in a relevant field or equivalent work experience. Your expertise includes Linux and Windows server administration, Kubernetes, and experience in IT operations. You have knowledge of IP networking and troubleshooting, as well as databases such as Oracle, PostgreSQL, and SQL. Experience working with CI/CD pipelines, automation tools (GitHub, Jenkins, Ansible), Splunk, and Agile/SAFe methodologies is highly valued. Additionally, knowledge of network monitoring, 4G/5G signaling, ServiceNow, Grafana, or Prometheus would be an advantage.
   

  

 You are a strong communicator and problem solver with a passion for automation and process improvements. You take ownership of your responsibilities and deliver high-quality work. You enjoy both independent tasks and teamwork, always aiming to grow and learn with others. You are fluent in English, both written and verbal, and open to new ideas and change.
   

  

**We are more than a workplace**
 Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn an annual bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 We are looking forward to your application by 2025-02-18. If you are selected for the next stage in the process, you'll be contacted by our Hiring Manager/Talent Acquisition Partner. Required controls will be performed.
   

  

 If you want to know more about this position, please contact me Michael Mobelius at +46 70 316 44 47.
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen – together**

title: DevOps Engineer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Business Consulting and Services
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
   

  

 At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for a Azure DevOps to join our Artificial Intelligence & Advance Analytics Team.
   

  

 Our practice Artificial Intelligence & Analytics is a global practice working across more than 15 verticals including, Banking & Financial Services, Healthcare, Retail, Consumer Goods & Insurance to deliver cutting edge solutions for their data & analytics requirements.
   

  

 We specialize in leading technology trends in market like cloud analytics, data modernization, Generative AI & AI/ML solutions.
   

  

 We help organizations engage people and uncover insight from data to shape the products, services and experiences they offer. We work with the world’s leading organizations to provide collaborative solutions to their business and IT challenges with innovative ideas that are embraced by their customers. More than 5,300 professionals around the world leverage deep industry knowledge across 15 verticals including: banking and financial services, healthcare, retail, consumer goods and insurance to deliver robust digital solutions in key areas of client growth.
   

  

 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced DevOps Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in DevOps practices, Databricks, and Azure Cloud Data Lake platforms. This role will involve managing and optimizing our cloud infrastructure, ensuring seamless integration and operation of our data pipelines, and enhancing our overall DevOps processes.
   

  

**Our ideal candidate**
 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced DevOps Engineer to join our team at Cognizant will have a strong background in DevOps practices, Databricks, and Azure Cloud Data Lake platforms. This role will involve managing and optimizing our cloud infrastructure, ensuring seamless integration and operation of our data pipelines, and enhancing our overall DevOps processes.
   

  

* Design, implement, and manage DevOps pipelines for our Azure Cloud Data Lake platform.
* Automate and streamline CI/CD processes.
* Integrate and manage Databricks for data warehousing and analytics.
* Monitor and optimize cloud infrastructure for performance and cost efficiency.
* Ensure high availability and disaster recovery for all cloud services.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve issues.
* Implement and maintain security best practices for cloud and data environments.
* Stay current with the latest DevOps and cloud technologies and apply them to our systems.
* Provide technical leadership and mentorship to junior team members.


**Nice to Have**
* Experience with Azure DevOps: Experience with Azure DevOps, including Azure Pipelines and Azure Boards is a plus.
* Experience with security: Experience with security practices and tools such as Azure Security Centre, Azure Active Directory, or Azure Key Vault is a plus.
* Experience in Kafka: experience in Kafka with Azure, such as Confluent Kafka is a plus.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
 DevOps is a critical part of our platform strategy. As a member of the DevOps team, you will focus on providing technical expertise and support to our engineering teams to enable them to deliver high-quality software solutions efficiently.
   

  

 This includes providing continuous support to teams, overcoming major technical hurdles, improving performance , implementing system monitoring and building highly available software.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Approaching Operations as a Software Engineering challenge applying software engineering to solve operational challenges.
* Being the first point of contact for our Operations and Dev teams for any questions and issues regarding our platform.
* Having a positive attitude and the ability to understand the critical urgency of topics and strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ensuring non-functional requirements for all applications and tools are met and clearly communicated.
* Providing counsel to our internal software engineering team and proactively suggesting improvements on how to operate our microservice-based solution.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:
   

  

 ESSENTIAL SKILLS:
   

  

* Minimum 5 years of software engineering or devops experience.
* Practical experience in using common cloud APIs
* Strong knowledge of Linux and shell scripting, as well as higher level protocols and patterns like HTTP/3, REST, JSON and gRPC
* Expertise in systems integration and distributed large scale microservice deployments
* Experience in operating and monitoring container workloads and similar technologies
* Strong code reading and understanding skills with at least one high level programming language


 NICE TO HAVES:
   

  

* Experience from the iGaming industry is meriting


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group, is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices world-wide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we like to empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait around for things to happen, we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English we’d like to see your CV in English please\*\*

title: Senior Technical Architect
description:
Role Overview:
 



 As a Senior Technical Architect, you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing complex technical solutions that align with business objectives and industry best practices. Your expertise will be crucial in guiding and shaping large-scale solutions that meet performance, scalability, and security standards.
 



 Key Responsibilities:
 


1. Solution Design & Architecture:


* Design and architect large-scale technical solutions ensuring scalability, performance, and security across all components.


1. Team Development & Training:


* Train, mentor, and develop the team to ensure a continuous pipeline of skilled manpower in relevant technologies, mitigating delivery risks through robust knowledge-sharing practices.


1. Continuous Skill Enhancement:


* Stay ahead of industry trends by continuously upskilling with cutting-edge technologies to deliver high-quality, future-proof solutions that meet client expectations and align with industry standards.


1. Client Engagement & Technology Strategy:


* Utilize domain and technical expertise to gather client requirements, deliver appropriate solutions, and craft a technology strategy that is aligned with the client’s business goals and objectives.



 Skills Required:
 


* Primary Skill: Quality & Tools Consulting (APPS)-DevOps-Q&T-DevOps
* Experience & Expertise: Proficiency in architecture and design of complex solutions, particularly in DevOps, automation, and quality tools within large-scale environments.
* Technical & Business Alignment: Strong understanding of business needs and the ability to translate them into practical and scalable solutions.

title: Cloud Engineer Azure & IaC
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vill du vara hjärnan bakom nästa generation av molnteknologi hos ett av Sveriges största IT-företag? Hos CGI är vi på en resa mot teknisk excellens inom Cloud och vi söker passionerade Cloud Engineers som vill vara med och driva denna framtid framåt. Här får du en unik möjlighet att arbeta med banbrytande teknologi tillsammans med likasinnade tech-entusiaster. Din arbetsplats kan vara överallt i Sverige, då vi fokuserar mer på att hitta rätt kompetens än på din geografiska placering.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som Cloud Engineer kommer du att primärt fördjupa dig i spännande och utmanande projekt inom främst Microsoft Azure, men eventuellt även AWS eller Google Cloud (GCP). Du kommer att vara en nyckelperson i ett dedikerat team av Cloud-specialister som ansvarar för utveckling, drift och support av olika kunders komplexa Cloud-lösningar. Din roll innebär att du blir en domänexpert och agerar som både problemlösare och rådgivare för klienter med komplexa tekniska utmaningar. Här erbjuder vi en mångsidig arbetsmiljö där du kan bidra till förbättring av våra tjänster och delta i förändrings- och projektarbete inom såväl de ledande Public Cloud tjänsterna som CGIs Privarte Cloud tjänster. Exempel på projekt inkluderar implementering av nya klienter, integration av avancerade funktioner eller utveckling av innovativa tjänster. Vi ser gärna att du drivs av tekniska utmaningar eftersom denna roll kräver att du är i framkant av den tekniska utvecklingen. Certifieringar inom de stora publika molnplattformarna är meriterande och eftertraktade.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 För att bli framgångsrik i rollen krävs minst tre års erfarenhet av Azure och Infrastructure as code.
   

  

**Du har djup expertis inom åtminstone ett av följande teknikområden:**
* Terraform eller Biceps
* Automation och skriptning
* Power Apps


 Att jobba som Cloud Engineer hos oss innebär inte bara att du måste kunna koda och hantera molnresurser utan vi lägger också stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper, dessa kommer vara avgörande för att du ska kunna ta din professionella utveckling till nya höjder. Du kommer att arbeta tätt tillsammans med kollegor, både internt på CGI och ute hos våra kunder. Ditt arbete kräver att du kan samarbeta effektivt och vara en integrerad del av teamet. Du behöver kunna förmedla dina idéer tydligt och professionellt, både i interna möten och i kundinteraktioner. Du är en person som kan sätta dig i andras situation och är beredd att bidra till givande diskussioner som leder till de bästa lösningarna. Ditt arbete som Cloud Engineer kommer att vara som en resa genom molnet, och det kräver mod att ständigt utmana och utvecklas. Din förmåga att ta initiativ och vara en aktiv deltagare i den här resan är vad som skiljer en bra Cloud Engineer från en enastående.
   

  

 Du behärskar flytande svenska samt engelska, eftersom kommunikation med våra kunder kan kräva flerspråkig förmåga. Vi vill även att du har svenskt medborgarskap då det kan vara aktuellt med säkerhetsklassad arbete och säkerhetsprövning kan förekomma.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder:**
 På CGI tror vi att framgång bygger på våra medarbetare, och därför erbjuder vi alla möjligheten att bli delägare i företaget. Vårt unika ägarprogram främjar företagskulturen och ger våra medarbetare engagemang och stolthet i att vara en del av CGI. Hos oss blir du en del av en kultur som präglas av ständig teknisk utveckling, och du kommer att arbeta i en miljö där du har möjlighet att påverka och växa i ansvar, utforska nya tekniska roller och sammanhang samt kontinuerligt utvecklas. Vi erbjuder dig en global arena där du kan utvecklas och göra verklig skillnad.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Har du frågor om jobbet kontakta rekryterande ledare Marcus Gridange, marcus.grindange@cgi.com. Vi tillämpar löpande urval skicka därför in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
   

  

**Som anställd erbjuds du nedan förmåner:**
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr.
* Trygg anställning: Våra medlemmar anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


**Övrigt**
 Bakgrundskontroller och registerkontroll kan komma att genomföras om uppdraget kräver det.
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Data Engineer
description:
RED are currently looking for a Data Engineer to work on a project with a key client of ours based in Stockholm, Sweden. This position will be an initial 3 Month contract + extensions and requires someone local who can be on site 3 days per week.
 



  





 We are looking for skills in the following:
 



  




* Design and implement automation of application lifecycle, including build test and deployment
* Build reliable and scalable platform solutions on Microsoft Azure, utilizing components such as Azure Databricks, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Data Factory, Event Hubs, etc.
* Perform operations tasks such as monitoring application performance over time or troubleshoot issues with production applications
* Monitor performance and create a plan to ensure the platform can grow with increased data volumes
* Proactively improve processes and technologies to prevent and minimize security risk for both data and the data platforms
* Develop and maintain documentation of processes and tools related to the data platform
* Proactively work to prevent Data exfiltration i.e., prevent data theft, data extrusion, data exportation, and data leakage
* Develop and engineer Kubernetes clusters and the containerized applications they run using tools such as Helm and Azure DevOps Pipelines
* Manage clusters, policies, security of Databricks Workspaces and other Data Engineering tools
* Keep abreast of emerging technology trends and proactively look for opportunities to improve Data platform
* Assist Platform operations team in troubleshooting issues, deploying new tools and technologies etc



  





 If this is something of interest then please send through your application and someone will be in touch shortly to discuss in more detail.

title: We are looking for a Head of Software Engineering!
description:
*Telenor Connexion is a leading, Scandinavian provider of IoT (Internet of Things) services with over 20 years of experience working with enterprises around the world.* 




  





*We are a global leader in connecting things and manage more than 17 million connections across the world for multinational customers such as Volvo, Scania, Hitachi, Verisure Securitas Direct and Husqvarna. We provide easy and reliable access to every market in the world and enable industry leading players to connect their products and services on a global scale across every vertical.* 




  





*Telenor Connexion is a specialized IoT company within the Telenor Group and together we rank among the top IoT operators in Europe and the world.* 




*With headquarters and tech center located in the Nordics, we have sales representation in the UK, US, Germany, South Africa, South Korea, China, Malaysia, and Japan.* 




  





**The role** 




  





 Our high performing Software Engineering team is responsible for developing and maintaining software solutions that are part of our product portfolio or used as internal support systems. The team currently consists of 9 employees and around 10 consultants reporting directly to the Head of Software Engineering.
 



  





 As Head of Software Engineering, you will oversee daily operations and own the software development process and projects. Software solutions are delivered upon request with specification coming from various parts of the organization, including solutions such as Global SIM Local Access (GSLA) and Device-to-Cloud. AWS and Salesforce are two examples of environments often relevant for the work, although the full scope spans across several environments and programming languages, including embedded software.
 



  





 As Head of Software Engineering, you will be responsible for planning and acting on training and competence needs, capacity building and growth of team members. You will identify and address short- and long-term competence and capacity needs, ensuring in-house solution competence is maintained. You'll monitor and manage development costs, collaborate with the Sourcing Manager on consultant agreements, and recruit and manage external development resources. The role will involve maintaining the quality and effectiveness of team deliveries and optimizing staffing by balancing internal employees and consultants within budget. Together with Head of CNO (Cloud Network Operations), you will also co-own Connexion’s DevOps framework and ensure the identifying and assigning of post-launch responsibilities, including Life Cycle Management aspects.
 



  





 This is a broad cross-functional role with relations to multiple departments internally, but also towards several stakeholders at all levels within Telenor Group as well as our customers’ organizations. This role reports to CTO of Telenor Connexion, and you will be part of the CTO management team together with the Heads of Product Management, Project Management, Technology Architecture, Data Science and Analytics, Roaming and Sourcing departments.
 



  





**Tasks and responsibilities** 




 As Head of Software Engineering, you will be responsible for implementing the necessary tools and services to ensure your team can perform their tasks efficiently. While daily coding is not the primary focus of this managerial role, a strong background and experience in software development is essential to effectively support your team and drive the company's strategic agenda in software engineering.
 



  





**Deliverables from Software Engineering team includes:** 



* Software & Application Development
* Software & Application Maintenance
* Testing
* Technology partner management
* Innovation (technology driven changes and solutions)
* Project driven work, often in an agile manner
* Test and Development environment maintenance



  





**Tasks and responsibilities:** 



* Ensure all software platforms in use are well documented and that operative tasks are handed off to Operations
* Ensure that all development processes and projects comply with regulations and internal policies and standards, including ISO27001/ISO9001 standards and GDPR.
* Maintain extensive technology supplier knowhow
* Keep up with market and industry trends
* Evaluate and consider introduction of new and emerging technologies
* Assess and plan for phasing out outdated technology nodes
* Ensure that build, test, and deploy strategies adhere to industry best practices.
* Maintain relationship and influence Group strategies, regarding cross BU support for software development.
* Member of CAB (Connexion Architecture Board) and provide expertise on Development aspects



  





**Experience and skills** 



* MSc/BSc in Software Engineering or equivalent degree
* Minimum 8 years of industry experience
* Experience from management and leadership roles
* Experience in Software development methodologies, tools and best practices
* Experience in Cloud based software architectures in general, Amazon Web Services in particular
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Swedish



  





**As a person:** 




  





 We are looking for a self-driven and results-oriented technology development and management professional with a positive and optimistic attitude. You bring a business- and sales-oriented perspective to technology.
 



  





 You are used to leading from the front and cooperating and collaborating well with others comes naturally to you. You are proactive, dependable and perform organized under pressure. At the same time, you don’t hesitate to step up and proactively take on tasks outside your direct area of responsibility.
 



  





 Working as a part of a team comes natural to you and you recognize the importance of the whole team working towards the same goal. At the same time, you like to lead the team towards success and make decisions when needed.
 



  





**Our Offer** 




 Telenor Connexion offers you a chance to be a part of one of the most interesting areas within the tech industry where the work we do has a huge impact on almost all areas in society. We are a fast-growing international company with great possibilities for your career ahead. Telenor Connexion is a flat and people-oriented organization with attractive job benefits where you have the opportunity to influence and build your role and make a real difference in building our brand.
 



  





**We are** 
 a team consisting of a diverse group of talented innovators, including platform developers, service engineers, data scientists and marketers. What unites us all is a dedication to providing our customers solutions and services that have a positive effect on businesses and communities.
 



  





**You will also have:** 



* Attractive and competitive bonus scheme
* Flexible and hybrid work policy
* Nice offices for collaborative work
* Training and development focused company
* Friendly work environment that recognizes each employee’s potential and value
* Talented and engaged colleagues all around the world.



  





**Placement:** 
 Stockholm, Göteborg or Karlskrona
 



  





**Application and contact:** 
 Please apply through our recruitment system Workday.
 



  





 If you have any questions do not hesitate to contact Martin Whitlock, CTO Telenor Connexion, martin.whitlock@telenorconnexion.com
 



  





  





**Deadline:** 
 The closing date for applications is February 16th. If you are interested, please apply as soon as possible as we will interview continuously, and the position might be filled before the closing date.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**About Mindler** 




 Mindler was founded in 2018 by two psychologists and a doctor with a shared vision of creating a world with improved mental health. Thanks to our dedicated tech teams, who developed our app and health care platform, Mindler has emerged as a leading provider, transforming the mental health industry.
 



  





 Our tech organization is split into three teams: Growth, Treatment and Operational Efficiency. All teams work full-stack across our different applications like the patient app, psychologist web platform and back office systems.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As an Engineering Manager, you’ll play a key role at the intersection of people and technology. Leading a team of 4-6 engineers, you’ll be an integral part of one of our three product development teams, working closely with the Product Manager to drive innovation and execution. You’ll report directly to our VP of Engineering, and together with two other EM:s form a strategic tech leadership team. You’ll have budget responsibilities for systems & services, team activities and individuals, as well as partnering with the talent team to shape your team and retain top talents. Additionally, you’ll take on a special assignment to strengthen collaboration with our Analytics team, contributing to data-driven initiatives and projects.
 



  





*Here’s some of the things you’ll do practically:* 




  




* **Team Leadership** 
 – Lead and support a team of 4-6 engineers, including hiring, personal development, and well-being.
* **Budget responsibility** 
 - Estimate, track & report costs related to systems & services, individuals & teams.
* **Product team collaboration** 
 – Participate in standups, planning, workshops, retrospectives, and process improvements.
* **Remove blockers** 
 – Streamline communication, refine requirements, and resolve team dependencies.
* **Finetune processes & work methods** 
 - Developing procedures to ensure that quality standards are met and risk is managed.
* **Provide know-how** 
 - Monitor system compliance with applicable laws and regulations, such as GDPR and PDL.
* **Manage third-party relations** 
 - Communicate with technical vendors, negotiating agreements & keeping track of upcoming changes.
* **Identify and drive your own projects** 
 - What do you think is important for Mindler to succeed on our mission to provide better mental healthcare?



  





**Our Stack** 




 Our tech stack is built with TypeScript and runs on AWS.
 


* Our patient app is built with React-Native & Expo, tRPC, Storybook, Jest, Detox.
* Our backend services use Node, Express, tRPC, Vitest, Kysely for PostGres & MySQL, Docker, CDK and Lambdas.
* For our front-end clinician interface and backoffice tools we use React, Vite, Vitest, Playwright, styled-components, tRPC & react-query.



  





**Who are you?** 




 You’re a people-first leader with at least 7 years of combined technical and leadership experience, who cares deeply about the well-being and growth of your team. You’re looking for a job where your work has a real, positive impact on people’s lives. While coding is no longer your main focus, your strong technical background helps you navigate complex challenges. You thrive in a fast-paced tech environment, easily connecting with engineers, product teams, and other parts of the organisation, while keeping the bigger picture in mind. You appreciate high levels of autonomy and responsibility, and enjoy working on-site most days and engaging in team activities.
 



  





*What you bring:* 



* **Leadership & initiative** 
 – You take ownership, drive change, and have the authority to make an impact.
* **Technical expertise** 
 – Background in software development, DevOps, or data engineering.
* **Cross-team collaboration** 
 – Strong communication skills to bridge engineering, product, and business needs.
* **Data-driven mindset** 
 – Passion for building a market-leading, data-focused organization.
* **Practical management experience** 
 – Hands-on leadership, with experience in team and project management.



  





**What can we offer?** 




 If you thrive on collaborating with talented colleagues in the office, but also appreciate the flexibility to work remotely, we could be a great match. We offer a diverse role that emphasizes work-life balance, including tech-driven social activities to drive creativity and innovation. For example we arrange hack weeks, music quizzes, board game nights, etc. There are also parties and physical well-being activities together with the rest of the organization.
 



  





 You’ll be surrounded by inspiring engineers in a dynamic, forward-thinking environment. This gives you the opportunity to contribute to a company on a mission to make a meaningful impact on the global market of improving digital mental healthcare.
 



  





 We are looking forward to hearing from you!
 



  





**Q&A** 




 Does an Engineering Manager at Mindler write code?
 


* Yes! As much as they deem fit. But not as much as our Tech Leads or Developers, and likely there are often other priorities that they need to prioritize before.



  





 Is an Engineering Manager at Mindler the utmost technical expert in their team?
 


* No, that would be our Tech Leads, and developers with skills in different areas. As an EM you’ll be expected to understand the technical solutions we implement, and be able to provide input in technical discussions, but also keep a birds-eye-view and have other perspectives in mind when making decisions - like product, business, compliance, and team well-being.



  





 Is an Engineering Manager at Mindler an HR position?
 


* No, Mindler has a People and Culture department that will support you in common HR questions. Although you’ll have staff responsibility for your team and be the first point of contact for many queries. Since you are the person working closest to your team, you’re expected to take responsibility for each individuals well-being and personal development.



  





 Can I be an Engineering Manager at Mindler without a technical background?
 


* No, since you’ll be a core part of the product development team’s activities, you need to have experience working practically with software development, DevOps, modern agile processes and system design.



  





 Can I apply even if I don’t have any previous leadership experience?
 


* No, at this point we’re looking for someone with a shorter ramp-up time, with existing experience leading a development team.



  





 Does an Engineering Manager at Mindler manage a whole cross-functional team?
 


* No, each product development team consists of an Engineering Manager, a Product Manager, a Tech Lead and a number of developers, and then design and content resources depending on team functionality. The engineering manager has staff responsibility for the Tech Lead and developers, while designers, PM:s and content editors report to our VP of Product.



  





*–-* 




*Mindler is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation or age.*

title: Teknisk testare/ Testautomatiserare
description:
**Teknisk testare/QA**
 Älskar du tech, utveckling och utmaningar? Är din inställning “uppåt-framåt”, snarare än ”sitt still i båten”? Bra, du har kommit till rätt ställe!
   

  

 Nexer växer och vi behöver bli fler i vårt team East Tech i Stockholm. Med dryga 11 år i genomsnitt i branschen axlar vi seniora roller, tar mycket ansvar och gör stor nytta hos våra kunder. Det finns stor passion för utveckling och vi inspirerar varandra att hålla oss i framkant med ny teknik.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har en passion för teknisk testning. Gillar att analysera testresultat och coacha utvecklingsteamen inom testområdet.
   

  

**Om dig**
* Minst 5 års professionell erfarenhet av testarbete.
* Erfarenhet av att skapa och underhålla testautomationsramverk för kvalitetssäkrade IT-leveranser.
* Gärna erfarenhet av programmeringsspråk som Python, Java, eller .NET.
* Erfarenhet av API-testning (t.ex. Postman, SoapUI, Ready API).
* Erfarenhet av frontend-testning med verktyg (t.ex. Playwright, Cypress).
* Erfarenhet av testhanteringssystem (t.ex. Jira, Azure Devops).
* Microsoft Services och SOAP/REST-baserade tjänster och verktyg.
* ISTQB certifiering.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med AI-drivna testverktyg eller ramverk, såsom verktyg för att generera testfall baserat på maskininlärning.
* Du är van att leda och ansvara för både större och mindre testprojekt samt är van vid agila metoder så som SAFe, Scrum eller Kanban.
* Du är en god kommunikatör och du behärskar både svenska och engelska.
* Du bor i Stockholmsområdet.


**Om Nexer**
 Vi är Sverige största privatägda konsultbolag med fina värderingar. Vi erbjuder en bred portfölj av tjänster inom alla områden av digital transformation – från avancerad analys och systemutveckling till automatisering och artificiell intelligens. Nexer har ett stort samhällsengagemang, bland annat genom Women in tech, Star for Life och Kodcentrum. Vi leder förändring och strävar hela tiden efter att hitta innovativa och kreativa lösningar för våra kunder och samhället i stort.

title: IT-Arkitekt
description:
IT
   

  

 IT-Arkitekt
   

  

 Har du en passion för IT-arkitektur och strategisk utveckling? Vill du vara med och forma framtiden för en av Sveriges mest framstående fackföreningar? Vi söker nu en IT-Arkitekt som kommer att ansvara för Kommunals arkitektur, dess förvaltning och vidareutveckling i en hybridmiljö. Kommunal är en fackförening med över en halv miljon medlemmar. Vi finns i fler än 230 yrken i kommuner, landsting och privata sektorn. Vi är en viktig samhällspolitisk aktör i Sverige och en modern fackförening med yrkesskickliga medlemmar och anställda som tillsammans arbetar för att tillvarata medlemmarnas intressen på arbetsmarknaden och i samhällslivet i stort. Som IT Arkitekt på IT-enheten kommer du att ha en central roll i att säkerställa en robust och framtidssäker IT-arkitektur. Du kommer att leda arbetet med att utveckla och implementera arkitekturstrategier som stödjer verksamhetens mål och behov. Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm, och du kommer att samarbeta nära med andra enheter för att optimera våra tekniska lösningar.
   

  

 Om tjänsten
   

  

 I rollen kommer du att utveckla och implementera arkitekturstrategier för både molnbaserade och on-prem-lösningar, med fokus på att stödja verksamhetens mål och behov. Du ansvarar för att leda och delta i projekt som syftar till att införa nya tekniska lösningar samt säkerställa att IT-arkitekturen är effektiv, säker och väl anpassad till organisationens krav.
   

  

 Du kommer att samarbeta med både interna och externa intressenter för att säkerställa hög kvalitet i lösningarna och ansvara för att förvaltningen och vidareutvecklingen av arkitekturen sker enligt plan. En viktig del av arbetet är också att följa upp leverantörers prestationer och ställa tydliga krav för att säkerställa att lösningarna möter verksamhetensbehov.
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Relevant akademisk utbildning inom IT eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete med IT-arkitektur.
* Erfarenhet av att förvalta, utveckla och implementera arkitekturstrategier.
* Förståelse för moln- och on-prem-lösningar, skärningar där emellan och integrationer.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av molnarkitektur.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av systemintegrationer.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av projektledning och implementering av tekniska lösningar.
* Förmåga att kommunicera obehindrat på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Meriterande**
* Kunskap om Agila arbetsmetoder och devops
* Certifieringar inom molntjänster, gärna Azure.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med CI/CD-pipelines och automatisering av deployment-processer.
* Kunskap om säkerhetsarkitektur och erfarenhet av att implementera säkerhetslösningar i både moln- och on-prem-miljöer.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med enterprise-arkitekturverktyg.
* Erfarenhet av att leda tekniska workshops och utbildningar för att sprida kunskap om arkitekturprinciper och bästa praxis.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med API-design och integrationer.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med IT-styrning och compliance, inklusive ramverk som COBIT eller ISO 27001.


 Vi söker en strukturerad och noggrann person som är trygg i sin roll att prioritera, koordinera och följa upp sitt arbete. Du är strategisk och analytisk, med förmågan att tänka långsiktigt och fatta välgrundade beslut. Samtidigt har du goda sociala färdigheter och trivs i rollen som lagspelare, där du aktivt bidrar till IT-enhetens uppsatta mål. Du är lösningsorienterad och arbetar systematiskt för att hitta och presentera effektiva lösningar.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med placering på Kommunals förbundskontor, Hagagatan 2, i centrala Stockholm. Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse. Kommunal arbetar aktivt för jämställdhet och mångfald i arbetslivet. Vi vill tillvarata depositiva effekter som en jämn könsfördelning och en ökad mångfald kan tillföra verksamheten. Vi förutsätter att du som söker delar Kommunals värderingar och inser värdet av fackligt arbete. Det är viktigt för oss att du ska trivas och må bra på din arbetsplats. Som anställd på Kommunal erbjuder vi dig ett arbete med kunniga och engagerade kollegor i en trivsam miljö med möjlighet till utveckling i linje med ditt uppdrag. Det är en självklarhet för oss att du omfattas av ett bra kollektivavtal som bland annat innehåller tjänstepension och försäkringar och ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag.
   

  

 Kontakt
   

  

 Vid frågor gällande rekryteringsprocessen går det bra att höra av sig till Jennifer Nilsson, rekryteringskonsult på Poolia. Har du frågor kring tjänsten, kontakta IT-chef Erik Ljunggren, 010 442 70 98. Fackligföreträdare är Yvonne Ahlin, Handels tjänstemannaklubb, 010-442 7153.
   

  

 Ansökan
   

  

 Du är varmt välkommen med din ansökan bestående av CV och personligt brev. I din ansökan vill vi att du motiverar varför just du skulle passa för denna tjänst. Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-02-28. Urval sker löpande vilket innebär att tjänsten kan komma bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdag löpt ut. Ansök därför gärna så snart som möjligt, eller tipsa en vän! Innan du ansöker ber vi dig att läsa igenom hur vi hanterar dina personuppgifter

title: Data Engineer
description:
På B3 Indes förvandlar vi data till värdefulla insikter som driver förändring och innovation. Vi skapar lösningar inom AI, Business Intelligence, Data Science och Automation för att maximera värdet av data och stärka företags konkurrenskraft. Vår styrka ligger i att kombinera passion för AI och data med en stark laganda, där vi stöttar varandra och löser utmaningar tillsammans.
   

  

**Rollen inom Data Engineering på B3:**
 Hos oss får du chansen att jobba med några av Sveriges mest spännande kunder och projekt. Vad innebär det? Jo, att du får:
   

  

* Gräva i och tillgängliggöra data som inte bara hjälper våra kunder – utan kanske till och med gör världen lite bättre.
* Göra företag mer datadrivna och smartare genom att guida dem i rätt riktning.
* Designar, modellerar och utveckla datalager som bygger på ett eller flera olika källsystem.
* Bygga och implementera avancerade lösningar – och faktiskt se dem göra skillnad!


 Här handlar det inte bara om teknik – det handlar om att modellera, tillgängliggöra och förvalta flöden av data som kan skapa verklig förändring. Vi gillar att tänka stort, experimentera och lösa kluriga problem tillsammans. Och det bästa? Du får ett team av grymma kollegor att bolla idéer med, lära dig av och ha kul ihop med!
   

  

****Det är din passion för** 
 data och analys som gör skillnaden. Utöver det ser vi gärna:**
* Har du en relevant universitetsutbildning? Toppen! Har du kanske skaffat motsvarande kunskaper genom arbetslivserfarenhet? Det funkar lika bra!
* Minst 4 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet – vi letar efter någon som har hunnit samla på sig en del erfarenhet inom området.
* Flytande svenska och engelska – eftersom båda språken används dagligen i arbetet.
* Tidigare konsultroller är ett plus! Har du jobbat som konsult tidigare? Då är det en extra merit, men inget krav.


**Men framför allt...**
 Har du djup erfarenhet av rollen som Data Engineer? Fantastiskt – det är viktigt! Men vi lägger också stor vikt vid din förmåga att se helheten, skapa användbara lösningar men framför allt att du är nyfiken. Om du dessutom har erfarenhet av flera olika moderna ramverk och utvecklarverktyg för t.ex ETL/ELT-flöden, Databaser, Data Warehouse, DataLake, Datamodellering och DevOps – är det ett stort plus.
   

  

 Vi ser även gärna att du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat i en eller flera molnplattformar – Azure, AWS, GCP.
* Kanske har du också lite koll på någon av de andra vanligaste BI-verktygen (ex; Power BI eller Qlik)
* Snowflake, Databricks eller något datalager automationsverktyg (ex: TimeXtender eller Wade)
* Viss erfarenhet av att arbeta med arkitektur


**Varför välja B3 Indes?**
 💡
 **Utveckling & karriär** 
 – Väx i en entreprenörsdriven miljö där din kompetens får ta plats.
   

  

 🌿
 **Balans & välmående** 
 – Vi värnar om ditt välbefinnande med stöd för wellness och en flexibel vardag.
   

  

 🚀
 **Energi & gemenskap** 
 – Här präglas kulturen av öppenhet, nyfikenhet och en passion för att skapa något större – tillsammans.
   

  

 ❤️
 **Vi bryr oss – på riktigt** 
 – Vi engagerar oss i samhällsfrågor och samarbetar med initiativ som Suicide Zero, My Dream Now och Pink Programming för att göra skillnad även utanför arbetslivet.
   

  

**En arbetsplats som gör skillnad** 
 :
   

  

 Vi är stolta över att ha utsetts till ett av
 **Sveriges fem främsta karriärföretag 2025** 
 – en utmärkelse som speglar vår energi, nyfikenhet och vårt engagemang för att skapa en inkluderande och inspirerande arbetsplats. Här värdesätts olika perspektiv och idéer, och vi tror att det är just det som gör oss starkare.
   

  

 Hos oss får du friheten att styra över dina uppdrag, din arbetstid och din utveckling. Vi erbjuder
 **konkurrenskraftiga löner** 
 , flexibilitet att forma din vardag och en sund balans mellan jobb och fritid. Och vi vet att
 **gemenskap är minst lika viktigt som teknik** 
 – därför satsar vi på allt från konferensresor och sommarfester till sköna AW:s där vi kan släppa jobbet för en stund.
   

  

**Om B3 Consulting Group**
*B3 Consulting Group är ett expansivt konsultbolag med cirka 1000 medarbetare. Vi brinner för innovation och hjälper Sveriges ledande företag och organisationer att skapa framtidens möjligheter genom digital transformation. B3 finns på* 
 tolv orter i Sverige samt i Polen, med huvudkontor i Stockholm. Bolaget grundades 2003, är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm Small Cap och omsatte 1 141 MSEK 2023.
   

  

*Vi är stolta över vår prisbelönta företagskultur, där olikheter, erfarenheter och gemensam energi värdesätts. Som ett etiskt och transparent bolag strävar vi efter att ha en positiv påverkan på samhället, människor och miljön. Vi är även engagerade i* 
 Women in Tech och initiativ för att stärka AI-utbildning för kvinnor. 2024 utsågs vi till Årets Employer Branding-företag, och vår HR-chef vann titeln Årets HR-chef.
   

  

**Är du redo att bli en del av ett företag där din passion för AI och data kan göra skillnad? Läs mer om oss och våra möjligheter här!**

title: Data & AI Architect
description:
Avanade is on a mission to become the top Microsoft Data & AI consultancy in the Nordics, delivering award-winning expertise and innovative solutions. We are seeking an experienced Data & AI Architect to join our team and drive this vision forward in the Swedish market.
   

  

 Avanade is the leading global provider of digital, cloud, AI and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Founded in 2000 as a joint venture between Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation, Avanade has more certifications, Gold-level competencies and most valued professionals (MVPs) than any other Microsoft partner. Every day, our 60,000 professionals in 26 countries innovate responsibly to make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.
   

  

**Come join us**
 In this role, you will combine technical depth, consulting acumen, and exceptional communication skills. You’ll engage with client C-suites as a trusted advisor while also guiding and sparring with developer teams. Your contributions will shape the future of Data & AI in Sweden while delivering measurable business value to clients.
   

  

**Skills And Experiences**
**Skills and Experiences**
* Deep Technical Expertise: Proven delivery experience in at least two of the following: Reporting solutions on Azure (e.g., Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, Power BI) with modern architecture patterns. Data & AI operational strategy and business alignment. Generative AI use cases using Databricks Mosaic AI and Microsoft AI Services.
* Strategic Communication: Confidence in engaging with executives and presenting complex solutions in clear business terms.
* Developer Engagement: Ability to collaborate with and mentor developer teams to ensure alignment and quality in delivery.
* Technical Leadership: Experience leading teams in delivering impactful Data & AI projects.
* Languages: Fluency in Swedish (spoken and written) is strongly preferred. English fluency is required.


**In Addition, These Will Help You Stand Out**
* Azure certifications such as Solutions Architect Expert or Data Engineer Associate.
* Experience with CI/CD and DevOps in Data & AI projects.
* Familiarity with modern data architectures such as Lakehouse or Data Vault.
* Cross-functional leadership experience in global or regional teams.


**About You**
**Characteristics that can spell success for this role:**
* Consultative, collaborative, analytical
* Resilient, adaptable, flexible
* Humble leader, strong negotiator, relationship builder
* Passionate about tech and engaging with and advising clients


**What You'll Do**
**Solution Delivery**
* Design and deliver large-scale Data & AI solutions that align with client goals and modern best practices.
* Provide technical leadership in at least two of the following areas: Reporting Solutions: Azure Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, Power BI, using modern architectural patterns (e.g., Delta, Lambda, Kappa). Data & AI Strategy: Creating operational models and aligning AI initiatives with business goals. Generative AI: Leveraging Databricks Mosaic AI and Microsoft AI Services.


**Client Engagement**
* Act as a thought leader and trusted advisor to C-suite executives, translating technical concepts into actionable business strategies.
* Focus on the Swedish market, building strong relationships with local clients and stakeholders.
* Support pre-sales activities and proactively originate opportunities by identifying client challenges and aligning them with Avanade’s capabilities.


**Team Collaboration**
* Mentor junior team members and ensure delivery quality across projects.
* Collaborate across teams to maintain excellence in delivery and align solutions with business growth objectives.


**Thought Leadership**
* Contribute to Avanade’s thought leadership initiatives, such as speaking engagements and content creation, to showcase our Data & AI expertise in the Nordics.
* Advocate for modern Data & AI technologies and methodologies both internally and externally.


**Learn more**
 Avanade is the leading global provider of digital, cloud, AI and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Founded in 2000 as a joint venture between Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation, Avanade has more certifications, Gold-level competencies and most valued professionals (MVPs) than any other Microsoft partner. Every day, our 60,000 professionals in 26 countries innovate responsibly to make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.
   

  

 To learn more about the types of projects our Analytics team works on check out this information
   

  

* Thyssenkrupp Materials Services uses data to help strike a delicate operational balance https://www.avanade.com/en-gb/clients/thyssenkrupp
* What matters to SSE Renewables is innovating for a sustainable future https://www.avanade.com/en-gb/clients/sse-renewables-ai
* Hachette UK enables employees with machine learning-driven contract searches https://www.avanade.com/en-gb/clients/hachette-automated-identification
* Marston Holdings identifies significant cloud savings https://www.avanade.com/en-gb/clients/marston-holdings


 Interested in knowing what’s going on inside Avanade? Check out our blogs:
   

  

 Avanade Insights – exchange ideas that drive tomorrow’s innovation https://www.avanade.com/en/blogs/avanade-insights
   

  

 Inside Avanade – explore what life is like working at Avanade https://www.avanade.com/en/blogs/inside-avanade
   

  

**Applications will be reviewed from Monday 6th January 2025**
**Enjoy your career**
**Some Of The Best Things About Working At Avanade**
* Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 years in a row), with exceptional development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally
* Dedicated career advisor to encourage your growth
* Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you


 Find out more about some of our benefits: https://www.avanade.com/en/career/benefits
   

  

**A great place to work**
 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you will get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look!
   

  

 We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Visit our Inclusion & Diversity page
   

  

 Create a future for our people that focuses on
   

  

* Expanding your thinking
* Experimenting courageously
* Learning and pivoting


 Inspire greatness in our people by
   

  

* Empowering every voice
* Encouraging boldness
* Celebrating progress


 Accelerate the impact of our people by
   

  

* Amazing the client
* Prioritizing what matters
* Acting as one


 We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Avanade believes that all persons are entitled to equal employment opportunities, and we do not discriminate against our employees, applicants, or job seekers because of their race, colour, gender, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity, or any other protect group status as defined by law.

title: Senior Data Platform Engineer - Rust
description:
**Why This Role Matters**
 Our platform is at the heart of our product, ensuring that everything runs smoothly for our 8,000+ users. As the backbone of the platform, the team primarily focuses on building a platform that enables continuous data retrieval, storage, transformation and exposing the data to the rest of the product.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who can bring fresh perspectives from various areas like distributed computing, data engineering, large-scale system design and architecture. We are right now evolving our platform and tech and you’ll play a critical role in our continued growth, with opportunities to develop.
   

  

**About The Engineering Teams & Role**
 Our teams have clear ownership of their product areas, making daily decisions in close collaboration both within and across teams, as well as with stakeholders. We work in small, iterative cycles, experimenting, learning and updating the product multiple times a day.
   

  

 At Funnel, our engineers handle everything from designing system architecture to implementation, deploying and monitoring our services. We put our customers first and always strive to design products that address their needs and go above and beyond.
   

  

 We are building our platform mainly with
 **Rust** 
 and in
 **AWS** 
 . We are using the most relevant and innovative open source technologies that are right for the job, while adjusting and building our own tech on top of them to be able to cater for our product’s specific needs.
   

  

**Skills & Experience We’re Looking For**
* 6-10+ years of experience with systems programming languages such as Rust, C/C++, Go and/or Java/Scala.
* Hands-on experience with cloud infrastructure and operations (AWS or GCP preferred).
* Experience in building distributed multi tenant systems, and challenges such as scalability, data synchronisation, fault tolerance, and inter-service communication.
* Experience in system architecture and modelling systems. Used to making architectural decisions and tradeoffs with your team.
* Familiarity with agile methodologies and collaborative, team-based workflows.
* Experience working in teams responsible for platforms/services with a high need of reliability and scalability.
* Good understanding of security and what that means for building safe services.
* Excellent communication skills with fluent English proficiency.


**Nice to Have**
* Previous experience with Rust or excited to learn and use Rust.
* Familiarity with Python, Javascript/Typescript.
* Experience with Amazon Cloud Development Kit (CDK).
* Familiarity with data engineering and data pipelines.
* Experience with Apache Arrow and Parquet.


**What You’ll Do**
* Design, build, and maintain scalable, reliable systems for handling large amounts of data. Such as data ingestion, transformation or exports.
* Lead and contribute to technical decisions that impact several teams and the platform.
* Collaborate closely with your team everyday and apply high standards for code quality and system performance.


**What Makes You a Great Match For Funnel**
* You’re pragmatic, preferring to make incremental progress and experimenting rather than wait for the perfect solution.
* You’re humble and open to feedback and hearing alternative ways of doing things.
* You view challenges as opportunities and embrace learning.
* You follow engineering best practices and stay current with evolving technologies.
* You enjoy collaborating together with other teams to find the best solutions.


 Learn more about our platform in this blog post by our CTO, Jonas Björk: Building Funnel’s Data Platform for MarketingAnalytics.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

 At this time, we can only consider applicants who are already located in
 **Stockholm** 
 and:
   

  

* Hold Swedish citizenship, or
* Hold EU/EEA citizenship and are currently living in Stockholm, or
* Have a valid Swedish work permit


**Benefits & Perks**
 We offer a competitive salary along with great benefits. → Take a look at our benefits here.
   

  

**Interview Process**
 We have a 4-step recruitment process for most roles → Get an overview of the steps here.
   

  

**Inclusiveness**
 Research shows that many candidates, especially women and individuals from underrepresented groups, may hesitate to apply for a role unless they meet every requirement. If this role excites you and your skills and experiences align, we strongly encourage you to apply. We’re interested in what you can bring, even if you don’t check every box.
   

  

**Office-first**
 At Funnel, we have an office-first approach, and we work from the office a minimum of four days a week. We have lots of flexibility for when life happens, during the summer, through the holidays however, we avoid having standing remote days.
   

  

**About Funnel**
 Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting.
   

  

 Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi-Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.
   

  

 Funnel enables a workflow that automates the collection of all the data the customer needs, easy creation and maintenance of a robust data model with the customer's own concepts and metrics, with an AI-powered model for marketing measurement, and beautiful reporting on top.
   

  

 All this without the user having to write a single line of code or even be particularly technical. Our vision is that the people who need data for their decision-making should have the tools to do it themselves - and not be dependent on their technical colleagues.
   

  

 Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.
   

  

 Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, London, Hamburg, and Sydney.
   

  

 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Integrationsarkitekt
description:
*Redpill Linpro är ledande specialister inom open source och brinner för öppna lösningar, öppna affärsmodeller och ett öppet samhälle. Tillsammans samverkar vi för att uppnå maximal nytta för alla. Hos oss finns några av marknadens främsta experter inom sina specialområden. Vi är omkring 320 anställda och du finner oss i tre länder på åtta kontor: Stockholm, Göteborg, Karlstad, Linköping samt i Köpenhamn, Århus. Oslo och Trondheim.*
**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Vi har mer än 10 års erfarenhet från integrationsområdet och är idag stora partners till MuleSoft, WSO2 och RedHat. Vi har flera utbildade och certifierade konsulter i området och nu förstärker vi vårt team ytterligare. Vi söker dig som, liksom vi, brinner för att leverera lösningar som bygger på öppen källkod. Till denna tjänst söker vi både dig med lång erfarenhet av integration och dig som är ny men nyfiken på området.
   

  

 Som integrationsutvecklare är din huvudsakliga uppgift att utveckla plattformar som möjliggör integrationen av olika system att jobba sömlöst tillsammans.
   

  

**I det dagliga arbetet kommer du att:**
* Utveckla API:er och integrationer med teknologier som REST, GraphQL, Kafka, Camel, MQTT, RAML och OpenAPI
* Ha tät dialog med kund, teamet och användare för att designa och implementera de bästa tekniska lösningarna
* Stötta kunder med utvecklingen av deras integrationsplattform och löpande säkerställa prestanda och tillgänglighet på applikationslösningarna


**Vem är du?**
 För att trivas som konsult hos oss är det viktigt att du har ett stort teknikintresse och en vilja att utvecklas inom nya områden och i ny teknik. Du drivs av problemlösning och förstår att det är samarbete som för oss framåt.
   

  

**Utöver ovanstående kompetenser ser vi att du har:**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning i datateknik eller relaterat område
* Erfarenhet av API-baserade integrationer och datatransformering
* Kunskap i Java
* Van att arbeta i agila team, gärna i en DevOps-setting
* Mycket goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska


**Meriter:**
* Erfarenhet och/eller certifiering i Mulesoft Anypoint Platform, WSO2 eller annan ledande integrationsplattform
* Erfarenhet av att kommunicera direkt med verksamhetsansvariga beställare och kunder
* Erfarenhet inom cloud, säkerhet, IAM och mikrotjänstearkitektur


**Varför Redpill Linpro?**
* Du får arbeta med några av de allra mest begåvade IT-talangerna i en organisation som brinner för professionella Open Source-ideal
* Du får arbeta med spännande projekt i flera olika branscher: allt från startups till globala jättar och myndigheter där du får vara med och göra skillnad på riktigt!
* Du får trevliga chefer som för en bra personalpolitik - våra konsulter är våra superstars och prioriteras alltid först
* Du får arbeta med den senaste tech-stacken och alltid vara up-to-date med ny teknologi
* Du får ta del av fördelarna att arbeta på ett medelstort nordiskt bolag med go sammanhållning, bra förmåner och där du ges stor frihet och flexibilitet i ditt arbete


 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du vill arbeta med oss. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Redpill Linpro is the leading provider of Open Source services and products in the Nordics. We are located in Oslo, Stockholm, Gothenburg, Karlstad Linköping, Copenhagen, Aarhus, and Trondheim with a mission to share knowledge and best practices for a more open society.
   

  

 We are passionate about open solutions, open business models, and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. We have got some really skilled co-workers here at Redpill Linpro, particularly within our main areas: API management, development, IT operations, data analytics, customer experience, cloud, DevOps, and automation.
   

  

**May the Source be with you!**

title: Dev Ops Engineer
description:
#### **Role overview**


We are looking for a Dev Ops engineer with experience in building and managing high-performing and scalable systems to handle massive amounts of transactions.  

  

Our platform is built on containerised microservices that we deploy in the cloud through continuous deployment. We are working with test driven development to ensure high quality and we can quickly implement new software into production. The future includes moving towards streaming data and "data lakehouse" architecture

#### **Main Responsibilities**


You will be part of a small and high performing team taking care of our Operational environment. You will take full responsibility for the provisioning, development and monitoring of our infrastructure, therefore a solid understanding of modern computing technology is essential and knowledge of cloud environments is beneficial.

#### **Your profile**

* At least 3 years of experience of Dev Ops
* Experience of working with cloud platforms (in particular AWS)
* Solid Kubernetes experience is essential
* You know how to work with high volume data
* You can quickly pick up an understanding of the business you are working with and are able to convert that knowledge into technical solutions that fulfill client needs
* GitOps, IAC, CICD, Helm, Python
* Linux (e.g. Ubuntu, CentOS, etc.)
* Webservers (e.g. Nginx, Apache, Lighttpd, etc.)
* Version Control (Git)
* Shell Scripting (sh, BASH, etc.)
* TCP/IP Networking (IPv4 & IPv6)
* Active knowledge of industry trends
* Excellent written and verbal communication in English

#### **Why us?**


Tradedoubler is an international performance marketing partner, creating smarter results for its clients and partners through traffic, technology and expertise. We help our clients grow their online sales and find new customers for their businesses and we help an expanding network of online publishers monetise their websites.  

  

Working at Tradedoubler is stimulating, challenging and fun. We pride ourselves in offering an environment where everyone can contribute and make a difference to the success of our business. Our employees come from all over the world, producing a culturally diverse environment where creativity, communication and idea sharing are highly valued.  

  

We recognise that our employees are the key to our success and with this in mind we offer competitive salaries and benefits as well as the opportunity for every employee to grow with us.

#### **About us**


Tradedoubler is a global partner marketing network that has been facilitating connections between result-driven brands and publishers worldwide for more than 25 years. We operate in 90+ markets across the globe and house over 2,000 brands and 180,000 publishers in our network. Our awesome teams are located across our 15 offices in Europe and Australia.  

In addition to Tradedoubler's core Partner Marketing business, we offer digital marketing solutions across the entire customer journey, including App marketing (Appiness), influencer marketing (Metapic), lead generation campaigns (Leadslab), & SaaS solutions (Grow by Tradedoubler).  

  

Tradedoubler was founded in 1999 in Stockholm, Sweden by Martin Lorentzon & Felix Hägnö, and has been listed on the Stockholm Stock Exchange since 2005.  

  

One of our strong beliefs at Tradedoubler is that our success stems from adhering to our core values: Make it Happen, Stay Curious, & Achieve Together.

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Location
Stockholm
Employment Type
Full time
Department
Engineering  




About Sana
We're on a mission to revolutionize how humans access knowledge through artificial intelligence. Throughout history, breakthroughs in knowledge sharing—from the Library of Alexandria to the printing press to Google—have been pivotal drivers of human progress. Today, as the volume of human knowledge grows exponentially, making it accessible and actionable remains one of humanity's most critical challenges. We're building a future where knowledge isn't just more accessible—it's a catalyst for achieving the previously impossible. If all of this sounds exciting, you’re in the right place.

  

About the Role
As an Infrastructure Engineer, you will support our engineering teams by building and maintaining the technical foundation that enables our products to scale. You'll work on cloud infrastructure, deployment systems, and developer tooling, serving as a technical partner to other engineering teams while focusing on reliability and performance.


In this role, you will:* Be the backbone of our ambitious goals, ensuring our infrastructure is robust and scalable
* Support feature development teams with infrastructure decisions and deployments.
* Act as Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) and continuously enhance our Developer Experience (DX).
* Design and implement scalable cloud infrastructure solutions


Your background looks something like:* Proficiency in both backend engineering and cloud-based deployments.
* Experience with highly available, scalable, and extensible backend systems.
* Proficiency in GCP, and Kubernetes.
* Track record of supporting development teams with infrastructure solutions
* Understanding of site reliability engineering principles


What We Offer* Help shape AI's future alongside brilliant minds from Google AI, Spotify, McKinsey, BCG, and Slack.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Swift professional growth in an evolving environment, supported by a culture of continuous feedback and mentorship from senior leaders.
* Work with talented teammates across 5+ countries, collaborate with customers globally and work in our offices in New York, London and Stockholm.
* Regular team gatherings and events (recently in Italy and South Africa)
