title: AI Orchestration Engineer
description:
### **Join Simployer as an AI Orchestration Engineer**



We’re looking for an **AI Orchestration Engineer** to help shape the future of software development. This is a unique opportunity to explore **AI-driven coding** and take development speed, scale, and efficiency to a whole new level.



In this role, you’ll **work alongside AI models, automation tools, and bots** to build software faster and smarter—without compromising on quality. You’ll also play a key role in guiding our teams towards **AI-powered ways of working**, leading by example and sharing best practices along the way.


### **What you’ll do:**


* Turn ideas into action – Break down product requirements into clear tasks, guiding AI tools to generate code, designs, and solutions.
* Coordinate AI workflows – Run multiple AI-powered development streams in parallel, ensuring everything comes together smoothly.
* Review & refine – Debug, validate, and fine-tune AI-generated code to ensure it meets high standards and is ready for production.
* Stay ahead of the curve – Test and integrate the latest AI tools to keep improving how we build software.
* Lead the AI shift – Help teams embrace AI-assisted development by sharing insights, running demos, and offering hands-on support.
* Keep things secure & responsible – Make sure AI-generated solutions follow security guidelines, respect IP laws, and meet company standards.
* Build for the future – Contribute to system design, ensuring scalability and stability as AI-powered development evolves.

  
Skills & Requirements


### **What You Will Bring to the Team:**


* Solid experience in software development and a passion for AI-assisted coding that is beyond curiosity.
* A strong understanding of user needs. You can translate customer stories into AI-driven solutions that actually make a difference.
* You are technically strong and have experience working with **Node.js, TypeScript, REST/GraphQL APIs**, and cloud platforms like **GCP, AWS, or Azure**.
* Experience with **Kubernetes, Nest.js, Redis, RabbitMQ, Jest**, and modern cloud-based architectures.
* You are extra curious about AI and enjoy experimenting with AI tools and have proven experience finding new ways to improve workflows.
* You’re eager to share knowledge and help teams adopt AI-first development practice and contributing to a thriving development culture.

### **What We Offer:**


* A supportive and inclusive workplace where collaboration and personal growth are prioritized.
* The flexibility to work from home or in our Stockholm office, based on your preference.
* Opportunities for personal and professional development with an emphasis on work-life balance.
* A team that inspires and supports one another in achieving our goals.
* High autonomy and responsibility, with recognition for your unique contributions.

### **Greetings from the Hiring Manager**


*Hi, my name is Peder, and I'm the CTO for Simployer. We have been accelerating our use of AI across development, in our products, and in our business areas at a high pace, coupled with building a world-class product and development organization, and we are very excited to open this position for you who can make sure we are working bleeding edge with AI across our product development teams, and with full executive buy-in. If you want to explore and help transform how we build software, you'll find this is the perfect position - I would love to hear from you and join our mission to become a leader in our space, both product-wise and as a product development company.*


**Our Hiring Process:**



* **Introduction meeting:** A brief chat with our recruiter for us to understand your background better, and for you to learn about us and the role (approx. 30 minutes).


* **Personality & Logic Test:** A short assessment to help us understand your problem-solving abilities and cognitive strengths via Alva Labs


* **Meet and Greet:** Meet with our CTO to assess your experience and skills, and for you to learn more about the projects we are working on (approx. 45 minutes).


* **Technical Interview:** A deeper dive into your technical expertise with our tech leaders, and for you to get a better feel for our team (approx. 60 minutes).


* **Informal HR/team Interview**: Before making an offer, we’ll have a final informal chat to answer any last questions and ensure everything feels right on both sides (approx. 30 minutes).



**We can’t wait to meet you!**



This is more than just a developer role—it’s a chance to help **shape the future of software development**. If you’re excited about working with AI and bringing new ideas to life, we’d love to hear from you! 

  


**Heads-up!** You might think an AI role means bots scan applications at lightning speed — but nope, we’re real humans carefully reviewing each one! This means responses will take a bit longer, but we appreciate your patience and will get back to you ASAP


  
**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------


Hybrid and flexible work model


Modern offices


Pension and health care


Laughs, develops, and celebrates together


HR tech company


Career opportunities


  
Simployer is a “people first” company. We offer a unique combination of high-value and people-centric products, services and expertise. Our simplifying solutions are the preferred choice of more than 15,000 customers and 1,2 million users in Northern Europe. For almost four decades, we have helped our customers unleash the full potential in people, the core asset of any company. Managers who want to lead better – by inspiring, engaging and developing their employees – choose our solutions. We are on an exciting journey where we will continue to grow our company into new markets in Northern Europe. In Simployer we have a culture where it is possible to grow, and to have a direct impact on the business through empowerment and flat structure. You will work with colleagues who are passionate about their work and we can promise you that we have a lot of fun at work. To succeed in the market, reach our growth goals and continue to fulfil our vision, we need top talent who shares our conviction that people make businesses grow. Are you our next Simployee?  



  

**Our Values**
**Learn, Lead and Deliver**
With every new piece of information we acquire, and every new skill we develop, we become stronger, wiser, and more capable of delivering good products and meaningful experiences. We will never stop seeking knowledge, for it is the key that unlocks the door to our greatest potential.
We are open to new ideas and perspectives, eager to make the next move. We are curious about way of working and stay ahead of the curve. We lead by example and dare to fail fast. We're on a fun journey, as a team and together with our customer.
We put passion and dedication into our work, because we know that every delivery is an opportunity to make a difference. We approach each task with our hearts and a drive to exceed expectations. We don't just deliver, we do it with a passion for both our customer and Simployees.
We embrace what makes us human, take time to play and have fun together.

title: Summer Work - Data Processing Tool Development at Climate
description:
Are you a student interested in the mobility of the future and curious about life at Volvo Cars? Then our summer internship can be something for you!


Each year, Volvo Cars welcome students as Summer Interns to our sites in Gothenburg, Olofström, Skövde och Lund. As a Summer Intern at Volvo Cars you can work in production, in one of our storages or at the office. Spending a few weeks in our team is a great way for you to get an insight to what life at Volvo Cars can be like and gives you a basic understanding of our operations. It also provides you with a strong network in our organization, which can be of value in your future career. The number of Summer intern positions and work areas varies from year to year.


**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------



At department Climate we are responsible of making a comfortable climate and secure good air quality for the car occupants. Our systems also support other components with cooling and heating to create optimal conditions for increased efficiency. We design the complete climate system as well as develops the software for controlling all parts of the system.

  

  

To improve the development of the Climate System we need support making data collected from cars accessible and presented in a useful way. During this summer we are looking for a person that can continue the work of developing tools for presenting and visualizing the available data for developers to speed up the process of increasing data utilization


**What you'll do**
------------------



We are looking for a self-driven individual that is familiar with data processing using Python. Also important to be able to listen in to the need of others and being able to attack problems from another person's viewpoint.  

During the summer you will be challenged with tasks like:  

* Communicate through APIs with data sources like Databricks and Snowflake
* Processing data both locally and on cloud services
* Develop tools for data visualizing using Python Dash and Jupyter Notebook


  

To succeed with the tasks not only do you need knowledge within Python scripting but also good ability to collect information from the intended users and being able to realize there whishes into working functions.  

**What you'll bring**
---------------------


**Required Qualifications:**  

* Experience in Python
* Experience using git
* Fluent in English
* Studying at university or equivalent level


  

**Meritorious:**  

* Experience working with Pandas module in Python
* Experience working with Dash module in Python
* Experience working with Jupyter Notebook


  

**Personal traits:**  

* Self-driven
* Service minded
* Curious

**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
---------------------------------

  

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.

  

  

Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. Applications are open until XXth of XX XXXX. We’re excited to get to know you!

  



**Volvo Cars – driving change together**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.  

  

And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!


Curious about Life at Volvo Cars? Read more


Curious about our story? Read more
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Solution Engineer, Nordics
description:
Every day, Global Payments makes it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our payments solutions for credit, debit, prepaid and merchant services. Our worldwide team helps over 3 million companies, more than 1,300 financial institutions and over 600 million cardholders grow with confidence and achieve amazing results. We are driven by our passion for success and we are proud to deliver best-in-class payment technology and software solutions. Join our dynamic team and make your mark on the payments technology landscape of tomorrow.


**TSYS Solution Engineer, Issuer Processing, Nordics**


Every day, TSYS makes it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our payments solutions for credit, debit, prepaid and merchant services. Together with our parent, Global Payments, our worldwide team helps over 3 million companies, more than 1,300 financial institutions and over 600 million cardholders grow with confidence and achieve amazing results. We are driven by our passion for success and we are proud to deliver best-in-class payment technology and software solutions. Join our growing Sales Centre of Excellence, and make your mark on the payments technology landscape of tomorrow.


The Solution Engineer role is critical to ensure we elicit a detailed understanding of the needs and pain points of issuers, crafting and articulating compelling TSYS solutions to meet these needs. The role is fast paced, varied, and requires deep collaboration with an experienced, supportive TSYS team. It’s an exciting time to join us as we look to grow our already impressive footprint across Europe.

**Job role summary**


Based in the Nordics, the Solution Engineer works directly with our European region sales team to support new name and existing client sales engagements, from early-stage meetings through to handover to our implementations team.


The role will include the following activities: providing day to day and strategic support to Sales on phases of the sales cycle including prospect research, preliminary call activities, Request for Information (RFI) and Request for Proposal (RFP), presentations, prospect visit management, and prospect meetings. The role serves as a liaison to develop combined sales strategy with other departments and/or companies and other partners (vendors) involved in the sales process for individual prospects. Manages all sales documentation and deliverables, ensuring accuracy and availability. Provides updates/reports of prospects to Senior Management.


The role will include travel to meet prospects and clients face to face, and fluency in one or more of the Nordic languages is highly desirable (with a preference for Swedish).

**What part will you play?**

* As the issuer processing Subject Matter Expert (SME), you’ll provide strategic support to Sales during various phases of the sales cycle.
* You’ll create, review, and/or lead the creation of proposal materials for existing and prospective clients, facilitating
* preliminary call activities, performing prospect research, presentation preparation, compiling and/or developing collateral materials, and/or meeting preparation / follow-up.
* You’ll run value proposition sessions with internal teams to develop strong, quantifiable and winning themes to build our responses around.
* You’ll complete and review documentation in response to a Request for Information (RFI) and Request for Proposal (RFP).
* Creates and leads pitch presentations to prospective clients, to include storyboarding and creation of compelling presentation material, and coaching of the bid team to ensure consistent messages are being delivered.
* Completes solution design work, addressing client requirements and working with internal technical and commercial teams to formulate a winning proposal.
* Delivers product demos against prospect requirements – working with TSYS Product teams to bring our solutions to life with prospective clients.
* Facilitates the development of sales strategies with other inter-company departments and other partners (vendors) involved in the sales process for individual prospects.
* Works in close liaison with Marketing and/or product owners to gather information and materials for sales offerings.
* Identifies coaching/mentoring opportunities and provides less experienced Solution Engineers with feedback and advice regarding sales support activities.
* Assists management with the coordination of strategic Sales Team activity that may not directly involve a client / prospect such as team education, trade show participation, etc.
* Compiles information and prepares reporting of strategic sales activities and key sales metrics for management to present to the executive leadership team.
* Remains knowledgeable and up-to-date on the current product/service portfolio and changes/developments within the payments industry. Maintains a comprehensive knowledge of all applications, modules, Value Added Products (VAP) offerings, and/or systems that are being sold by the supported Sales team.

**What are we looking for in this role?**

* Extensive experience in the payments industry – 5 years plus ideally, with a significant portion of this in issuer processing.
* Nordic language skills highly desirable – to C2 level, with a preference for Swedish. Must have good standard of English too.
* Good understanding of latest trends in IT – cloud computing, big data, APIs etc.
* Experience presenting to mid-level / senior audiences.
* Strong writing skills, able to clearly and concisely convey TSYS value propositions in proposals and presentations.
* Advanced ability to be an effective problem solver and act quickly to resolve issues.
* Effective listener and communicator who is able to be a reliable strategic partner to the sales team.
* Team player, helping out on opportunities across regions depending on work stack, and proactively supporting and coaching more junior members of the team.
* Effective relationship building, to grow both internal network at TSYS in order to create accurate, up to date sales collateral; and external network to gain industry / prospect insights.
* Strong analytical skills, able to identify prospect needs and develop a tailored value proposition and solution with clearly identified benefits to differentiate TSYS against our competition.
* Technical experience an advantage – knowledge of solution architecture, integration patterns and different SDLCs.
* Willingness to travel, to meet prospects and internal TSYS teams, growing your internal and external networks.


Global Payments Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Global Payments provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis protected by law. If you wish to request reasonable accommodations related to applying for employment or provide feedback about the accessibility of this website, please contact jobs@globalpay.com.
company_description: Our vision is simple: To be the leading global payment solutions provider to those we serve – our clients, our shareholders and our team members.

title: Platform Owner - Cloud
description:
Welcome to E.ON – where we drive real changes for climate transition. We take responsibility for a better future through stable and fossil-free energy solutions for people, cities, and industries. We are progressive and brave, while also being impactful and reliable. If you have passion and believe in the power of working together, then E.ON is the place for you.

**About the position**  

As cloud platform owner you will:

* Initially, work closely with our cloud team (currently 8 members) in a coaching and supportive role embedding our new cloud operating model, alongside the current team lead.
* Gradually, take ownership of the team’s backlog and roadmap, driving the team’s work to ensure our cloud platform supports our product teams and adds value to our business.
* Ultimately, assume accountability for the delivery and operation of cloud shared services at E.ON in the Nordic region and take over management of the cloud team.
* Develop and explicitly communicate an E.ON Nordic cloud vision, goals and roadmap in line with, overall business objectives and with E.ON’s group standards for cloud.
* Lead and ensure the delivery of our cloud-based shared services, including infrastructure, platforms, and software services, aligned with agreed Service Level Agreements (SLAs).
* Collaborate with and oversee our partners and vendors, ensuring they meet delivery expectations, handle patching and updates, and maintain optimal system performance.
* Act as the primary point of contact for our Nordic business units (application teams, E.ON central IT, Operational Technology, and business teams) regarding cloud technology.


Are you ready to lead and shape the future of our cloud journey? As our cloud platform owner you will take on the leading role in our cloud team and be part of an exciting transformation.

**Your Experiences**  

To succeed in this role, we believe you need:

* Solid experience in cloud technologies (Azure or similar), ideally with a background as a cloud architect, cloud engineer, or in a role involving vendor management and service delivery.
* Relevant certifications in cloud services (e.g., Azure) and a strong technical foundation, with knowledge of setting up and managing cloud environments and hosting.
* Experience managing roadmaps and backlogs, with the ability to work both strategically and hands-on to drive development and deliveries forward.
* A track record of leading and distributing work, preferably in an agile environment, with a coaching and supportive leadership style.


As a person you listen actively, engage smoothly in dialogues and act as a bridge between development teams, partners, cloud providers and other product/platform owners. You excel at building and maintaining relationships, both internally and externally with an understanding of business needs.

**What is it like to work with us?**  

In E.ON Nordic and across our group we are working on an exciting transformation, moving from traditional ways of working to a product-oriented model with a focus on innovation and efficiency


At E.ON, we actively work with inclusion - it is crucial for driving the energy transition forward. We want you to feel welcome! We strive to create a safe working environment with meaningful tasks and good opportunities for development. We constantly challenge ourselves to create a welcoming workplace where we hope you will thrive.


We work towards a more sustainable energy society, but it is equally important that our employees have the conditions to take care of their personal sustainability. Therefore, we offer great benefits to ensure your well-being and a good work-life balance. Some of these include shorter working hours than the industry standard, health insurance, free healthcare, and more!


Welcome to apply before 18/2.

**For questions about the position, please contact:**  

David Killander, +46 703 401979

**For union questions, please contact:**  

Hanna Rosen, +46 705 705254  

Akademikerna, Akademikerna@eon.se  

Michael Andersson, Ledarna, +46 705 250129


E.ON är ett internationellt privatägt energiföretag. 75.000 medarbetare i 15 länder arbetar dagligen för utvecklingen av tekniska innovationer och användarvänliga kundlösningar för den nya energivärlden. Vi är det första stora energibolaget som verkligen fokuserar på framtidens energilösningar genom våra affärsområden för smarta nät och kundlösningar.


### **Inklusion**



Det är viktigt för oss att personer med funktionshinder har tillgång till en rättvis ansökningsprocess, som ger dem en möjlighet att glänsa. Därför kommer vårt representativa organ för gravt funktionshindrade personer att inkluderas i processen från ett tidigt skede. Meddela oss via ansökningsformuläret om du behöver tekniska eller organisatoriska anpassningar under ansökningsprocessen. Vi kommer att sträva efter att göra de nödvändiga hjälpmedlen tillgängliga.



Om du inte har möjlighet att ansöka online och vill prata med någon personligen, vänligen kontakta din lokala rekryterare.
company_description: E.ON is an international privately-owned energy supplier.

title: ServiceNow Architect - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.*Are you a pro in ServiceNow and passionate about outstanding customer experience?*
In Tietoevry Tech Service, we modernize our customers IT landscape to drive efficiency, agility and innovation, and to realize their digital ambitions. Our customers are large Nordic organizations operating in various industries as well as in the public sector. Our aim is to become the market leader in the Nordics and the first choice for our customers’ business renewal. ServiceNow is one of the leading IT Service Management platform and a focus area for Tietoevry in the Nordic market.
We are now looking for a ServiceNow Architect / Senior ServiceNow Consultant to plan, design, solution, and deliver ServiceNow implementations in client facing roles.
When joining Tietoevry Tech Services as a Servicenow architect, you will:* Build and deliver Tietoevry’s ServiceNow implementation at customer sites in the Nordic markets while ensuring customer satisfaction and acting as the central point of contact for implementation work
* Advising senior client leadership on IT and non-IT service management challenges and developing technical solutions that align with their strategy and goals
* Overseeing the delivery roadmap, providing accurate estimates and timelines, and maintaining solution integrity throughout the process, including managing scope, change requests, and reviewing technical design specifications
* Collaborating with Tietoevry’s vendors and delivery partners to ensure timely and high-quality solution delivery
* Communicating effectively with both business and technical partners, and staying updated on industry trends, new ServiceNow features, and third-party solutions to identify opportunities and impacts

  

We believe you to have:* Strong knowledge and expertise of ServiceNow ITSM with good understanding of CSM and HR
* Good Knowledge about ServiceNow On-Premise implementation
* Ability to create client specific solutions leveraging industry best practices
* Working knowledge of architectural frameworks such as TOGAF
* Excellent knowledge of various common integration solutions
* Be able to communicate effectively articulating technical decisions to business and technical partners
* Fluency in Swedish and English language

  

Did we get you inspired?  

We look forward to your application! Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we will reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Amit Ambre, amit.ambre@tietoevry.com.
Hope to hear from you soon!  

*We perform background checks on all final candidates.*  

*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*  

About Tietoevry  

Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.  

Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiar yourself with what we do  

Creating purposeful technology to reinvent the world for good
At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Engineering Operations Technician , Data Center
description:
• High school or equivalent diploma 
• 1 to 4 years of Knowledge of key electrical competencies and theory; generic mechanical room infrastructure such as chillers, cooler units, and fan controls; backup generator systems
• Valid EU driving license;
  

AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help. 
You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion. (AIS tagline)
We are looking for a Data Center Engineering Operations Technician to join our expanding Infrastructure Operations team. Data Center Engineering Operations Technician is a hands-on electrical and mechanical equipment troubleshooting and operation responder. If you like to use apply your electrical and mechanical skills to solve problems, we’d like to meet you. Your work will help to maintain one of the world's largest information system infrastructures.
We are currently hiring Data Center Engineering Operations Technicians in our mission-critical data centers in multiple locations across Sweden: Eskilstuna, Västerås, and Katrineholm.
A valid driver's license is required for this role.
Key job responsibilities
SAFETY
Follow and maintain the highest safety standards and diligently encourage a world-class safety culture. As a facility owner team, ensure remediation of safety risks/issues in conjunction with other teams. Own the safety initiatives and projects to foster strong safety culture.
ENGINEERING & FACILITY OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE
Operational experience and familiarity with electrical and mechanical equipment, including Uninterruptable Power Supplies (UPS’s), Switchgear, Circuit Breakers, Automatic Transfer Switches (ATS's), Diesel Generators, Chillers, Heating Ventilation Air Conditioning (HVAC), Exhaust Fans, Variable Frequency Drives (VFD's), and Transformers.
o Troubleshoot events within internal Service Level Agreements (SLA’s)
o Take daily operational readings of all mechanical and electrical equipment through routine rounds/log-taking (temperatures, voltages, currents, etc.)
o Supervise contractors who perform servicing or preventive maintenance
Physical requirements
• Manual handling and lifting of equipment may be required (weight limits in accordance with regulations).
• Ability to work shifts (morning, late and night) 
• On-call rotation reaction to off-duty emergency calls (if applicable)
• Work at heights and from ladders; in a noisy environment with ear protection
• Perform physical tasks during the shift
A day in the life
Your day-to-day activities will include:
Monitoring alarms and systems that manage power, cooling, and fire suppression in the data center.
Coordinating vendor work on-site to ensure equipment is maintained and uptime is preserved.
Supporting other teams and sites during events and planned works.
Handling rack installations and powering up equipment.
Monitoring and facilitating the handover of new equipment.
Sharing knowledge and supporting new team members.
Participating in event response drills.
About the team
At AWS, we value diverse experiences. Even if you don’t meet all of the qualifications, we encourage you to apply. We welcome candidates from all career paths, regardless of your professional journey.
Why AWS?
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and widely adopted cloud platform. Our innovation in cloud computing continues, which is why customers ranging from startups to Global 500 companies rely on AWS to power their businesses.
Inclusive Team Culture
At AWS, we embrace inclusion and diversity. Our employee-led affinity groups promote a welcoming environment that celebrates differences. Through ongoing events and learning opportunities like Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and our AmazeCon conferences, we strive to continuously foster a culture of inclusion.
Mentorship and Career Growth
AWS is committed to raising the bar in performance and employee development. We provide extensive knowledge-sharing, mentorship, and career-advancing resources to help you grow professionally.
Work-Life Balance
We believe in a healthy work-life balance and flexible working environments. AWS supports your well-being both at work and at home, allowing you to thrive in both areas.
  

* Degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or relevant discipline + Professional Certification in Electrical, Mechanical or Controls engineering.
* Experience in operations of critical facilities (Heavy Industry or Data Centers) which require in-depth knowledge in electrical, mechanical, and control systems and Data Center engineering experience

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Qlik expert
description:
**Nyfiken?****Stretch Qonnect fortsätter att växa!**Brinner du för att lösa affärsproblem med strategisk dataanvändning och smarta integrationer?
Är du redo att växa med oss och göra avtryck på Stockholmsmarknaden tillsammans med Stretch Qonnect?**Klart du är, och vi vill ha med dig på resan!**
Stretch Qonnects framgång i Sverige fortsätter och nu utökar vi teamet i Stockholm. Sedan starten för 12 år sedan i Köpenhamn, har Stretch Qonnect etablerat sig på den danska och svenska marknaden. Vi är nu närmare 40 medarbetare som hjälper företag på den lokala som den globala marknaden med sin dataresa.
Vi använder främst Qliks plattform, som erbjuder marknadens ledande produkter. Genom vårt nära samarbete med Qlik tillhandahåller vi våra kunder expertlösningar skapade av våra certifierade konsulter och säljer även vår egen produktlinje av Qlik-produkter med namnet Qloud Cover, som används över hela världen.
Mitt i centrala Stockholm finner du vårt hem, ett kontor som ger en hemma hos-känsla med moderna inslag.**Vi söker dig som:*** Har ett par års erfarenhet av Qlik Sense och Qlik Cloud
* Är analytisk och lösningsorienterad med stark förmåga att kommunicera komplex information på ett enkelt sätt
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta med dataintegration
* Besitter kunskap om relationsdatabaser och datamodellering
* Har utmärkta svenska kommunikationsfärdigheter
* Är en problemlösare - du ser alternativa lösningar när andra möter hinder
* Älskar utmaningar, har driv och beslutsamhet
* Trivs i teamarbete

 **Vi erbjuder:*** Spännande och varierande projekt med intressanta företag i olika branscher
* Möjligheten att arbeta med den senaste tekniken
* All din utbildning du behöver för din roll
* Skandinaviska kick off:er med hela Stretchgruppen
* Frihet under ansvar
* "Lunch - and learn" varannan vecka
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag
* Förmånlig tjänstepension och försäkringar
* Ett glatt gäng som trivs & har kul tillsammans. Vi hjälper varandra i vått och torrt

  

Tveka inte att höra av dig!
Stretchgänget
**Våra svenska bolag**
**Stretch Qonnect**
**Platser**
**Stockholm**
**KONTAKT**


**Susanne Ohlsson**
company_description: Stretch gör skillnad genom att ha affärsvärde i fokus, leveransförmåga i toppklass och entreprenörskap i vårt DNA. Dessutom har vi riktigt roligt när vi jobbar tillsammans. Följ med oss!

title: Distribution Partner Account Manager
description:
Splunk, a Cisco company, is building a safer and more resilient digital world with an end-to-end full stack platform made for a hybrid, multi-cloud world. Leading enterprises use our unified security and observability platform to keep their digital systems secure and reliable. Our customers love our technology, but it's our caring employees that make Splunk stand out as an amazing career destination. No matter where in the world or what level of the organization, we approach our work with kindness. So bring your work experience, problem-solving skills and talent, of course, but also bring your joy, your passion and all the things that make you, you. Come help organizations be their best, while you reach new heights with a team that has your back.  

**Role:**
We are seeking an outstanding “Distribution Partner Account Manager” for our North EMEA region to help Splunk support and grow our distribution partners. The role has the primary responsibility to meet and exceed, quarterly and annual revenue quota assignments for specified distributor(s) and growing Splunk's business in the distribution channel. This includes the understanding of distributor business goals and requirements, and being involved in the presentation of Splunk product, solution and technology propositions to distribution salespeople.**Responsibilities: I want to and can do that!**

* Meet and exceed revenue and bookings quotas in assigned channel.
* Consistently deliver aggressive license, support and service revenue targets – commitment to the number and to deadlines
* Account planning and opportunity management with the distribution and distribution managed channel
* Lead sales efforts with distribution and distribution managed channel
* Enable distributor & partners in our selling and product methodology
* Recruit onboarding and training to new partners
* Execute partner/sales marketing activities aligned with sales quota (marketing, campaign, cross-selling, pipeline generation and quota retirement)
* Manage interface between Splunk and channel/distributor. Manage channel conflict.
* Interact with Splunk direct sales team
* Work with Splunk Sales RSMs and Channel PSM´s to build and manage demand generation and marketing efforts
* Drive marketing activities with complementary technology partners
* Ensure partners are driving towards certification requirements and Partnerverse compliance metrics

**Ensure channel/distributors meet and exceed goals by:**

* Understanding channel/distributors business strategies
* Communicating channel/distributors business strategies to relevant departments in Splunk
* Understanding and presenting Splunk value proposition (corporate, positioning, products, technologies, capabilities) to distributors and VARs.
* Managing channel/distributors product focus.
* Managing quarterly and ad-hoc promotional activities at channel/distributors.
* Training channel/distributors salespeople.
* Monitoring and reporting competitive activities and sales.
* Monitoring and reporting on distributor POS sales
* Adjusting sales activities and product mix as needed based on POS sales.
* Managing co-marketing opportunities with channel partners and third-party allies.
* Satisfy internal reporting requirements by submitting reports and records in accordance with company policies and practices.
* Participate in trade shows and make presentations, as required.
* Travel to distributor locations for mindshare, enablement and training

**Requirements: I've already done that!**

* 5+ years of Distribution Partner Account Manager in a fast-growing software company
* 5+ years of Distributor and VARs experience within a technology company that is similar to Splunk’s industry
* Recent and previous success exceeding revenue and bookings quotas in a distribution channel
* Experience identifying new resellers and prioritizing Distribution’s for a company’s team
* Success and references to prove the success from working with direct sales teams and sales leaders
* Experience strategizing and managing Distributors and exceeding goals
* Experience with analyzing and reporting actives related to sales and revenue activities
* Forecasting commitments and forecasting accuracy
* Fluent in Swedish and English (both written and spoken)

**Splunk is an Equal Opportunity Employer:**

At Splunk, we believe creating a culture of belonging isn’t just the right thing to do; it’s also the smart thing. We prioritize diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging to ensure our employees are supported to bring their best, most authentic selves to work where they can thrive. Qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

  

Note:

**OTE Range**


For sales roles starting salaries are expressed as On Target Earnings or OTE (OTE = base + on-target incentives in the form of sales commission plans).


Sweden


On Target Earnings: SEK 840,000.00 - 1,155,000.00 per year


Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. Please note that the On Target Earnings (OTE) range is a guideline and for candidates who receive an offer, the OTE will vary based on factors such as work location as set out above, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. **In addition to OTE, this role may be eligible for equity or long-term cash awards.**


Benefits are an important part of Splunk's Total Rewards package. This role is eligible for a comprehensive, competitive benefits package which may include healthcare and retirement plans, paid time off, wellbeing expense reimbursement, and much more! Learn more about our next-level benefits at https://splunkbenefits.com.

title: Technical Customer Support Consultant - Civil Engineering
description:
Title: Technical Customer Support Consultant - Civil Engineering
Job Location: Gothenburg - Sweden OR Sandvika - Norway
Working Pattern: On-site and/or Hybrid Working - Combination of Office & Home Working
Department: Civil Engineering (Quadri/Novapoint)
Do you have a keen interest or professional experience in Civil Design and Engineering? Trimble is seeking an experienced Civil Engineer to work with our customers to succeed in the transformation to a fully digital workflow, specifically supporting our Quadri BIM software and Novapoint design tools.
What This Role Is:
In this role you will be responsible for providing technical support for our customers in addition to project support and training. If you enjoy solving problems, helping others and developing yourself within digital tools, you will become a natural part of our team. We hope to find a curious person that wishes to be developed into a Subject Matter Expert in these softwares and takes pride in providing best in class support to our customers and the challenges they face in transforming how the World works.
You will work in close collaboration with the existing team and be mentored from the very beginning through an onboarding process, so you feel both welcome and supported. You will be part of a global team even though your office will be located in Gothenburg, Sweden or Sandvika, Norway.
What You Will Do:* Technical Customer support by phone, e-mail and remote access
* Be a technical advisor on Civil Engineering Software and services for existing and new customers both on site and in house support
* Help customers resolve technical challenges and increase/upskill customers product/software knowledge
* Perform software testing
* Creating FAQ’s, best practice videos and descriptions to help our customers
* Software online training and classroom training
* Project support


What Skills & Experience You Should Bring:* BSc or MSc in Civil Engineering (other type of background with a relevant experience in Civil Engineering will be considered)
* Service mindedness and a genuine interest to help others to succeed
* Communications skills in Swedish / Norwegian and English (written and verbal)
* Knowledge about Scandinavian design standards is preferred
* Ability to learn and adapt fast to changes and new environments
* Organised and analytical
* Road, Rail or W&S design experience
* Experience with Trimble software like Quadri and Novapoint is required


If you have some, but not all qualifications, and feel motivated to apply, we encourage you to do so.
About Trimble:
Dedicated to the world’s tomorrow, Trimble is a technology company delivering solutions that enable our customers to work in new ways to measure, build, grow and move goods for a better quality of life. Core technologies in positioning, modelling, connectivity and data analytics connect the digital and physical worlds to improve productivity, quality, safety, transparency and sustainability. From purpose-built products and enterprise lifecycle solutions to industry cloud services, Trimble is transforming critical industries such as construction, geospatial, agriculture and transportation to power an interconnected world of work. For more information about Trimble (NASDAQ: TRMB), visit: www.trimble.com
About Trimble AB in Sweden and Norway:
Join a leading company in the Civil Design and Engineering industry. Our offices in Sweden and Norway, are considered centers of excellence and knowledge hubs, developing software solutions for infrastructure projects. Our technology-leading solutions are part of a global product portfolio in constant development to provide world-class results for the individual user, customer, partner - and society. As part of our team you will contribute to transforming the way the world works. We offer you a welcoming professional environment where you have the opportunity to influence your own workday as well as the solutions and functionalities we develop and improve. For more information, visit*:* civil.trimble.seand civil.trimble.no*.*
Trimble’s Inclusiveness Commitment:
We believe in celebrating our differences. That is why our diversity is our strength. To us, that means actively participating in opportunities to be inclusive. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion have guided our current success while also moving our desire to improve. We actively seek to add members to our community who represent our customers and the places we live and work.
We have programs in place to make sure our people are seen, heard, and welcomed and most importantly that they know they belong, no matter who they are or where they are coming from.
Trimble’s Privacy Policy

title: BIM Coordinator
description:
**Description**


**Embrace Diversity and Innovation!**


Hitachi Energy's Grid & Power Quality Solutions and Service global product group is a world-leading provider of grid connections and power quality solutions that enable our customers to build a more sustainable, flexible and secure energy system. We leverage our long-standing technology leadership, vast integration expertise, huge installed base and global footprint to provide our customers with life-cycle value solutions at the lowest risk. Our customers are in the utility, renewables, industry, transportation, data centers and infrastructure sectors.


Our business in Europe has more than 1,000 skilled professionals focused on critical areas of expertise and is present in 16 countries.


At Grid & Power Quality Solutions and Service business in Europe (HBUEU), diversity drives our culture of innovation and collaboration. Our leading technology and strong market position enable us to achieve growth targets in the energy transition across current and growing market segments such as hydrogen, data centers and e-mobility.


Join Our Team!

**The opportunity**


Would you like to work on projects in the booming energy sector?


We are looking for a BIM Coordinator at Hitachi Energy, Grid Integration business. This role can be located in Sweden, Denmark or Finland. The preferred locations are in Västerås (SE), Tampere (FI), Helsinki (FI), Vaasa (FI), Middelfart (DK) or Copenhagen (DK).


The business line designs and delivers complete substations for distribution and transmission grids. In close co-operation with customer and other Hitachi Energy teams we deliver solutions to many segments, such as renewables, battery energy storages, datacenters, industry, utilities and green hydrogen sector. We are offering an interesting position in an international project environment and various development possibilities in the areas of BIM, design and engineering, research and development.


As a BIM Coordinator, you maintain design models, create documentation, and communicate effectively with global colleagues, clients, suppliers, and subcontractors. You will also sometimes need to create and maintain Building Information Models. You will also support and driving the Nordic Cluster Digitalization Initiative.


**How you’ll make an impact**

* Conduct 3D design reviews and model coordination meetings, clash-detection assist in the coordination efforts of all parties involved.
* Derive BIM modeling requirements and guidelines (incl. BEP) from contract requirements and for BIM use throughout the lifecycle.
* Manage BIM content development for projects.
* Create 3D renderings and animations when needed.
* Coordinate electronic information transfer and integrity of the Common Data Environment.
* Support project team by managing and creating content library files and templates, creating and enforcing standards and evaluating project models.
* BIM modeling and content management and creation which including 3D/4D/5D/6D models.
* Aid in the preparation and revisions of project budgets/estimates.
* Prepare periodic progress reports and presentations regarding the status of projects as required by Management.
* Be part of BIM Coordinator team to delevop BIM processes and tool usage in Nordic Countries and Europe.
* Train other teams in organization of BIM process and tools.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless project integration and successful outcomes in international project environment.
* Living core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues, and the business.

**Your background**

* Good knowledge of BIM cloud platforms specifically BIM360/Autodesk Construction Cloud and BIM requirements in Nordic countries.
* Experience in working mid to large-scale projects.
* Thorough understanding of BIM processes and global BIM standards.
* Minimum of a bachelor’s degree within a related field in construction or design.
* Minimum of 1 year of experience from Navisworks, and experience of Revit is considered as an advantage.
* In this role you need to be self-motivated and work effectively both independently and as part of the team.
* You need to be fast learner of new BIM tools and processes.
* Ability to manage time and deal with multiple projects simultaneously.
* Good verbal and written skills in English. Other language skills (e.g. Finnish, Swedish and Danish) are considered as an advantage.

**More about us**


Ready for a new exciting challenge? Apply for the position by 16 March, 2025. We will initiate interviews as candidates apply and position will be filled as soon as a suitable candidate is found.


For more information about this role, please contact Markus Kotisaari, BIM Manager, tel. +358 50 36 42719 or Anna-Karin Karlsson, Head of Engineering, anna-karin.karlsson@hitachienergy.com.

**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

title: Corporate Account Manager - (Dutch-speaking)
description:
**Xensam:** SAM DisruptersXensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.
  
We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.
  
About the roleAs a Corporate Account Manager at Xensam, you will be responsible for driving net new sales. You will play a vital role in prospecting, conducting tool demonstrations, delivering proof of concepts, and closing net new business. Furthermore, you will collaborate with our partners to expand our market reach.
  
Responsibilities
  
**Sales strategy:** Identify and pursue new sales opportunities within mid-market clients. Develop and execute strategies to meet or exceed revenue targets.
  
**Prospecting:** Identify potential new clients in the market and build and nurture relationships with prospects to understand their SAM needs.
  
**Solution Demonstrations:** Conduct detailed demonstrations of Xensams technology and services and showcase how our solutions can address the unique needs of each client.
  
**Partner Collaboration:** Identify joint opportunities and deliver comprehensive solutions with partners.
  
**Customer Engagement:** Proactively assess client needs and maintain satisfaction, and provide SAM expertise.
  
  

Qualifications
  
Bachelor's degree in Business, IT, or related field.
  
Minimum of 1-2 years experience in corporate account management, including net new technology sales.
  
Exceptional problem-solving and negotiation abilities.
  
Proficiency in using CRM and account management software.
  
Proficiency in using prospecting tools like LinkedIN Navigator.
  
Results-oriented with a strong focus on client satisfaction and retention.
  
Knowledge of Software Asset Management (SAM) is a plus.
  
Excellent communication and presentation skills in fluent English and Dutch.
  
  

What you get
  
A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
  
Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
  
If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
  
Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
  
An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
  
  

**At Xensam, our core values define our culture:**  

**Rebellious:** We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.
  
**Humane:** We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
  
**Harmonious:** We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.
  
As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.
  
This position can be based in either Stockholm, Sweden, or London, UK. Location-specific benefits will apply accordingly.

title: Staff Engineer - Node.js
description:
Do you want to be a central part of product development for the biggest property platform in Sweden? Are you eager to join a self-propelled, cross-functional team that works data-driven with constant user feedback? Join us on our mission to help more people find a place to call home!
  
What’s in it for you?
  
Take an active part in driving our tech strategy towards Node.js together with our product teams in our domain
  
  

**Innovative Approach:** Work with an experimental and iterative approach. Dare to explore uncharted territories, try something new, and surprise us all!
  
  

**End-to-End Development:** Develop and maintain our products from idea to production
  
  

**Inclusive Culture:** Enjoy a friendly, inclusive, and caring company culture where transparency, work-life balance, and well-being are high priorities. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, or background
  
  

**Lab Weeks:** Participate in recurring lab weeks—time for our developers to experiment, hack around, and evaluate creative ideas. Unleash Your Inner Mad Scientist—innovation starts here!
  
  

**Autonomy:** Be part of a team that controls its own product decisions
  
  

**Technical Skills:**  

**Node.js:** In-depth knowledge of its ecosystem and frameworks
  
  

**Web Applications:** Proven experience in driving architecture and system design, as well as developing and maintaining complex web-based applications in production environments
  
  

**Javascript:** Proficiency in ES5, ES6+, and asynchronous programming
  
  

**APIs:** Experience with RESTful APIs and GraphQL implementation
  
  

**Database Management:** Proficiency with relational databases like PostgreSQL
  
  

**Cloud Services:** Familiarity with AWS, Docker, CircleCI, and how to deploy and scale Node.js services in the cloud
  
  

**We also believe that you are experienced in:**  

Experience from data-driven product development with short and experimentation
  
  

**Team Collaboration:** Experience working in team settings, especially in medium to large multicultural/global companies
  
  

Matured experience and be proficient with other programming languages and eco systems. Meritorious frameworks: NestJS, Ruby on Rails, Typescript, React, and Next.js
  
  

**We believe that this will ensure your success in this role:**  

**Problem Solver:** Excel at solving complex technical problems
  
  

**Team player:** You thrive in a collaborative environment where we succeed together
  
  

**Leadership Skills:** Have experience leading teams and mentoring junior developers
  
  

**Ownership:** Can take ownership of and drive initiatives from start to finish
  
  

**What you will do:** As a Staff Engineer you are responsible for setting, aligning, and executing the Tech Strategy within the Backend Community with the focus on Node
  
Facilitation of collaboration between community members to set up and follow up on:
  
A vision for the craft, guidelines, technological KPIs, and ways of working in the community
  
Encourage and support competence development and education within the community
  
**Node.js Journey:** Play a central role in our Node.js journey. While we have some services already running in production, this is just the beginning
  
  

**Product Development:** Engage in all areas of product development—ideation, innovation, new development, iteration, and maintenance.
  
  

**Team Collaboration:** Implement solutions with the teams in the domain, deploying to production multiple times a day. Pair and mob programming are key parts of our knowledge sharing.
  
  

Your career at HemnetWith over 40 million visits each month, you’ll be part of Sweden’s most popular property platform – and one of the world’s most admired real estate platforms. But our size and reputation aren’t the only reasons why you and your 150+ colleagues enjoy working here.
  
Since 1998, Hemnet has been an essential go-to place for millions of Swedes, guiding them through one of life’s biggest transitions: finding a new place to call home. We’re proud to make this life-changing, often stressful journey as seamless as possible.
  
With access to vast amounts of data, you’ll have limitless opportunities to explore and create new features that enhance the experience for Sweden’s real estate agents, home buyers, and sellers.Our friendly Hemnet culture fosters a dynamic, playful environment where every voice is valued. Here, you’ll join a welcoming team that encourages you to thrive and grow, working alongside passionate colleagues from around the world.
  
A Hybrid Way of Working Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.

title: HCM Technical Architect
description:
We are looking for a Human Capital Management Consultant/HCM Technical Architect who masters Oracle HCM Cloud solutions, HCM business processes and technology. The Consultant will collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their functional requirements and will be responsible for the design and configuration of their cloud solution to ensure a seamless implementation & go-live.
  
  

**What You’ll Bring:**  

Your enthusiasm, passion for customer success, and dedication will help us become the leading cloud service provider. Your extensive knowledge of human capital management processes enables you to connect with customers' businesses at both strategic and operational levels. At the same time, your passion for technology, along with and your technical expertise and experience, allows you to dive into the technical details of our solutions. Combining these strengths in the most optimal way is what you truly thrive
  
  

**Key Skills/Qualifications:**  

Relevant experience with HRIS implementation consulting experience. Oracle HCM (Cloud) experience is a plus.
  
Understanding of HR strategies, operations, policies and procedures by having experience as HCM (IT) consultant, project experience, HR specialist or being in an equivalent position
  
Fluency in Swedish; proficiency in English
  
Relevant Master’s or Bachelor’s degree.
  
High level of energy, drive, enthusiasm, commitment, self-belief, and achievement orientation.
  
Entrepreneurial mindset with a focus on growing business.
  
Strong communication skills as well as a strong focus on customer success
  
Willingness and ability to travel as needed.
  
  

What We Offer
  
A driver’s seat in leading your own career. We give you the freedom, skills, tools and technologies to shape your future. Whatever avenue you go down, you’ll gain access to immense learning experiences and you’ll always be backed-up by Oracle’s impressive resources.
  
We offer an excellent compensation and benefits package, a good work / life balance and an international culture that is vibrant, dynamic and inspiring, helping you reach your full potential.
company_description: Oracle is the cloud leader for global business. Our technologies are transforming the world and no matter how complex, they have one thing in common: making our shared future better.

title: Product Sales Specialist Senior
description:
You'll be responsible for the go-to-market strategy of our Cloud computing business in EMEA. Collaborating with Sales, Pre-Sales, Product and Marketing leaders, you'll execute market development initiatives. This will drive pipeline, and lead sales programs. You'll close smart deals that deliver material outcomes for customers, and breakout growth for Akamai.
  
  

**As a Product Sales Specialist, you will be responsible for:**  

* Shaping the future, crafting innovative solutions that push the boundaries of edge computing.
* Partnering with engineers and product managers, diving deep into technical architecture and understanding customer needs.
* Leaving a lasting mark on the way the world interacts online.
* Developing a deep understanding of the Cloud Computing market.
* Driving product development and Go to Market initiatives, establishing Akamai as a Cloud Computing leader.


Do what you love
  
  

**To be successful in this role you will:**  

* Have sales experience in Cloud Services Sales (infrastructure and/or Software) in the B2B Enterprise market.
* Have a technical career history with a desire to move/have moved into a sales overlay role.
* Have cloud expertise – AWS, Azure, GCP, Digital Ocean, OVH or similar – is a must.
* Have a deep understanding of containerization and networking.
* Build trust by mastering sales, navigating complex conversations, and closing deals to improve customer businesses.

description:

title: Solution Engineer, Nordics
description:
Every day, Global Payments makes it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our payments solutions for credit, debit, prepaid and merchant services. Our worldwide team helps over 3 million companies, more than 1,300 financial institutions and over 600 million cardholders grow with confidence and achieve amazing results. We are driven by our passion for success and we are proud to deliver best-in-class payment technology and software solutions. Join our dynamic team and make your mark on the payments technology landscape of tomorrow.


**TSYS Solution Engineer, Issuer Processing, Nordics**


Every day, TSYS makes it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our payments solutions for credit, debit, prepaid and merchant services. Together with our parent, Global Payments, our worldwide team helps over 3 million companies, more than 1,300 financial institutions and over 600 million cardholders grow with confidence and achieve amazing results. We are driven by our passion for success and we are proud to deliver best-in-class payment technology and software solutions. Join our growing Sales Centre of Excellence, and make your mark on the payments technology landscape of tomorrow.


The Solution Engineer role is critical to ensure we elicit a detailed understanding of the needs and pain points of issuers, crafting and articulating compelling TSYS solutions to meet these needs. The role is fast paced, varied, and requires deep collaboration with an experienced, supportive TSYS team. It’s an exciting time to join us as we look to grow our already impressive footprint across Europe.

**Job role summary**


Based in the Nordics (ideally in Sweden), the Solution Engineer works directly with our European sales team to support new name and existing client sales engagements, from early-stage meetings through to handover to our implementations team.


The role will include the following activities: providing day to day and strategic support to Sales on phases of the sales cycle including prospect research, preliminary call activities, Request for Information (RFI) and Request for Proposal (RFP), presentations, prospect visit management, and prospect meetings. The role serves as a liaison to develop combined sales strategy with other departments and/or companies and other partners (vendors) involved in the sales process for individual prospects. Manages all sales documentation and deliverables, ensuring accuracy and availability. Provides updates/reports of prospects to Senior Management.


The role will include travel to meet prospects and clients face to face, and fluency in one or more Nordic languages is desirable.

**What part will you play?**

* As the issuer processing Subject Matter Expert (SME), you’ll provide strategic support to Sales during various phases of the sales cycle.
* You’ll create, review, and/or lead the creation of proposal materials for existing and prospective clients, facilitating
* preliminary call activities, performing prospect research, presentation preparation, compiling and/or developing collateral materials, and/or meeting preparation / follow-up.
* You’ll run value proposition sessions with internal teams to develop strong, quantifiable and winning themes to build our responses around.
* You’ll complete and review documentation in response to a Request for Information (RFI) and Request for Proposal (RFP).
* Creates and leads pitch presentations to prospective clients, to include storyboarding and creation of compelling presentation material, and coaching of the bid team to ensure consistent messages are being delivered.
* Completes solution design work, addressing client requirements and working with internal technical and commercial teams to formulate a winning proposal.
* Delivers product demos against prospect requirements – working with TSYS Product teams to bring our solutions to life with prospective clients.
* Facilitates the development of sales strategies with other inter-company departments and other partners (vendors) involved in the sales process for individual prospects.
* Works in close liaison with Marketing and/or product owners to gather information and materials for sales offerings.
* Identifies coaching/mentoring opportunities and provides less experienced Solution Engineers with feedback and advice regarding sales support activities.
* Assists management with the coordination of strategic Sales Team activity that may not directly involve a client / prospect such as team education, trade show participation, etc.
* Compiles information and prepares reporting of strategic sales activities and key sales metrics for management to present to the executive leadership team.
* Remains knowledgeable and up-to-date on the current product/service portfolio and changes/developments within the payments industry. Maintains a comprehensive knowledge of all applications, modules, Value Added Products (VAP) offerings, and/or systems that are being sold by the supported Sales team.

**What are we looking for in this role?**

* Extensive experience in the payments industry – 5 years plus ideally, with a significant portion of this in issuer processing.
* Fluency in one or more of the Nordic languages is highly desirable. Must have good standard of English too.
* Good understanding of latest trends in IT – cloud computing, AI, APIs etc.
* Experience presenting to mid-level / senior audiences.
* Strong writing skills, able to clearly and concisely convey TSYS value propositions in proposals and presentations.
* Advanced ability to be an effective problem solver and act quickly to resolve issues.
* Effective listener and communicator who is able to be a reliable strategic partner to the sales team.
* Team player, helping out on opportunities across regions depending on work stack, and proactively supporting and coaching more junior members of the team.
* Effective relationship building, to grow both internal network at TSYS in order to create accurate, up to date sales collateral; and external network to gain industry / prospect insights.
* Strong analytical skills, able to identify prospect needs and develop a tailored value proposition and solution with clearly identified benefits to differentiate TSYS against our competition.
* Technical experience an advantage – knowledge of solution architecture, integration patterns and different SDLCs.
* Willingness to travel, to meet prospects and internal TSYS teams, growing your internal and external networks.


Global Payments Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Global Payments provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis protected by law. If you wish to request reasonable accommodations related to applying for employment or provide feedback about the accessibility of this website, please contact jobs@globalpay.com.
company_description: Our vision is simple: To be the leading global payment solutions provider to those we serve – our clients, our shareholders and our team members.

title: Cloud Architect
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



**Kom och jobba på Sigma Technology Cloud- ett topprankat IT-konsultbolag inom molnlösningar!**



Sigma Technology Cloud är specialiserade inom cloudlösningar och är en del av Sigma Technology koncernen, ett globalt teknikkonsultbolag. Som Advanced partner mot AWS och Solution Partner mot Microsoft står vi starka på marknaden inom vårt område och kan idag hjälpa kunder av olika storlekar att skapa hållbara, skalbara och säkra molnlösningar.



Vårt engagemang och expertis har lett till enastående framgångar med en tydlig marknadspositionering, och vinnare av 2024 Nordic AWS Partner Awards. Ett starkt bevis på vårt engagerade team och vår ständiga strävan efter excellens i att leverera innovativa molnlösningar till våra kunder.



Vi är otroligt stolta över det vi har åstadkommit och söker nu fler stjärnor till Cloud-arkitekter som vill bli en del av vårt team.



**Om rollen**
  

I rollen som Cloud Arkitekt på Sigma Technology Cloud kommer du hjälpa våra kunder att designa, planera och sätta upp molnbaserade arkitektur och infrastruktur i AWS eller Azure. Med din tekniska expertis kommer du ha en avgörande roll i att skapa värde till våra kunder genom att skapa molnstrategier som möter deras behov och krav på prestanda, säkerhet, skalbarhet och kostnadseffektivitet.


**Mer specifikt kommer dina arbetsuppgifter innebära**

* Design, migrering och implementering av olika Cloudlösningar.


* Att jobba med pre-sales, workshops och erbjudanden



- Analysering och optimering av både tekniska- och affärsprocesser.



- Design och planering av arkitekturen för Cloud, hybrid och multi- cloudlösningar.


* Optimera och jobba med ständiga förbättringar för att uppnå Well-architect lösningar.


* Strategisk rådgivning med alltifrån att ge råd till styrelsen om företagsomfattande molninitiativ för att identifiera förbättringar på utvecklingsnivå.



**Om dig**  

Vi söker dig som jobbar som Cloud Arkitekt idag eller liknande och har en gedigen erfarenhet av att jobba med att designa och implementera Cloudbaserad arkitektur och infrastruktur på olika företag, med fokus på AWS eller Azure. Vi ser positivt på om du redan har certifikat idag alternativt har ambitionen att ta relevanta certifieringar framöver.



Hos oss pratar och skriver vi på både svenska och engelska så det är viktigt att du kan behärska båda språken. Som ansvarig för att hjälpa våra kunder i ett deras molnresa är det viktigt att du trivs i en roll där du får ta mycket ansvar och vara drivande i den digitala transformationen samt har ett genuint intresse för molnet. Viktigt att du håller dig uppdaterad om det senaste teknikerna inom molnet och vill göra allt för att kunderna ska bli nöjda.



**Vad vi på Sigma Technology Cloud erbjuder dig**
  

På Sigma Technology Cloud brinner vi för att ligga i framkant när det gäller innovation och kompetens. Vi vet hur viktigt det är att ständigt utvecklas och hålla sig uppdaterad, och därför investerar vi kontinuerligt i din kompetensutveckling. Som en del av vårt team får du tillgång till dedikerade utvecklingstimmar, utbildningar, konferenser och individuell coachning – allt för att ge dig de bästa förutsättningarna att växa och nå nya höjder i din karriär. Detta speglar även vår kultur där vi skapat en lärande och inkluderande miljö.



Sigma Technology Cloud är ett familjärt företag som gärna delar vår kunskap med varandra. Vi är experter på det vi gör och garanterar dig en inspirerande tid hos oss, där du får chansen att arbeta med några av Sveriges främsta Cloud-konsulter. Våra medarbetare är vår största tillgång, och därför är vi extra stolta över att Sigma Technology för 12:e året i rad har blivit utsedd till en av Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare, med en topp tre-placering enligt Universum. Det bekräftar att vi håller vad vi lovar och att vi verkligen bryr oss om våra anställda. Vår kultur bygger på passion, respekt och transparens, och vi gör allt vi kan för att hjälpa dig att nå dina drömmar och ta nästa steg i din karriär


### **MORE INFORMATION**

  



Emmy Vartiainen,  

0761155241  

emmy.vartiainen@sigmatechnology.com



* #### **POSITION**


Cloud Architect
* #### **COMPANY**


Sigma Technology Cloud
* #### **LOCATION**


Malmö, Stockholm, Sweden
* #### **COMPETENCE AREA**


System development, Operation, support and infrastructure, Software development, Digitalisation
* #### **PUBLICATION DATE**


2024-12-09
* #### **CONTACT**


Emmy Vartiainen, emmy.vartiainen@sigmatechnology.com, 0761155241

Upper Saddle River, NJ 07458
