 The salary level is agreed based on your qualifications and competences. In addition, we offer health insurance, pension scheme, lunch scheme and paid mobile phone and internet. We prioritise having various social events and gather once or twice a year with all employees across countries.
 



  





**Interested?** 




 If you wish to apply for this position, please send your CV and a concise cover letter to job@promark365.com.
 



 If you have any questions about the position, the company or the application process, you are welcome to contact Director of Professional Services Martin Krusbæk at +45 2826 9519.

title: Junior Python Developer – banking industry
description:
Sii Sweden is looking for a Python Developer to join an exciting long-term project for one of the Nordic leaders in the Banking Industry. This role involves developing and maintaining data-driven solutions within the credit risk domain using Python, Pandas, and Polars. You'll have the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment, leveraging cutting-edge technologies alongside your colleagues. At Sii, we offer a great work culture, professional growth opportunities, and training programs to support your development.
 



  





**Your tasks** 



* Build and optimize Python-based applications using Pandas and Polars
* Design and develop scalable solutions aligned with business needs
* Maintain and improve metadata structures, user access policies, and security settings
* Troubleshoot system issues and provide support to end-users
* Ensure proper documentation of data models, system workflows, and architecture
* Contribute to system performance improvements and code optimization



  





**Requirements** 



* At least 1-2 years of experience in Python programming
* Previous work with Pandas, Polars, and other third-party libraries
* Experience in Financial Services, preferably within Credit Risk
* Strong knowledge of API development, orchestration, and caching techniques
* Experience with cloud platforms
* Fluent English

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

**Do you find satisfaction in understanding how your technical expertise enables our business applications and by that be able to Power Climate Smarter Living?**
 We need to strengthen our cloud operations team with an additional
 **Full Stack Developer (Azure)** 
 who is driven by technical challenges and the urge to always find better and more efficient ways of delivering services to the customer.
   

  

 The Digital Platform Operation team is a multi-competence team, operating the Vattenfall Digital Platform; this comes with a big variety of tasks to ensure stable cloud systems. Those tasks are governance (ensuring architectural and security compliance), IaaS, PaaS, Network operation, Monitoring support, Azure DevOps support and capacity management. In the current Dev-Ops team we develop and maintain the self-services solutions based on cloud architecture to automate as much as possible and provide self-service functionality.
   

  

**What will you do?**
 You will develop and improve existing responsive web applications hosted in Azure, for resource creations and deployments based on tech stack : Angular (Typescript, HTML, SCSS), C#, .NET Core, Powershell providing an intuitive and user-friendly interface for internal teams to provision, manage, and monitor resources in the Azure environment.
   

  

 Your tasks and responsibilities:
   

  

* Developing and maintaining web applications using Angular, .NET Core., Azure REST APIs and azure services such as function apps, storage accounts, automation runbooks.
* Writing clean, scalable, and efficient code following best practices and coding standards, conducting code reviews, participating in agile development methodologies including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives.
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including developers, system administrators, and operations, to design, implement, and maintain cloud-based solutions on the Azure platform.
* Developing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure as code using tools like Azure DevOps, Git.
* Automating deployment, scaling, and management of cloud resources, leveraging Azure Resource Manager templates and Infrastructure as Code principles.
* Ensuring high availability, reliability, and performance of cloud web apps, monitoring and troubleshooting application issues.
* Implementing and maintaining security best practices, adhering to Vattenfall's information security policies and industry standards.
* Staying up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies, proactively identifying opportunities to enhance Vattenfall's cloud infrastructure and web portal.


**Location**
 Katowice, Gliwice, Stockholm, Amsterdam, Berlin or Hamburg
   

  

 Din bakgrund
   

  

**Who are you?**
 As our Fullstack Developer you have:
   

  

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
* Proficiency in front-end and backend development using programming language such as Angular and framework such as .NET , C# for building dynamic, responsive web applications.
* Strong expertise in Angular , HTML5, CSS3, TypeScript, ES6+, RESTful APIs, and build tools like Webpack, npm, or Yarn.
* Interest and willingness to learn Azure services, such as Azure App Service, Azure Functions, Azure Storage, Azure SQL Database, Azure Automation Account and Microsoft Graph.
* Ability to write clean, maintainable and efficient code.
* Some experience in working with relational databases (e.g., SQL Server) and ORM frameworks (e.g., Entity Framework).
* Some understanding of CI/CD principles CI/CD tools, such as Azure DevOps or Git.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a diverse, international team.
* Fluency in English, both written and verbal. Knowledge of local language (Polish, German, Swedish or Dutch) would be a plus.


 Next to this you bring:
   

  

* Understanding of PowerShell scripting for automation and deployment tasks.
* Knowledge of containerization tools like Docker.


 Mer information
   

  

**Our offer**
 Good remuneration, a challenging and international work environment, and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues. We offer attractive employment conditions and opportunities for personal and professional development.
   

  

**More Information**
 We welcome your application in English. We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website as we cannot guarantee that we will be able to process applications that are not made via our website.
   

  

 For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter Ewa Krajewska via ewa.krajewska@vattenfall.com
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation.
   

  

 The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall. The screening will be performed by a third party, Validata.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall is a European energy company with approximately 21 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.

title: SAP Transformation Senior Manager/Director - Accenture’s Nordic SAP Business Group
description:
Are you passionate about transforming businesses with the latest SAP technologies? Do you want to combine your business consulting skills with technology strategy expertise? If so, our roles as SAP Technology Consultant in our SAP Business Group are perfect for you!
   

  

 Join Accenture and help us deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity. Develop your skills and build an extraordinary career. You will play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world. Let there be change!
   

  

**About Our Nordic SAP Business Group**
 Accenture and SAP have a longstanding relationship of over 40 years. As the premier Nordic SAP transformation partner, we work with SAP end-to-end from product innovation to development and delivery. Together, we are revolutionizing the future of business through major SAP transformation programs with some of the biggest companies.
   

  

 Within our Nordic SAP community, we work with the newest SAP solutions and offerings such as SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, SAP CX, Ariba, SuccessFactors, SAP BTP, and SAP RISE. We are expanding our community and looking for candidates for several positions and seniority levels.
   

  

**SAP Transformation Senior Manager/Director**
 As a Senior SAP Transformation Manager/Director, you will guide large-scale SAP transformation and conversion projects for our clients, combining hands-on technology expertise with strategic vision. You will manage multidisciplinary teams, oversee end-to-end project delivery, and drive technological innovations to solve complex business challenges. Beyond delivery, you will contribute to business development, collaborate with sales teams to identify new opportunities, and shape solutions that align with our clients’ strategic goals.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**SAP Transformation Management**
- Drive and support complex SAP transformation projects from planning through execution, ensuring they meet scope, budget, and timeline requirements.

- Deliver high-quality SAP S/4HANA, ECC, BTP, and other SAP product implementations, upgrades, and integrations.

- Act as a trusted advisor to clients, understanding their unique business needs and tailoring solutions to deliver maximum value.

**Team and Stakeholder Management**
- Coach and develop a team of SAP consultants and technology specialists, fostering a high-performance culture.

- Manage cross-functional teams, including functional consultants, developers, and project managers, to achieve cohesive project execution.

- Facilitate effective communication between business stakeholders and the project team, ensuring alignment and clarity.

**Business Development and Sales Support**
- Collaborate with sales and account teams to develop new business opportunities and support client proposals and pitches.

- Identify upselling and cross-selling opportunities within ongoing projects, positioning our SAP offerings for maximum impact.

**Technology Strategy and Innovation**
- Stay current with the latest SAP technologies, tools, and industry trends, guiding clients and teams on best practices and innovative solutions.

- Define technology roadmaps for clients, aligning SAP architecture and landscape with long-term business goals.

- Identify opportunities to optimize clients’ SAP environments for improved scalability, resilience, and efficiency.

**Risk Management and Quality Assurance**
- Identify potential project risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure successful project outcomes.

- Conduct regular project reviews to track progress, manage risks, and adjust project plans as necessary.

**Preferred Qualifications And Experience**
- Experience: 10+ years of SAP project experience, including 5+ years in management roles managing complex transformations.

- Leadership: Proven track record of managing multidisciplinary teams, coaching talent, and delivering successful SAP projects.

- Technical Skills: Deep expertise in SAP S/4HANA, BTP, SAP ECC, Fiori, SAP Cloud, and related technologies.

- Business Acumen: Strong business development skills, including presales, proposal preparation, and client engagement.

- Certifications: Relevant SAP certifications (e.g., SAP S/4HANA, Solution Architect) are a plus.

**What’s In It For You**
- Work with some of the biggest SAP clients in large global implementation projects.

- Be an integral part of innovative SAP transformation projects.

- Significant development opportunities and support for progressing in your professional career.

- Rich opportunities to develop your business acumen, consulting toolbox, technical and professional skills.

- Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization, including implementation methodologies, knowledge databases, top industry add-on software, expert network, and benchmarks.

- A dedicated mentor to guide you during your work with continuous feedback.

- Being part of our culture and core values in a truly human work environment.

- Utilize your functional and technical expertise in SAP technology by investigating, designing, and implementing business processes supported by SAP best practice solutions.

- Take part in our highly engaged and diverse global network for collaboration and delivery.

- Appealing compensation and benefits.

- Help clients’ sustainability agenda through SAP transformations.

- Be a valuable member of our Nordic SAP technology Value Tower and contribute to thought leadership, professional development, and sales initiatives.

 Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from a diverse group of backgrounds related to gender, age, ethnicity, culture, race, religion and belief, disability, nationality, sexual orientation, and gender identity. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values, providing an environment where everyone brings distinct experience, talent, and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity.

title: Enterprise Services Sales Manager Scandinavia
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Hospitals and Health Care, and Biotechnology Research
description:
Join us in pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably.
   

  

 Our inspiring and caring environment forms a global community that celebrates diversity and individuality. We encourage you to step beyond your comfort zone, offering resources and flexibility to foster your professional and personal growth, all while valuing your unique contributions.
   

  

 Apply now for the position of
 **Enterprise Services Sales Manager for our Scandinavian region. Role to be located within Scandinavian region. This position reports to the Head of Enterprise Services, Nordic and Baltic Countries** 
 .
   

  

 In our Enterprise Services team, you will enjoy purposeful work. Our ambition is to establish long-term goal-oriented partnerships, the essence of which is value creation for the benefit of patients and healthcare professionals. Let’s transform healthcare together!
   

  

 You will act as part of the Enterprise Services team in the Nordic and Baltic countries, developing new business opportunities in an independent and self-driven manner in the Scandinavian countries.
   

  

 You will connect with healthcare decision makers and leaders to introduce innovative partnership solutions tailored to the customer needs. Your aim will be to advocate Siemens Healthineers as a trusted partner and create long-term Value Partnerships.
   

  

 Focus will be mainly on Scandinavian market but also flexible to contribute to Nordic and Baltic zone (NRB) as required.
   

  

**Your tasks and responsibilities:**
* Leverage your knowledge of clinical practices and workflows, as well as the latest technology innovations, to create unique offerings that support transformational change in the healthcare.
* Work in close collaboration with the Sales and Account Manager teams, to develop unique offerings, combining different businesses and solutions, for each specific customer need.
* Conduct customer meetings and partner with cross-functional team work to create solutions, funnel and bid management.
* Develop and present business cases, public tendering, and take care of various sales process related tasks.


 This is an individual contributor role, therefore it does not have direct team reports. However, leadership responsibilities will be required, to define and lead projects.
   

  

**Your expertise:**
* Previous experience working within from healthcare industry; to allow for in-depth knowledge of the present operating environment, challenges, as well as future trends of healthcare.
* Sales/Business Development experience, preferably from consultant work within the healthcare market.
* Familiar with diagnostic technology and eager to leverage latest innovations for better care
* University degree and/or education in Engineering/Economics/Management/Healthcare.
* Fluent English language skills, both written and spoken, as well as fluency in one or more of the Scandinavian countries.


 Your attributes and skills:
   

  

* Customer centered, well networked, and strong interpersonal and communication skills.
* Curious and enjoy exploring new business models and opportunities.
* Entrepreneurial, result-driven attitude and perseverance.
* Team player, with a willingness to grow personally and professionally as part of diverse and multicultural teams.
* Solution-oriented, capable of handling complex tasks in a collaborative manner.
* Ability to work independently with high level of self-leadership, but still with the ability of inclusion and engagement.
* Ability to autonomously drive your business forward with high level of accountability, even when obstacles arise and without all details in place.
* Strong presentation skills.
* Willingness to travel, mainly throughout the geographic area of Scandinavia.


**Who we are:**
 We are a team of more than 71,000 highly dedicated Healthineers in more than 70 countries. As a leader in medical technology, we constantly push the boundaries to create better outcomes and experiences for patients, no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.
   

  

**How we work:**
 When you join Siemens Healthineers, you become one in a global team of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists, who believe in each individual’s potential to contribute with diverse ideas. We are from different backgrounds, cultures, religions, political and/or sexual orientations, and work together, to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enable access to care, united by one purpose: to pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably. Check our Careers Site at Jobs & careers (siemens-healthineers.com)
   

  

 As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from individuals with disabilities
   

  

 We care about your data privacy and take compliance with GDPR as well as other data protection legislation seriously. For this reason, we ask you not to send us your CV or resume by email. Please create a profile within our talent community and subscribe to personalized job alert that will keep you posted about new opportunities.
   

  

**To all recruitment agencies:**
 Siemens Healthineers' recruitment is internally managed, with external support permitted only when a qualified supplier has established a formal contract with us. Unsolicited candidate submissions and referrals, absent a current supplier contract, do not establish consent and are ineligible for fees. We delete and destroy unsolicited information, thus, would recommend you refrain from any such practices. Your adherence to our policies is appreciated.

title: Manager Embedded Systems
description:
Science Services Division is the part of SSC that develop scientific payloads, provide launch services for rockets and stratospheric balloons as well as services for testing of space systems and reusable rockets. Our customers are space organizations, scientists, corporations, and institutes of higher education. Payloads and Flight Systems department is a team of engineers mainly developing and launching scientific experiments and supportive systems for sounding rockets, balloons, and other space platforms. Projects for the team are typically short (1-2 years) and often run from initial study phases through development to actual launch and operations.
   

  

 Payloads & Flight Systems are introducing three sections for the main areas of disciplines within the team, Projects & Systems, Embedded Systems & Mechanical Systems. We are now looking for an experienced project manager or system engineer to shoulder the role of leading the Embedded Systems team of approximately 5-7 engineers.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
 You will be the operational manager for a small team of engineers with focus on development of embedded systems and other avionics and electronics. You will share your time between operational activities withing your area of expertise and managing the team. As a member of the Payloads & Flight Systems management team, you will report to the Manager of Payloads & Flight Systems.
   

  

 In your management role you will be responsible for maintaining, develop and organize methodology and tools within the units’ operational disciplines and roadmaps. You will also in close collaboration with project management be responsible for planning the resources of your unit and providing projects with correct talent and solutions. Recruitment and personnel development is also a part of the task as well as work environment responsibility, as delegated.
   

  

 The position includes work at our office and lab in Solna as well as business travel.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 To thrive at this position, you are a mature and stable person enjoying responsibility and cooperating with engineers in all technical fields, to achieve goals. You have a holistic eye and are decisive when needed.
   

  

 To enjoy the position as Manager for Embedded Systems you like working with creative people in an international setting. You have leadership experience of managing engineering teams in solving complex problems as line manager, project manager or system engineer. We believe you have a university degree in a technical field or equivalent work experience. We also believe you have knowledge and experience in space technology and sounding rocket payload engineering in particular. You technical expertise should be within the disciplines of embedded systems, software & electronics development.
   

  

 Since you will work with both costumers and colleagues globally, you are proficient in English, both oral and in writing.
   

  

**WE OFFER YOU**
* a unique opportunity to be part of the exciting space industry
* an excellent opportunity for personal development and challenging tasks
* a workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and proud employees all over the world
* to be part of our team of talented engineers who works with important services so that Earth can benefit from space


**We are professionals in Space, here is a chance to become our new Star!**
 Your experience together with your personal abilities will be critical to our success. If you have the right professional and individual skills, please don’t hesitate to send in your application already today!
   

  

**LOCATION**
 The position is in our Solna location/Stockholm.
   

  

**NEXT STEP**
 Are you interested in this challenging position within an international work environment in a successful company? Apply now! We evaluate all applications continuously. Please apply using your CV by clicking the apply button below.
   

  

 This position requires a background control and security interview before employment.

title: Business Development Strategist
description:
**Voyado** 
 is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, the Voyado customer experience cloud makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.
   

  

 With a solid foundation in business development, we are now scaling to the next level—and we need you to help make it happen!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Business Development Strategist, you will be at the heart of Voyado’s growth strategy, leading high-priority strategic projects, ensuring execution, and aligning key stakeholders. This is not a back-office role—you’ll be actively engaging across teams, driving initiatives forward, and making things happen.
   

  

 From M&A and corporate development to data-driven market evaluations, this role offers a unique opportunity to work on projects that shape the future of our company.
   

  

 Your work will be dynamic, fast-paced, and highly collaborative, involving daily interactions with leaders and teams across the organization. Expect a mix of strategic execution, stakeholder engagement, and hands-on problem-solving.
   

  

**What you'll be up to:**
* Lead and execute high-impact strategic projects – Ensure alignment, progress, and business impact.
* Identify business opportunities – Engage with teams to surface and act on key initiatives.
* Drive M&A and corporate development – Support acquisitions, assess market opportunities, drive strategic evaluations, and actively participate in post-merger integration.
* Analyze data for business insights – Monitor key metrics, trends, and market shifts.
* Manage stakeholders across functions – Secure buy-in and drive seamless execution of key initiatives.


 So, who are you?
   

  

 You’re a proactive, social, and highly structured problem-solver who thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth environment. You know how to navigate complex organizations, engage stakeholders, and ensure things get done—even in ambiguous situations.
   

  

**Skills and Experience:**
* Project management – Proven experience of leading complex projects from strategy to execution.
* Stakeholder management – Ability to engage and influence cross-functional teams.
* Business acumen – Strong ability to identify and drive strategic opportunities.
* M&A & corporate development – Experience in acquisitions, due diligence, or integration.
* Data-driven decision-making – Used to use insights to drive business impact.
* Adaptability in fast-paced environments – Comfortable managing multiple priorities in a scaling company.


 If you’re a business-savvy strategist who loves solving complex challenges, pushing initiatives forward, and creating real impact, this is the role for you!
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 Voyado is a Swedish purpose-driven company with 300+ Voyadoers where every opinion is recognized and where you’ll be successful when putting the customers first. Here, you'll get the opportunity to work self-driven with strong support that you can leverage at any time. We really care for our Voyadoers and put a lot of time and effort into keeping and nurturing our knowledge-sharing and friendly culture. We’re personal and that extends into everything about us. Read more on what it’s like to work at Voyado
 **here** 
 .
   

  

 Some of our benefits:
   

  

* 30 days of vacation, so you can spend time on the things you love
* A generous gadget-and-phone package (your choice!)
* 5000 SEK per year in wellness allowance
* A wellness hour you can use every week
* Beneficial bike lease, including e-bikes
* Breakfast buffet on Fridays


 Ready to join the team and make an impact?
   

  

 Lovely!🎉
   

  

 Applying is super easy. Use your LinkedIn profile (or upload a resume) and answer a few click-in questions (no data entry, we promise). We'd love to get to know you and understand what makes you tick, so write a few lines about what you enjoy about your role and what would be an exciting challenge for you going forward. We are eager to get to know you and what you love to do, so be yourself and let that shine through in your application!
   

  

 Additional information
   

  

 We conduct a background check on the final candidate as part of our recruitment process. We use background checks from
 **Scandinavian Recruitment Intelligence** 
 .
 **Here** 
 you can read more about how a background check is done.
   

  

 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, the Voyado customer experience cloud makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.

title: Styrkonsult
description:
Är du tekniskt intresserad och brinner för innovation inom fastighetsautomation? Vill du vara med och skapa energieffektiva lösningar för moderna och komplexa fastighetssystem? Då kanske rollen som Styrkonsult hos Exengo är något för dig!
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




  





 Som Styrkonsult på Exengo kommer du att vara en del av vårt team inom fastighetsautomation. I din roll ansvarar du för att utveckla, projektera och konstruera tekniska lösningar för styr- och övervakningssystem i både nya och befintliga fastigheter. Du kommer att arbeta i nära samarbete med andra duktiga projektörer inom el, VVS, belysning och energi för att skapa skräddarsydda systemlösningar som är både effektiva och användarvänliga.
 



  





**I detta ansvar ingår det exempelvis att:** 




  




* Genomföra kartläggningar och inventeringar av befintliga byggnader för att identifiera åtgärder som behövs för att skapa energieffektiva system.
* Ansvara för projektering av styr- och övervakningssystem för en mängd olika fastigheter, som exempelvis kontor, hotell, skolor, idrottsanläggningar, sjukhus, laboratorier, köpcentrum, och industriella anläggningar.
* Säkerställa att systemlösningarna är tekniskt genomtänkta och bidrar till långsiktig energibesparing med ett mervärde för våra kunder.
* Arbeta med både tekniska och funktionella aspekter för att skapa logiska och lättanvända system för förvaltningsskedet.
* Ge rådgivning och stöd vid upphandling av entreprenader samt vid provning och besiktning av system.



  





 Du rapporterar till VD och utgår ifrån kontoret på Rehnsgatan 11 i Vasastan.
 



  





 Arbetet kan komma att utföras i säkerhetsklassade byggnader, vilket innebär att säkerhetsprövning kan komma att genomföras i samband med anställningen.
 



  





**Är det här du?** 




  





 För att vara framgångsrik i denna roll krävs det att du har:
 



  




* En högskoleutbildning inom relevant område eller motsvarande erfarenhet från arbete som entreprenör eller styrkonsult.
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet inom fastighetsautomation, gärna med erfarenhet av olika kommunikationsbussar, DUC/PLC, DHC/SCADA och systemuppbyggnader inom VVS och El.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med tekniska system inom fastighetsautomation och energibesparing.
* Förmåga att uttrycka dig väl på svenska både i tal och skrift.



  





 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper vilka också kommer att vara avgörande för att bli framgångsrik i denna tjänst. Vi söker dig som är serviceinriktad, problemlösande och ansvarstagande. Du är strukturerad och effektiv och uppskattar att samarbeta med dina kollegor.
 



  





**Vill du veta mer?** 




  





 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Exengo med Level Recruitment. Vänligen sök tjänsten genom att klicka på "ansök"-knappen här intill. Vid frågor vänligen kontakta rekryteringskonsult Kamilla Envall på 08-120 50 432 eller, Senior rekryteringskonsult Lynn Sjöberg Westander 08-120 50 431. Urvalet av ansökningar sker löpande. Välkommen in med din ansökan!

title: PhD Position in Trustworthy Generative AI
description:
Shape the Future of AI!  

Are you passionate about artificial intelligence and its impact on society? Join our dynamic research team and develop the skills to conduct independent, groudbreaking research. Your work will contribute to building more trustworthy generative AI systems, with the potential to revolutionize healthcare, transportation, and other critical areas of our society.


**About us**  

The Department of Computer Science and Engineering at Chalmers University of Technology and the University of Gothenburg, Sweden, is a globally recognized institution, home to approximately 270 employees from over 30 countries. We are known for our excellence in research and education.



This PhD position is based at the Division of Interaction Design and Software Engineering, with Chalmers University of Technology as the employer. Our division is a leader in research and education on complex, software-intensive systems, with strong international collaborations and close ties to the local industry. With around 50 researchers—including PhD students, postdocs, and faculty at all levels—we are one of the largest academic software engineering research groups worldwide. Our core expertise spans AI Engineering, software testing, requirements engineering, behavioral software engineering, and automotive software engineering.


**About the research project**  

This project explores how neural-symbolic approaches can enhance the trustworthiness of generative AI models (e.g., Large Language Models (LLMs) and Vision-Language Models (VLMs)). We are looking for a motivated and driven PhD student to join our team, working in close collaboration with leading researchers across Europe.



Your research will focus on:


* Improving the safety and explainability of generative AI
* Integrating knowledge-based methods into fine-tuning AI models
* Designing monitors to filter inappropriate AI-generated outputs

The primary application area will be service robotics, particularly in elderly care. A research robot will be available at Chalmers to evaluate the developed concepts in real-world scenarios.  

  

**Who we are looking for**  

To qualify for third-cycle (PhD) studies, you must meet one of the following requirements:


* Hold a degree with at least 240 credits, including at least 60 credits at the second-cycle level
* Have acquired equivalent knowledge in some other way

Fluency in English (spoken and written) is required.



Further we believe that you will thrive in this role if you are:


* Driven by curiosity
* Independent and proactive in your work
* Empathetic, with high ethical standards
* Team-oriented, able to collaborate effectively in a multicultural research environment
* Possess strong analytical problem-solving skills


We strongly encourage applicants with early research experience in this field, demonstrated through publications or a strong Master’s thesis. Prior industry experience (e.g., as a software or AI engineer) is a plus.


#### **Assessment Criteria**
**The selection process will be based on:**


* Your CV and academic background
* Interviews
* A possible technical challenge, either as a take-home assignment or live test, where you demonstrate problem-solving and research reasoning skills

**What you will do**  

Your primary responsibility is to pursue doctoral studies within the scope of this project. This includes:


* Developing scientific concepts and conducting original research
* Communicating your results through academic articles and presentations  

  

The position generally also includes teaching at Chalmers' undergraduate level or performing other duties corresponding to 20 percent of working hours.

**Contract terms and what we offer**


* The PhD-positions are fully funded from the start.
* As a PhD student at Chalmers, you are an employee and enjoy all employee benefits. Read more about working at Chalmers and our benefits for employees.
* The position is limited to four years, with the possibility to teach up to 20%, which extends the position to five years.
* A dynamic and inspiring working environment in the coastal city of Gothenburg.
* A starting salary of 34,550 SEK per month (valid from May 25, 2025).


Chalmers is dedicated to improving gender balance and actively works with equality projects, such as the GENIE Initiative for gender equality and excellence. We celebrate diversity and consider equality and inclusion as fundamental aspects of all our activities.



If Swedish is not your native language, Chalmers offers Swedish courses to help you settle in.


**Discover more**  

Find more general information about doctoral studies at Chalmers here.


**Application procedure**  

*The application should be written in English be attached as PDF-files, as below. Maximum size for each file is 40 MB. Please note that the system does not support Zip files.*


* **CV:** *(Please name the document: CV, Family name)*
* **Personal letter**
* **Two references that we can contact**
* **Bachelor’s and, if available, master’s thesis together with the transcripts.**
* **Documents confirming your English proficiency: e.g.** TOEFL/IELTS test results, a course/project report written in English (if your bachelor’s/master’s thesis is not in English).


Use the button at the foot of the page to reach the application form.


**Please note:** The applicant is responsible for ensuring that the application is complete. Incomplete applications and applications sent by email will not be considered.


**Application deadline: March 15, 2025**


**For questions please contact:**



Assoc. Professor Chih-Hong Cheng (Chalmers PI; e-mail: chihhong@chalmers.se)



Assistant Professor Ilaria Torre (ilariat@chalmers.se)


**We look forward to your application!**

  

*\*\*\* Chalmers declines to consider all offers of further announcement publishing or other types of support for the recruiting process in connection with this position.* \*\*\*

  


*Chalmers University of Technology in Gothenburg conducts research and education in technology and natural sciences at a high international level. The university has 3100 employees and 10,000 students, and offers education in engineering, science, shipping and architecture.* *With scientific excellence as a basis, Chalmers promotes knowledge and technical solutions for a sustainable world. Through global commitment and entrepreneurship, we foster an innovative spirit, in close collaboration with wider society.*  

*Chalmers was founded in 1829 and has the same motto today as it did then: Avancez – forward.*

title: Server Engineer (Hybrid - Flexible Options)
description:
At Broadridge, we've built a culture where the highest goal is to empower others to accomplish more. If you’re passionate about developing your career, while helping others along the way, come join the Broadridge team.
A successful Server Engineer is responsible for the engineering and operational support of compute and storage equipment in Broadridge Data Centers. This role is critical in ensuring the seamless operation of servers, storage, and other IT infrastructure that supports business-critical applications and services.
Key Responsibilities:* Installation and Maintenance:
	+ Install, configure, and maintain servers, storage devices
	+ Perform routine maintenance tasks such as software installation / removal, configuration changes, vulnerability management.
* Monitoring and Diagnostics:
	+ Monitor system performance, capacity, and availability using various tools and dashboards.
	+ Diagnose and resolve hardware and software issues, including server failures, network outages, or storage problems.
* Troubleshooting:
	+ Respond to alerts from monitoring systems in real-time to prevent or minimize downtime.
	+ Conduct root cause analysis for recurring issues to implement permanent fixes.
* Documentation:
	+ Maintain accurate documentation of infrastructure configurations, maintenance activities, and incident responses.
	+ Update operational procedures and system diagrams to reflect current states.
* Security Compliance:
	+ Participate in security audits and implement security measures as required.
* Emergency Response:
	+ Be available for emergency calls for critical system failures, which might include after-hours or weekend work on a rotation basis.
* Collaboration:
	+ Work closely with other IT teams, including network engineers, system administrators, and software developers.
	+ Coordinate with external vendors for equipment repairs or upgrades.
* Training and Development:
	+ Keep abreast of new technologies and methodologies in data center management.
	+ Participate in training sessions and might occasionally train new staff or interns.
* Data Center Management
	+ If needed, assist Data Center staff with racking / stacking or emergency response.


Basic Qualifications:* 5+ years in a similar role
* Ability to clearly communicate orally and in writing with engineers, vendors, managers, business, clients.
* Ability to write standard operating procedures, documentation, strategy documents and roadmaps
* Solid knowledge of VMware ESXi 7.x and 8.x, VMware, Red Hat Linux or Windows Server Operating systems
* Comfortable in several scripting languages (PowerShell, Python, Ruby, Go, etc).
* Understanding of SAN, multi-path and storage technologies
* Capacity Planning


Preferred Qualifications:* Good understanding of centralized configuration management, orchestration, and infrastructure as code techniques (Ansible or Chef, Terraform).
* Kubernetes and container platforms (Tanzu / Openshift)
* Experience with Observability / Monitoring tooling - Datadog, Splunk, ELK.
* Experienced on NSX-V & NSX-T implementation along with micro-segmentation.
* Certification of RHCE, MSCE / Azure Administrator, VCP or equivalent are advantageous.


#LI-Hybrid  

#LI-AC1  

Broadridge associates helped us envision our Connected Workplace - a work model that allows associates around the globe, dependent upon their role responsibilities, take advantage of the benefits of both on-site and off-site work to support our clients, one another, and the communities where we live and work. Our Connected Workplace is grounded in the concept of FACS: Flexible, Accountable, Connected, and Supported, which is our commitment to our associates. FACS supports our strong culture and allows us to achieve business goals while supporting meaningful work-life integration for our associates.  

  

We are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment and committed to providing a workplace that empowers associates to be authentic and bring their best to work. We believe that associates can only do their best when they feel safe, understood, and valued, and we work diligently and collaboratively to ensure Broadridge is a company—and ultimately a community—that recognizes and celebrates diversity in all its dimensions.

title: Manager Embedded Systems
description:
###### **Solna**


*Science Services Division is the part of SSC that develop scientific payloads, provide launch services for rockets and stratospheric balloons as well as services for testing of space systems and reusable rockets. Our customers are space organizations, scientists, corporations, and institutes of higher education. Payloads and Flight Systems department is a team of engineers mainly developing and launching scientific experiments and supportive systems for sounding rockets, balloons, and other space platforms. Projects for the team are typically short (1-2 years) and often run from initial study phases through development to actual launch and operations.*



Payloads & Flight Systems are introducing three sections for the main areas of disciplines within the team, Projects & Systems, Embedded Systems & Mechanical Systems. We are now looking for an experienced project manager or system engineer to shoulder the role of leading the Embedded Systems team of approximately 5-7 engineers.


**YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES**



You will be the operational manager for a small team of engineers with focus on development of embedded systems and other avionics and electronics. You will share your time between operational activities withing your area of expertise and managing the team. As a member of the Payloads & Flight Systems management team, you will report to the Manager of Payloads & Flight Systems.



In your management role you will be responsible for maintaining, develop and organize methodology and tools within the units’ operational disciplines and roadmaps. You will also in close collaboration with project management be responsible for planning the resources of your unit and providing projects with correct talent and solutions. Recruitment and personnel development is also a part of the task as well as work environment responsibility, as delegated.



The position includes work at our office and lab in Solna as well as business travel.



**WHO YOU ARE**



To thrive at this position, you are a mature and stable person enjoying responsibility and cooperating with engineers in all technical fields, to achieve goals. You have a holistic eye and are decisive when needed.



To enjoy the position as Manager for Embedded Systems you like working with creative people in an international setting. You have leadership experience of managing engineering teams in solving complex problems as line manager, project manager or system engineer. We believe you have a university degree in a technical field or equivalent work experience. We also believe you have knowledge and experience in space technology and sounding rocket payload engineering in particular. You technical expertise should be within the disciplines of embedded systems, software & electronics development.



Since you will work with both costumers and colleagues globally, you are proficient in English, both oral and in writing.



**WE OFFER YOU**


* a unique opportunity to be part of the exciting space industry
* an excellent opportunity for personal development and challenging tasks
* a workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and proud employees all over the world
* to be part of our team of talented engineers who works with important services so that Earth can benefit from space


**We are professionals in Space, here is a chance to become our new Star!**

Your experience together with your personal abilities will be critical to our success. If you have the right professional and individual skills, please don’t hesitate to send in your application already today!


**LOCATION**



The position is in our Solna location/Stockholm.


**NEXT STEP**



Are you interested in this challenging position within an international work environment in a successful company? Apply now! We evaluate all applications continuously. Please apply using your CV by clicking the apply button below.



This position requires a background control and security interview before employment.

title: Senior Automation Test Engineer
description:
##### **Project description**

Luxoft is a leading global software services company, delivering professional services across multiple business verticals such as finance, automotive, and digital transformation.  

  

The Automotive practice inside DXC Luxoft delivers SW projects to a majority of the world's car manufacturers and suppliers for both personal and commercial vehicles. We are known for our Automotive SW expertise and for helping our customers with high quality services and deliveries.  

Currently we are growing for our Swedish customers and are looking for Software Developers to join our team. You will be part of our growing organization in Sweden and will be part of developing next gen systems for the Automotive industry for the age of connected, autonomous, electric vehicles.  

  

Participate in the process of test system flow by defining test activities, equipment, asset under test and DUT (Device Under Test) preparedness together with requirement owner and suppliers.


##### **Responsibilities**


As a senior Test Automation Engineer at Luxoft you will be responsible for:


The ECU component verification, i.e. black and white box test, acceptance test and regression test on deliverables from supplier (both inhouse and external).


Automation of test cases in vTestStudio for Component-/Domain


and Complete testing in bench rig, HIL and on Vehicle. Test Cases to automate are from all functional areas.


Creating and maintain automation test framework in Python.


Testing methods & test case development, planning and coordination of test activities together with rest of the team.


Creating Fault reports and assign to receivers to investigate and create solutions.


Reviewing and communicating with suppliers' the test reports and results.


Independently take logs and measurement on the component and actuators and signals.


In collaboration with developer analyze logs to identify root cause of faults.


Ensuring the work is delivered as per specified acceptance criteria and definition.


Reading and analyzing from HIL's or other test set-ups.


Empowering close collaboration with team members within team and other teams.


Being self-organized and outspoken to support the team creating the best solutions.


##### **Skills**


Must have


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering or equivalent education.


At least 8 years of experience from manual and automated verification of automotive embedded software.


Programming knowledge in Python and exposure to C++.


Knowledge and understanding how to read electrical schematics, use of instruments such as voltmeters and oscilloscopes.


Experiences of the following tools is preferred: Requirement management tool, Vektor tools like Canalyzer/Canoe (both Hardware and software), Inca and DSA.


Fluent in English.


Swedish B-driver license.


Nice to have


HIL sanity test automation in CANoe (CAPL) or Robot Framework.


Vector tools knowledge.


DSPACE tools knowledge.


JavaScript expert competence.


Docker.


Ansible.


Git, Gerrit, Artifactory.


CI/CD mindset.


Passion for new technologies, software and hardware test and creating great user experiences.


Willing to take up the task that is most important for the team to progress.

Languages


English: C1 Advanced


Seniority


Senior


  
Goeteborg, Sweden

title: Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
Who Are We?
  
ADB SAFEGATE stands as a beacon of innovation in the aviation technology landscape. With a global footprint encompassing 48 offices and a dedicated team of 1400 employees, we are reshaping the future of airport operations. Our mission is to deliver cutting-edge solutions that elevate airport efficiency, safety, and sustainability worldwide. Our partnership with over 2,500 airports, including 47 of the top 50 busiest, underscores our commitment to fostering seamless travel experiences and pioneering the next wave of aviation advancements. Airside 4.0 orchestrates a roadmap to true airside digitalization, delivering a smarter, more harmonized airside that will allow airports to increase airside availability, recognize operational savings, support sustainability goals, and improve safety.
  
  

**The Opportunity:**  

We are seeking a meticulous and dedicated Quality Assurance Engineer with a strong background in embedded software and a keen interest in electronic components. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring the highest quality standards in our embedded software products, with a particular focus on the integration and functionality of electronic components. This role requires a blend of software testing expertise and a solid understanding of electronics to effectively identify, analyze, and resolve quality issues.
  
  

You will make an impact by...
  
  

**Embedded Software Testing:**  

Design, develop, and execute comprehensive test plans and test cases for embedded software systems.
  
Perform functional, regression, and performance testing to ensure software reliability and performance.
  
Utilize automated testing tools and frameworks to enhance testing efficiency.
  
  

**Electronic Component Integration:**  

Collaborate with hardware engineers to understand the integration of electronic components within the embedded system.
  
Test and validate the interaction between software and electronic components to ensure seamless functionality.
  
Identify and troubleshoot issues related to electronic components and their impact on software performance.
  
  

**Quality Assurance Processes:**  

Develop and maintain QA documentation, including test plans, test cases, and test reports.
  
Implement and adhere to QA processes and best practices to ensure consistent product quality.
  
Participate in code reviews and provide feedback to developers to improve code quality.
  
  

**Collaboration and Communication:**  

Work closely with cross-functional teams, including software developers, hardware engineers, and product managers, to ensure alignment on quality objectives.
  
Communicate effectively with stakeholders to provide updates on testing progress, issues, and resolutions.
  
Advocate for quality throughout the product development lifecycle.
  
  

The talent we want to inspire has...
  
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
  
Proven experience in quality assurance, particularly in testing embedded software systems.
  
Strong understanding of electronic components and their integration within embedded systems.
  
Experience with automated testing tools and frameworks.
  
Proficiency in programming languages such as C/C++, Python, or similar.
  
Familiarity with embedded systems development and debugging tools.
  
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  
Strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality products.
  
Effective communication and teamwork skills.
  
  

This would be a plus but not a must!
  
Experience with hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) testing.
  
Knowledge of industry standards and regulations related to embedded systems and electronic components.
  
  

Why join ADB SAFEGATE?
  
We value you and your contribution in the business. Recognizing and rewarding the impact you make is important to us.
  
In return, we offer a truly global environment with competitive salaries and benefits.
  
The opportunity to develop your career. We love to upskill and promote our staff; there's nothing better than to see someone gain a strong sense of pride and accomplishment.
  
A great flexible working culture with company values and behaviours that help shape your development and lead to success for you and the Company.
  
  

If you want to join a global business and enjoy being a team player who's driven and passionate, then this is your opportunity to come on board by applying!

title: Clinical Data Standards Lead
description:
Telescope Services har som konsultbolag sedan början av 2000-talet anställt och flyttat ingenjörer och specialister från hela världen till Sverige. Idag har vi circa 150 stycken utländska ingenjörer på konsultuppdrag hos flertalet av våra olika klienter. Vårt huvudkontor är placerat i Lund, men vi har rekryteringskontor i över 10 olika länder.
  
  

**Job Description:**  

You will be working in one of the teams in the software engineering department focusing on patient facing mobile and web application for clinical studies.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Develops and enforces clinical data standards (preferably pulmonary therapeutic area) to enhance the efficiency, productivity, and quality of clinical data deliverables. These standards encompass industry standards like the CDISC SDTM (Study Data Tabulation Model), and ADaM (Analysis Data Model).
* Strong technical expertise and experience in Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) principles and product management.


**Required skills & experience:**  

* 8 - 13 years of relevant experience in CDISC SDTM & ADaM.
* Advanced knowledge of clinical programming aspects of clinical research, data management, standards compliance methodologies, metadata management and data analysis
* Advanced knowledge of programming, analysis, and reporting or data collection standards
* Advanced knowledge of CDISC standards for the creation and maintenance of end-to-end standards from data collection to regulatory submission
* Advanced knowledge of all CDISC guidance documents and implementation guides
* Excellent written and oral communication skills, along with ability to present technical issues
* Advanced ability to work with management in the development and collection of metrics
* Advanced ability to collaborate with sponsors on standards implementations
* Demonstrated experience applying at least one data standard such as: CDASH, SDTM and ADaM
* Experience in generating Questionnaire Response Datasets like the QRS dataset.


**Desired skills & experience:**  

* Good knowledge of GCP / ICH guidelines
* Preferably, good knowledge of composite endpoint datasets consisting of multiple event types like Ashma and COPD.


Education/Experience
  
* 8-13 years of experience in Pharmaceutical industry
* Bachelor’s Degree


Please send Your CV to jobs@telescopeservices.se.

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
Are you a motivated and experienced Mechanical Engineer with a passion for contributing to an innovative, dynamic, and collaborative environment? Join our forward-thinking team at ASSA ABLOY Entrance Systems in Landskrona, Sweden. Be part of a supportive culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.  


**What you would do as our Mechanical Engineer**
You would leverage your expertise in mechanical design and engineering to develop and enhance overhead sectional door systems. You would work closely with our design, production, and installation teams to ensure our products consistently meet the highest standards of quality and performance.  


You would also:
* Conduct feasibility studies and cost analyses for proposed designs.
* Perform testing and validation of prototypes and final products.
* Identify and implement improvements to existing products and processes.
* Ensure compliance with industry standards and safety regulations.


This position offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to innovative solutions in a dynamic and collaborative environment.  


**The skills and experience you need**
We are looking for someone who has:
* A bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering or a related field, along with proven experience in mechanical design and engineering.
* Proficiency in CAD software, such as AutoCAD or SolidWorks.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken; knowledge of Swedish is an advantage.
* Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, as well as the capability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.

  


**What we offer**  


We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a successful career with us – here’s what we have to offer:  


* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* The opportunity to grow your skills in a versatile way and develop your career in a respected global group.
* Agile and innovative working environment.
* Motivated and encouraging team around you.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere.

  


**We review applications regularly, so don’t wait**
We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply.  


To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the recruitment process, please email Alexandra Kymäläinen, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at alexandra.kymalainen@assaabloy.com.  


Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to a background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.  

  

Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!  

  

To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com  


**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**  

Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.
#LI-GRR  

#LI-ZA1

title: Backend Engineer
description:
Vizrt One Media AB is seeking a full-time Software Engineer to join the Media Asset Management (MAM) business unit in the Stockholm office where you will be working with the platform team who go all-out to produce the broadcasting market's most competitive client facing applications, improving the daily work for TV anchors, journalists, editors, producers, operators, video editors and graphics artists around the world.
 



 We set clear goals, honor performance and celebrate success. You care about our business, our customers and your own personal growth and contribute with your innovation and ideas.
 



  





**About the role:** 



* You will work with the team to deliver container-based deployment and workflows for Viz One, our media asset management system.
* Collaborate with stake holders on Proof of Concepts (PoCs) to explore new ideas and technologies.
* Contribute to the development of new features and enhancements in existing products and components.
* Work with the team to gradually modernize and future proof our product codebases.
* Support professional services to deliver projects to our customers to meet established scope and deadlines.
* Develop and maintain test automation to validate software functionality.
* Identify performance bottlenecks and work with stakeholders to optimize software performance.
* Maintain and improve the quality of existing code








**Requirements:** 




  




* Experience with at least one high level programming language (e.g. Python, Perl) and/or one lower-level programming language (e.g. C++, Go).
* Experience with cloud services (AWS is ideal), containers, and/or Kubernetes.
* An understanding of AI products and features particularly in the areas of semantic search or video analysis.
* Knowledge of audio and video encoding is a plus.
* Experience with relational databases is a plus.
* Experience implementing RESTful API services is a plus.
* Experience of working in an agile/scrum environment



  





**Benefits:** 




 We offer an exciting position in an open and friendly environment where we help each other to develop and create value. Your work will have a true impact on Vizrt's future success.
 



  




* Work-Life balance as it plays an important role in generating long-lasting productivity and output

* The stories we tell are unique. We'd love to hear yours



  





**Recruitment Process:** 



* Recruiter Screening
* Team Interview
* Technical Discussion
* Final Interview

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.
   

  

 We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 As a Senior Software Engineer for Web Solutions, you will bring deep technical knowledge and experience into a team of software, test automation and quality assurance engineers. You will routinely collaborate with your peers booth within your own and other software teams to ensure adherence to common software development standards and practices. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Apply yourself to and drive software development efforts in our web-based solutions, in close collaboration with peers and team members.
* Take initiatives in how to best maintain any existing web-based products
* Take initiatives in building our new generation of web-based solutions
* Build a common understanding within the development team with regards to design patterns, software solution structures, dependencies and interfaces to other systems
* Take a leading role in the team’s planning and prioritization together with stakeholders
* Ensure software meets all requirements of quality, security, maintainability, extensibility etc


**What We're Looking For:**
* A bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field.
* 5+ years of experience with web-based and .NET-based backend systems.
* Proven ability to build, deliver, and maintain new and existing web solutions.
* Full-stack expertise, particularly in .NET and web development.
* Experience in designing and deploying full-stack web solutions, including installed applications.
* Familiarity with deployment platforms for web solutions and cloud-based operations (preferably Microsoft Azure).
* Strong knowledge of databases and modeling techniques.
* Understanding of software quality assurance principles.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Data Engineer in Fintech
description:
**About The Job**
 We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Engineer to join our tech development team. The role will primarily be focused on developing and maintaining data models for financial institutions, utilizing both relational and NoSQL technologies. In addition to data modeling, the role will involve maintaining and testing data pipelines to ensure the quality and maintainability of the data infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have a background in data engineering, preferably with experience in both relational and NoSQL databases, as well as a passion for delivering high-quality solutions.
   

  

 You will be a part of a fast-growing team that values cooperation and encourages individuals to take initiative in finding new solutions as well as evolving and improving current processes. We are a tight-knit team that likes to solve problems together and believes in the benefits of teamwork.
   

  

 As a Part Of The Team Working On Internal Tech Development, You Will Be Working On Tasks Such As, But Not Limited To
   

  

* Data engineering, including development and maintenance of data pipelines and ETL workflows.
* Develop and maintain data models for financial institutions using both relational and NoSQL technology.
* Maintain and test data pipelines to ensure the quality and maintainability of the data infrastructure.
* Collaborate with external stakeholders to develop and extend existing data models, enabling new use cases, regulations, and opportunities for analysis.
* Work in an agile and adaptable environment within a supportive team.


**Background And Experience**
* Bachelor’s or masters degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field.
* Experience in data engineering, with a focus on developing and maintaining data models.
* Preferably 1-4 years relevant work experience
* Proficiency in both relational and NoSQL databases, such as SQL, MongoDB, Cassandra, or similar.
* Live in, or adjacent to, the greater Stockholm metropolitan area. Candidates should be EU citizens or possess appropriate residency or work permits.
* Great interpersonal skills and excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.


**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a structured and analytical problem-solver with a keen eye for detail and a strong sense of ownership. You thrive in a data-driven environment, approaching challenges methodically and with a solutions-oriented mindset.
   

  

 Collaboration is key in our team, so we value excellent communication skills and the ability to explain complex technical concepts in a clear and concise manner. You should be comfortable working both independently and as part of a team, proactively sharing knowledge and supporting colleagues.
   

  

 A continuous improvement mindset is essential—whether it’s optimizing data pipelines, refining backend architecture, or staying up to date with new technologies. We appreciate a proactive attitude, curiosity, and a drive to create scalable, efficient, and secure solutions.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 We review applications continuously, so don’t wait—apply as soon as you’re ready! As long as the job posting is live, the position is still available. Our selection process is designed to highlight your strengths through steps such as work-related psychological assessments, business cases, interviews, and reference checks. We focus on competencies throughout the process and strive to make your experience as smooth as possible by keeping you informed and answering any questions you may have.
   

  

 To comply with GDPR regulations, we do not accept applications via email. Please submit your application through the official application portal.

title: Test & Verification Engineer-Stockholm (Onsite)
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a Test & Verification Engineer🚀**
**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden (Onsite)
   

  

**Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our Test & Verification Engineer**
**About VIPAS**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We at VIPAS AB are looking for a skilled
 **Test & Verification Engineer** 
 for client location Stockholm, on an exciting project. If you have experience in leading and performing tests on physical products and enjoy working closely with R&D teams, this opportunity is for you!
   

  

 As a
 **Test & Verification Engineer** 
 , you will be responsible for planning, coordinating, and executing verification tasks. You will determine the correct verification approach based on specific product requirements and ensure all test activities align with the highest quality standards. This role requires close collaboration with engineering teams across software, hardware, and mechanical domains.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Plan and implement verification tasks.
* Define appropriate verification approaches & consolidate them into a unified verification plan.
* Collaborate with engineering teams to analyze, perform, and interpret test results.
* Identify and execute tests for software, hardware, and mechanical functionality.
* Plan, book, and manage test activities at designated locations.
* Review and refine existing Design Verification Methods.
* Contribute to product quality improvements from a production perspective.


**Requirements**
* 3-5 years of experience in test & verification, automated testing.
* Engineering background with knowledge in software, hardware, and mechanical systems.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.
* Experience with automated testing.
* Strong collaboration and communication skills.
* Solution-oriented mindset with the ability to drive results.
* A proactive, structured, and adaptable approach.
* Valid driver's license (business trips may be required).


**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

**Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at sandhya@vipas.se / +46 720836371**
**Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.**
**How To Apply**
 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.
